by

CHAPTER 1

The sea - wind in [his]156-warburton hair , [his]156-warburton eyes agleam with the fresh memory of Alpine snows , [Will Warburton]156-warburton sprang out of [the cab]291-the cab , paid [the driver]292-the driver a double fare , flung on to [his]156-warburton shoulder a heavy bag and ran up , two steps at a stride , to [a flat on the fourth floor of [the many - tenanted building hard by [Chelsea Bridge]1-chelsea bridge]294-the many - tenanted building hard by chelsea bridge]293-a flat on the fourth floor of the many - tenanted building hard by chelsea bridge . [His]156-warburton rat - tat - tat brought to the door a thin yellow face , cautious in espial , through the narrow opening .

" Is it [you]156-warburton , [sir]2259-sir ? "[156-warburton]

" All right , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper ! How are [you]296-the woman ? how are [you]296-the woman ? "[156-warburton]

[He]156-warburton threw [his]156-warburton bag into [the passage]295-the passage , and cordially grasped [the woman]296-the woman 's hands .

" Dinner ready ? Savagely hungry . Give [me]156-warburton three minutes , and serve . "[156-warburton]

For about that length of time there sounded in [the bedroom]297-the bedroom a splashing and a blowing ; then [Warburton]156-warburton came forth with red cheeks . [He]156-warburton seized upon a little pile of letters and packets which lay on [his]156-warburton writing - table , broke envelopes , rent wrappers , and read with now an ejaculation of pleasure , now a grunt of disgust , and again a mirthful half roar . Then , dinner the feeding of [a famished man of robust appetite and digestion]298-a famished man of robust appetite and digestion , [a man three or four years on the green side of thirty]299-a man three or four years on the green side of thirty . It was a speedy business , in not much more than a quarter of an hour there disappeared a noble steak and its appurtenances , a golden - crusted apple tart , a substantial slice of ripe Cheddar , two bottles of creamy Bass .

" Now [I]159-will can talk ! "[159-will] cried [Will]159-will to [[his]159-will servant]300-his servant , as [he]159-will threw [himself]159-will into a deep chair , and began lighting [his]159-will pipe . " What 's the news ? [I]159-will seem to have been away three months rather than three weeks . "[159-will]

" [Mr. Franks]160-franks called yesterday , [sir]2259-sir , late in the afternoon , when [I]156-warburton was [here]2261-here cleaning . [He]160-franks was very glad to hear [you]2259-sir 'd be back to - day , and said [he]160-franks might look in to - night . "[156-warburton]

" Good ! What else ? "[159-will]

" [[My]156-warburton brother - in - law]2262-my brother - in - law wishes to see [you]2259-sir , [sir]2259-sir . [He]160-franks 's in trouble again lost [his]160-franks place at [Boxon 's]186-boxon a few days ago . [I]156-warburton do n't exac'ly know how it happened , but [he]160-franks 'll explain everything . [He]160-franks 's very unfortunate , [sir]2259-sir , is [Allchin]161-allchin . "[156-warburton]

" Tell [him]160-franks to come before nine to - morrow morning , if [he]160-franks can . "[159-will]

" Yes , [sir]2259-sir . [I]156-warburton 'm sure it 's very kind of [you]2259-sir , [sir]2259-sir . "[156-warburton]

" What else ? "[159-will]

" Nothing as [I]156-warburton can think of just now , [sir]2259-sir . "[156-warburton]

[Warburton]156-warburton knew from [the woman]296-the woman 's way of speaking that [she]296-the woman had something still in [her]296-the woman mind ; but [his]156-warburton pipe being well lit , and a pleasant lassitude creeping over [him]156-warburton , [he]156-warburton merely nodded . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper cleared the table , and withdrew .

The window looked across [the gardens of [Chelsea Hospital]3-chelsea hospital old - time [Ranelagh]4-ranelagh]302-the gardens of chelsea hospital old - time ranelagh to [the westward reach of [the river]304-the river]303-the westward reach of the river , beyond which lay [Battersea Park]5-battersea park , with [its]5-battersea park lawns and foliage . A beam of the July sunset struck suddenly through [the room]305-the room . [Warburton]156-warburton was aware of it with half - closed eyes ; [he]156-warburton wished to stir [himself]156-warburton , and look forth , but languor held [his]156-warburton limbs , and wreathing tobacco - smoke kept [his]156-warburton thoughts among [the mountains]306-the mountains . [He]156-warburton might have quite dozed off had not a sudden noise from within aroused [him]156-warburton the unmistakable crash of falling crockery . It made [him]156-warburton laugh , a laugh of humorous expostulation . A minute or two passed , then came a timid tap at [his]156-warburton door , and [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper showed [her]158-mrs. hopper face .

" Another accident , [sir]2259-sir , [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm sorry to say , "[158-mrs. hopper] were [her]158-mrs. hopper faltering words .

" Extensive ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" A dish and two plates , [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm sorry to say , [sir]2259-sir . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Oh , that 's nothing . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Of course [I]158-mrs. hopper shall make them good , [sir]2259-sir . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Pooh ! Are n't there plates enough ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Oh , quite enough just yet , [sir]2259-sir . "[158-mrs. hopper]

[Warburton]156-warburton subdued a chuckle , and looked with friendly smile at [[his]156-warburton domestic]307-his domestic , who stood squeezing [herself]307-his domestic between the edge of the door and the jamb [her]307-his domestic habit when embarrassed . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper had served [him]156-warburton for three years ; [he]156-warburton knew all [her]158-mrs. hopper weaknesses , but thought more of [her]158-mrs. hopper virtues , chief of which were honest intention and a moderate aptitude for plain cooking . A glance about [this room]308-this room would have proved to [any visitor]309-any visitor that [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper 's ideas of cleanliness were by no means rigid , [[her]158-mrs. hopper master]310-her master had made [himself]310-her master to a certain extent responsible for this defect ; [he]310-her master paid little attention to dust , provided that things were in [their]311-their wonted order . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper was not [a resident domestic]312-a resident domestic ; [she]158-mrs. hopper came at stated hours . Obviously [a widow]313-a widow , [she]158-mrs. hopper had a poor , loose - hung , trailing little body , which no nourishment could plump or fortify . [Her]158-mrs. hopper visage was habitually doleful , but contracted itself at moments into a grin of quaint drollery , which betrayed [her]158-mrs. hopper for something of [a humorist]314-a humorist .

" [My]158-mrs. hopper fingers is all gone silly to - day , [sir]2259-sir , "[158-mrs. hopper] [she]158-mrs. hopper pursued . " [I]158-mrs. hopper daresay it 's because [I]158-mrs. hopper have n't had much sleep these last few nights . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" How 's that ? "[156-warburton]

" It 's [[my]158-mrs. hopper poor sister]2273-my poor sister , [sir]2259-sir [[my]158-mrs. hopper sister]2275-my sister [Liza]162-liza , [I]158-mrs. hopper mean [she]2273-my poor sister 's had one of [her]2273-my poor sister worst headaches the extra special , [we]2276-we call ['em]2277-'em . This time it 's lasted more than three days , and not one minute of rest has [the poor thing]2278-the poor thing got . "[158-mrs. hopper]

[Warburton]156-warburton was all sympathy ; [he]156-warburton inquired about the case as though it were that of [an intimate friend]315-an intimate friend . Change of air and repose were obvious remedies ; no less obviously , these things were out of the question for [a working woman who lived on a few shillings a week]316-a working woman who lived on a few shillings a week .

" Do [you]158-mrs. hopper know of any place [she]2273-my poor sister could go to ? "[156-warburton] asked [Warburton]156-warburton , adding carelessly , " if the means were provided . "[156-warburton]

[Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper squeezed [herself]158-mrs. hopper more tightly than ever between door and jamb . [Her]158-mrs. hopper head was bent in an abashed way , and when [she]158-mrs. hopper spoke it was in a thick , gurgling tone , only just intelligible .

" There 's [a little lodging ' ouse at [Southend]6-southend]2279-a little lodging ' ouse at southend , [sir]2259-sir , where [we]2276-we used to go when [[my]158-mrs. hopper ' usband]2281-my ' usband could afford [it]2279-a little lodging ' ouse at southend . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Well , look here . Get [a doctor]2282-a doctor 's opinion whether [Southend]6-southend would do ; if not , which place would . And just send [her]2273-my poor sister away . Do n't worry about the money . "[158-mrs. hopper]

Experience enabled [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper to interpret this advice . [She]158-mrs. hopper stammered gratitude .

" How 's [[your]156-warburton other sister]2283-your other sister [Mrs. Allchin]161-allchin ? "[156-warburton] [Warburton]156-warburton inquired kindly .

" Why , [sir]2259-sir , [she]2283-your other sister 's doing pretty well in [her]2283-your other sister ' ealth , [sir]2259-sir , but [[her]2283-your other sister baby]2286-her baby died yesterday week . [I]156-warburton hope [you]2259-sir 'll excuse [me]156-warburton , [sir]2259-sir , for all this bad news just when [you]2259-sir come back from [your]2259-sir holiday , and when it 's natural as [you]2259-sir do n't feel in very good spirits . "[156-warburton]

[Will]159-will had much ado not to laugh . On [his]159-will return from a holiday , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper always presumed [him]159-will to be despondent in view of the resumption of daily work . [He]159-will was beginning to talk of [Mrs. Allchin]161-allchin 's troubles , when at the outer door sounded a long nervous knock .

" Ha ! That 's [Mr. Franks]160-franks . "[158-mrs. hopper]

[Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper ran to admit [the visitor]317-the visitor .

CHAPTER 2

" [Warburton]156-warburton ! "[158-mrs. hopper] cried a high - pitched voice from [the passage]295-the passage . " Have [you]156-warburton seen The Art World ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

And there rushed into [the room]305-the room [a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty , [his]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty comely face glowing in excitement . With one hand [he]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty grasped [[his]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty friend]321-his friend 's , in the other [he]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty held out a magazine .

" [You]156-warburton have n't seen it ! Look here ! What d'you think of that , confound [you]156-warburton ! "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

[He]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty had opened the magazine so as to display an illustration , entitled " Sanctuary , "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty] and stated to be after a painting by [Norbert Franks]160-franks .

" Is n't it good ? Does n't it come out well ? deuce take [you]156-warburton , why do n't [you]156-warburton speak ? "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" Not bad for a photogravure , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton , who had the air of [a grave elder in the presence of this ebullient youth]322-a grave elder in the presence of this ebullient youth .

" Be hanged ! [We]2288-we know all about that . The thing is that it 's there . Do n't [you]156-warburton feel any surprise ? Have n't [you]156-warburton got anything to say ? Do n't [you]156-warburton see what this means , [[you]156-warburton old ragamuffin]2289-you old ragamuffin ? "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" Should n't wonder if it meant coin of the realm for [[your]156-warburton shrewd dealer]2290-your shrewd dealer . "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" For [me]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty too , [[my]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty boy]2291-my boy , for [me]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty too ! Not out of this thing , of course . But [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty 've arrived , [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty 'm lance , the way is clear ! Why , [you]156-warburton do n't seem to know what it means getting into The Art World . "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" [I]156-warburton seem to remember , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton , smiling , " that a month or two ago , [you]156-warburton had n't language contemptuous enough for this magazine and all connected with it . "[156-warburton]

" Do n't be [an ass]2292-an ass ! "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty] shrilled the other , who was all this time circling about [the little room]323-the little room with much gesticulation . " Of course [one]2293-one talks like that when [one]2293-one has n't enough to eat and ca n't sell a picture . [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty do n't pretend to have altered [my]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty opinion about photogravures , and all that . But come now , the thing itself ? Be honest , [Warburton]156-warburton . Is it bad , now ? Can [you]156-warburton look at that picture , and say that it 's worthless ? "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty never said anything of the kind . "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" No , no ! [You]156-warburton 're too deucedly good - natured . But [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty always detected what [you]156-warburton were thinking , and [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty saw it did n't surprise [you]156-warburton at all when [the Academy muffs]2295-the academy muffs refused it . "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

" There [you]156-warburton 're wrong , "[156-warburton] cried [Warburton]156-warburton . " [I]156-warburton was really surprised . "[156-warburton]

" Confound [your]156-warburton impudence ! Well , [you]156-warburton may think what [you]156-warburton like . [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty maintain that the thing is n't half bad . It grows upon [me]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty . [I]320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty see its merits more and more . "[320-a tall , auburn - headed young man of five - and - twenty]

[Franks]160-franks was holding up the picture , eyeing it intently . " Sanctuary "[160-franks] represented [the interior of [an old village church]325-an old village church]324-the interior of an old village church . On the ground against a pillar , crouched [a young and beautiful woman]326-a young and beautiful woman , [her]326-a young and beautiful woman dress and general aspect indicating the last degree of vagrant wretchedness ; worn out , [she]326-a young and beautiful woman had fallen asleep in a most graceful attitude , and the rays of a winter sunset smote upon [her]326-a young and beautiful woman pallid countenance . Before [her]326-a young and beautiful woman stood [the village clergyman]327-the village clergyman , who had evidently just entered , and found [her]326-a young and beautiful woman [here]2261-here ; [his]327-the village clergyman white head was bent in the wonted attitude of clerical benevolence ; in [his]327-the village clergyman face blended a gentle wonder and a compassionate tenderness .

" If that had been hung at [Burlington House]7-burlington house , [Warburton]156-warburton , it would have been the picture of the year . "[327-the village clergyman]

" [I]327-the village clergyman think it very likely . "[327-the village clergyman]

" Yes , [I]327-the village clergyman know what [you]156-warburton mean , [you]156-warburton sarcastic old ruffian . But there 's another point of view . Is the drawing good or not ? Is the colour good or not ? Of course [you]156-warburton know nothing about it , but [I]327-the village clergyman tell [you]156-warburton , for [your]156-warburton information , [I]327-the village clergyman think it 's a confoundedly clever bit of work . There remains the subject , and where 's the harm in it ? The incident 's quite possible . And why should n't [the girl]2296-the girl be good - looking ? "[327-the village clergyman]

" [Angelic]163-angelic ! "[327-the village clergyman]

" Well why not ? There are [girls with angelic faces]2297-girls with angelic faces . Do n't [I]327-the village clergyman know one ? "[327-the village clergyman]

[Warburton]156-warburton , who had been sitting with a leg over the arm of [his]156-warburton chair suddenly changed [his]156-warburton position .

" That reminds [me]156-warburton , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton said . " [I]156-warburton came across the Pomfrets in [Switzerland]8-switzerland . "[156-warburton]

" Where ? When ? "[327-the village clergyman]

" At [Trient]9-trient ten days ago . [I]156-warburton spent three or four days with [them]2298-them . Has n't [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan mentioned it ? "[156-warburton]

" [I]160-franks have n't heard from [her]164-miss elvan for a long time , "[160-franks] replied [Franks]160-franks . " Well , for more than a week . Did [you]160-franks meet [them]2298-them by chance ? "[160-franks]

" Quite . [I]156-warburton had a vague idea that [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets and [[their]165-the pomfrets niece]2299-their niece were somewhere in [Switzerland]8-switzerland . "[156-warburton]

" Vague idea ! "[329-the artist] cried [the artist]329-the artist " Why , [I]156-warburton told [you]160-franks all about it , and growled for five or six hours one evening here because [I]156-warburton could n't go with [them]2298-them . "[156-warburton]

" So [you]160-franks did , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton , " but [I]156-warburton 'm afraid [I]156-warburton was thinking of something else , and when [I]156-warburton started for [the Alps]10-the alps , [I]156-warburton had really forgotten all about it . [I]156-warburton made up [my]156-warburton mind suddenly , [you]160-franks know . [We]2300-we 're having a troublesome time in [Ailie Street]21-little ailie street , and it was holiday now or never . By the bye , [we]2300-we shall have to wind up . [Sugar]166-sugar spells ruin . [We]2300-we must get out of it whilst [we]2300-we can do so with a whole skin . "[156-warburton]

" Ah , really ? "[160-franks] muttered [Franks]160-franks . " Tell [me]160-franks about that presently ; [I]160-franks want to hear of [Rosamund]167-rosamund . [You]160-franks saw a good deal of [her]167-rosamund , of course ? "[160-franks]

" [I]329-the artist walked from [Chamonix]12-chamonix over [the Col de Balme]2301-the col de balme grand view of [Mont Blanc]13-mont blanc [there]2302-there ! " Yes , yes , so [he]2306-him is , "[329-the artist] muttered [the artist]329-the artist , absently . " But [Rosamund]167-rosamund was [she]167-rosamund enjoying [herself]167-rosamund ? "[329-the artist]

" [We]2307-we discussed [you]329-the artist , of course . [I]329-the artist forget whether [our]2307-we conclusion was favourable or not . "[329-the artist]

[The artist]329-the artist laughed , and strode about [the room]305-the room with [his]329-the artist hands in [his]329-the artist pockets .

" [You]160-franks know what ? "[329-the artist] [he]329-the artist exclaimed , seeming to look closely at a print on the wall . " [I]329-the artist 'm going to be married before the end of the year . On that point [I]329-the artist 've made up [my]329-the artist mind . [I]329-the artist went yesterday to see [a house at [Fulham Mrs. Cross 's]14-fulham mrs. cross 's]2308-a house at fulham mrs. cross 's , by the bye , it 's to let at Michaelmas , rent forty - five . All but settled that [I]329-the artist shall take it . Risk be hanged . [I]329-the artist 'm going to make money . Well , it 's too late to talk about that . And [I]329-the artist say , [old man]2310-old man , do n't take [my]329-the artist growl too literally . "[329-the artist]

" How 's ' [The Slummer]172-the slummer ' getting on ? "[156-warburton] asked [Warburton]156-warburton good - humouredly .

" Well , [I]329-the artist was going to say that [I]329-the artist shall have it finished in a few weeks . If [Blackstaffe]173-blackstaffe wants ' [The Slummer]172-the slummer ' [he]171-blackstaffe'll 'll have to pay for it . " Pooh ! "[329-the artist]

" Be poohed [yourself]2316-you ! "[329-the artist]

At this moment [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper entered with a lamp . There was a pause in the conversation . [Franks]160-franks lit a cigarette , and tried to sit still , but was very soon pacing the floor again . A tumbler of whisky and soda reanimated [his]160-franks flagging talk .

" No ! "[160-franks] [he]160-franks exclaimed . " [I]160-franks 'm not going to admit that ' Sanctuary ' is cheap and sentimental , and all the rest of it . The more [I]160-franks think about it , the more convinced [I]160-franks am that it 's nothing to be ashamed of . [People]2321-people have got hold of the idea that if a thing is popular it must be bad art . That 's all rot . [I]160-franks 'm going in for popularity . Look here ! Suppose that 's what [I]160-franks was meant for ? What if it 's the best [I]160-franks have in [me]160-franks to do ? Should n't [I]160-franks be [a jackass]2322-a jackass if [I]160-franks scorned to make money by what , for [me]160-franks , was good work , and preferred to starve whilst [I]160-franks turned out pretentious stuff that was worth nothing from [my]160-franks point of view ? "[160-franks]

" [I]156-warburton should n't wonder if [you]156-warburton 're right , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton reflectively . " In any case , [I]156-warburton know as much about art as [I]156-warburton do about the differential calculus . "[156-warburton]

And [he]329-the artist turned at once to another subject .

CHAPTER 3

The year was 1886 .

When at business , [Warburton]156-warburton sat in [a high , bare room]335-a high , bare room , which looked upon [little [Ailie Street]21-little ailie street , in [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel]336-little ailie street , in whitechapel ; the air [he]156-warburton breathed had a taste and odour strongly saccharine . If [his]156-warburton eye strayed to one of the walls , [he]156-warburton saw a map of [the West Indies]337-the west indies ; if to another , it fell upon a map of [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts ; if to the third , there was before [him]156-warburton a plan of [a sugar estate on [that little island]339-that little island]338-a sugar estate on that little island . Here [he]156-warburton sat for certain hours of the solid day , issuing orders to [clerks]340-clerks , receiving [commercial callers]341-commercial callers , studying trade journals in sundry languages often reading some book which had no obvious reference to the sugar - refining industry . It was not [Will]159-will 's ideal of life , but hither [he]159-will had suffered [himself]159-will to be led by circumstance , and [his]159-will musings suggested no practicable issue into a more congenial world .

The death of [[his]159-will father]342-his father when [he]159-will was sixteen had left [him]159-will with a certain liberty for shaping a career . What [he]156-warburton saw definitely before [him]156-warburton was a small share in [the [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts property of [Messrs. Sherwood Brothers]175-sherwood brothers]343-the st. kitts property of messrs. sherwood brothers , a small share in [the [London]18-london business of [the same firm]345-the same firm]344-the london business of the same firm , and a small sum of ready money these things to be [his]156-warburton when [he]156-warburton attained [his]156-warburton majority . [[[His]159-will mother]346-his mother and sister , who lived in [a little country house down in [Huntingdonshire]19-huntingdonshire]348-a little country house down in huntingdonshire]347-his mother and sister , who lived in a little country house down in huntingdonshire , were modestly but securely provided for , and [Will]159-will might have gone quietly on with [his]159-will studies till [he]159-will could resolve upon a course in life . But no sooner was [he]156-warburton freed from paternal restraint than [the lad]349-the lad grew restive ; nothing would please [him]156-warburton but an adventure in [foreign lands]350-foreign lands ; and when it became clear that [he]159-will was only wasting [his]159-will time at [school]351-school , [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton let [him]159-will go to [the West Indies]337-the west indies , where a place was found for [him]159-will in [the house of [Sherwood Brothers]175-sherwood brothers]353-the house of sherwood brothers . At [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts , [Will]159-will remained till [he]159-will was one - and - twenty . Long before that , [he]159-will had grown heartily tired of [his]159-will work disgusted with the climate , and oppressed with [home]354-home sickness , but pride forbade [him]159-will to return until [he]159-will could do so as [a free man]355-a free man .

One thing this apprenticeship to life had taught [him]159-will that [he]159-will was not made for subordination . " [I]159-will do n't care how poor [I]159-will am , "[159-will] thus [he]159-will wrote to [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother , " but [I]159-will will be [[my]159-will own master]2332-my own master . To be at [other people]2333-other people 's orders brings out all the bad in [me]159-will ; it makes [me]159-will sullen and bearish , and all sorts of ugly things , which [I]159-will certainly am not when [my]159-will true self has play . So , [you]346-his mother see , [I]159-will must find some independent way of life . If [I]159-will had to live by carrying round a Punch and Judy show , [I]159-will should vastly prefer it to making a large income as [[somebody]2334-somebody 's servant]2335-somebody 's servant . "[159-will]

Meanwhile , unfortunately for [a young man of this temperament]357-a young man of this temperament , [his]357-a young man of this temperament prospects had become less assured . There was perturbation in [the sugar world]358-the sugar world ; income from [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts and from [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel had sensibly diminished , and it seemed but too likely , would continue to do so . For some half - year [Will]159-will lived in [London]18-london , " looking about [him]159-will , "[159-will] then [he]159-will announced that [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood , at present [sole representative of [Sherwood Brothers]175-sherwood brothers]359-sole representative of sherwood brothers , had offered [him]159-will an active partnership in [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street , and that [he]159-will had accepted it . [He]159-will entered upon this position without zeal , but six months ' investigation had taught [him]159-will that to earn money without surrendering [his]159-will independence was no very easy thing ; [he]159-will probably might wait a long time before an opening would present itself more attractive than this at [the sugar - refinery]360-the sugar - refinery .

[Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood was a schoolfellow of [his]177-sherwood , but some two or three years older ; much good feeling existed between [them]361-them , [their]361-them tastes and tempers having just that difference in similarity which is the surest bond of friendship . Judged by [his]177-sherwood talk , [Sherwood]177-sherwood was all vigour , energy , fire ; [his]177-sherwood personal habits , on the other hand , inclined to tranquillity and ease [a great reader]362-a great reader , [he]177-sherwood loved the literature of romance and adventure , knew by heart authors such as [Malory]178-malory and [Froissart]179-froissart , had on [his]177-sherwood shelves all the books of travel and adventure [he]177-sherwood could procure . As [a boy]363-a boy [he]177-sherwood seemed destined to any life save that of humdrum commerce , of which [he]177-sherwood spoke with contempt and abhorrence ; and there was no reason why [he]177-sherwood should not have gratified [his]177-sherwood desire of seeing [the world]364-the world , of leading what [he]177-sherwood called " the life of [a man]2336-a man . "[177-sherwood] Yet here [he]177-sherwood was , sitting each day in [a counting - house in [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel]365-a counting - house in whitechapel , with nothing behind [him]177-sherwood but a few rambles on [the continent]366-the continent , and certainly with no immediate intention of going far afield . [[His]177-sherwood father]342-his father 's death left [him]177-sherwood in sole command of the business , and [his]177-sherwood reasonable course would have been to retire from it as soon as possible , for foreign competition was making itself felt in the English trade , and [many firms more solidly established than that in [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street]368-many firms more solidly established than that in little ailie street had either come to grief or withdrawn from the struggle . But [Godfrey]177-sherwood 's inertia kept [him]177-sherwood in the familiar routine , with day - to - day postponement of practical decision . When [Warburton]176-warburton came back from [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts , and [their]369-their friendship was renewed , [Godfrey]177-sherwood 's talk gave full play to [his]177-sherwood imaginative energies . Yes , yes , the refining business was at a bad pass just now , but this was only temporary ; [those firms that could weather the storm for a year or two longer would enter upon a time of brilliant prosperity]370-those firms that could weather the storm for a year or two longer would enter upon a time of brilliant prosperity . Was it to be supposed that [the Government]22-the government would allow [a great industry to perish out of mere regard for the fetish of Free Trade]371-a great industry to perish out of mere regard for the fetish of free trade ? [City men with first - hand information]372-city men with first - hand information declared that " measures "[372-city men with first - hand information] were being prepared ; in one way or another , the English trade would be rescued and made triumphant over [those bounty - fed foreigners]373-those bounty - fed foreigners .

" Hold on ? "[177-sherwood] cried [Sherwood]177-sherwood . " Of course [I]177-sherwood mean to hold on . There 's pleasure and honour in the thing . [I]177-sherwood enjoy the fight . [I]177-sherwood 've had thoughts of getting into Parliament , to speak for sugar . [One]2293-one might do worse , [you]2338-you know . There 'll be a dissolution next year , certain . First - rate fun , fighting a constituency . But in that case [I]177-sherwood must have [a partner]2339-a partner here why that 's an idea . How would it suit [you]2338-you ? Why not join [me]177-sherwood ? "[177-sherwood]

And so the thing came about . The terms which [Godfrey]177-sherwood offered were so generous that [Will]159-will had to reduce them before [he]159-will accepted : even thus , [he]159-will found [his]159-will income , at a stroke , all but doubled . [Sherwood]177-sherwood , to be sure , did not stand for Parliament , nor was anything definite heard about that sugar - protecting budget which [he]177-sherwood still believed in . In [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street business steadily declined .

" It 's a disgrace to [England]23-england ! "[177-sherwood] cried [Godfrey]177-sherwood . " Monstrous that not a finger should be lifted to save one of [[our]2340-our most important industries]2341-our most important industries . [You]159-will , of course , are free to retire at any moment , [Will]159-will . For [my]177-sherwood own part , here [I]177-sherwood stand , come what may . If it 's ruin , ruin let it be . [I]177-sherwood 'll fight to the last . [A man]2336-a man owes [me]177-sherwood ten thousand pounds . When [I]177-sherwood recover it , and [I]177-sherwood may any day [I]177-sherwood shall put every penny into the business . "[177-sherwood]

" Ten thousand pounds ! "[176-warburton] exclaimed [Warburton]176-warburton in astonishment . " A trade debt , do [you]177-sherwood mean ? "[176-warburton]

" No , no . [A friend of mine]2343-a friend of mine , [son of a millionaire , who got into difficulties some time ago , and borrowed of [me]177-sherwood to clear [himself]2343-a friend of mine]2344-son of a millionaire , who got into difficulties some time ago , and borrowed of me to clear himself . Good interest , and [principal safe as Consols]2345-principal safe as consols . In a year at most [I]177-sherwood shall have the money back , and every penny shall go into the business . "[177-sherwood]

[Will]159-will had [his]159-will private view of the matter , and not seldom suffered a good deal of uneasiness as [he]159-will saw the inevitable doom approach . But already it was too late to withdraw [his]159-will share from the concern ; that would have been merely to take advantage of [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's generosity , and [Will]159-will was [himself]159-will not less chivalrous . In [Godfrey]177-sherwood 's phrase , [they]374-we continued " to fight [the ship]2346-the ship , "[374-we] and perhaps would have held out to the moment of sinking , had not the accession of [the Liberals]375-the liberals to power in the spring of this present year caused [Sherwood]177-sherwood so deep a disgust that [he]177-sherwood turned despondent and began to talk of surrender to hopeless circumstance .

" It 's all up with [us]374-we , [Will]159-will . [This Government]2347-this government spells ruin , and will count [it]2348-it one of [its]2347-this government chief glories if [we]374-we come to grief . But , by Heaven , [they]374-we sha n't have that joy . [We]374-we 'll square up , quietly , comfortably , with dignity . [We]374-we 'll come out of this fight with arms and baggage . It 's still possible , [you]159-will know . [We]374-we 'll sell [the St. Kitts estate]2349-the st. kitts estate to [the Germans]180-the germans . [We]374-we 'll find some one to buy [us]374-we up here [the place]2350-the place would suit [a brewer]2351-a brewer . And then by [Jove]181-jove ! [we]374-we 'll make jam . "[177-sherwood]

" Jam ? "[177-sherwood]

" Is n't it an idea ? Cheap sugar has done for [the refiners]2352-the refiners , but it 's a fortune for the jam trade . Why not put all [we]374-we can realize into [a jam factory]2353-a jam factory ? [We]374-we 'll go down into [the country]2354-the country ; find [some delightful place where land is cheap]2355-some delightful place where land is cheap ; start [a fruit farm]2356-a fruit farm ; run up [a building]2357-a building . Does n't it take [you]159-will , [Will]159-will ? Think of going to business every day through lanes overhung with fruit - tree blossoms ! Better that than the filth and stench and gloom and uproar of [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel what ? [We]374-we might found [a village]2358-a village for [[our]374-we workpeople [the ideal village]2360-the ideal village]2359-our workpeople the ideal village , perfectly healthy , [every cottage]2361-every cottage beautiful . Eh ? What ? How does it strike [you]159-will , [Will]159-will ? "[177-sherwood]

" Pleasant . But the money ? "[177-sherwood]

" [We]374-we shall have enough to start ; [I]177-sherwood think [we]374-we shall . If not , [we]374-we 'll find [a moneyed man]2362-a moneyed man to join [us]374-we . "[177-sherwood]

" What about that ten thousand pounds ? "[177-sherwood] suggested [Warburton]156-warburton .

[Sherwood]177-sherwood shook [his]177-sherwood head .

" Ca n't get it just yet . To tell [you]159-will the truth , it depends on the death of [[the man]2363-the man 's father]2364-the man 's father . No , but if necessary , [some one]2365-some one will easily be found . Is n't the idea magnificent ? How it would rile [the Government]22-the government if [they]22-the government heard of it ! Ho , ho ! "[177-sherwood]

[One]2293-one could never be sure how far [Godfrey]177-sherwood was serious when [he]177-sherwood talked like this ; the humorous impulse so blended with the excitability of [his]177-sherwood imagination , that [people who knew [him]177-sherwood little and heard [him]177-sherwood talking at large]377-people who knew him little and heard him talking at large thought [him]177-sherwood something of a crack - brain . The odd thing was that , with all [his]177-sherwood peculiarities , [he]177-sherwood had many of the characteristics of [a sound man of business]378-a sound man of business ; indeed , had it been otherwise , the balance - sheets of [the refinery]379-the refinery must long ago have shown a disastrous deficit . As [Warburton]176-warburton knew , things had been managed with no little prudence and sagacity ; what [he]177-sherwood did not so clearly understand was that [Sherwood]177-sherwood had simply adhered to the traditions of [the firm]380-the firm , following very exactly the path marked out for [him]177-sherwood by [[his]177-sherwood father]342-his father and [[his]177-sherwood uncle]382-his uncle , [both notable traders]383-both notable traders . Concerning [Godfrey]177-sherwood 's private resources , [Warburton]176-warburton knew little or nothing ; it seemed probable that the elder [Sherwood]177-sherwood had left a considerable fortune , which [[his]177-sherwood only son]384-his only son must have inherited . No doubt , said [Will]159-will to [himself]159-will , this large reserve was the explanation of [[his]159-will partner]385-his partner 's courage .

So [the St. Kitts estate]2349-the st. kitts estate was sold , and , with all the deliberate dignity demanded by the fact that [the Government]22-the government 's eye was upon [them]387-them , [Sherwood Brothers]175-sherwood brothers proceeded to terminate [their]175-sherwood brothers affairs in [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel . In July , [Warburton]176-warburton took [his]177-sherwood three weeks ' holiday , there being nothing better for [him]177-sherwood to do . And among the letters [he]177-sherwood found on [his]177-sherwood table when [he]177-sherwood returned , was one from [Sherwood]177-sherwood , which contained only these words :

" Great opportunity in view . [Our]175-sherwood brothers fortunes are made ! "[177-sherwood]

CHAPTER 4

When [Franks]160-franks was gone , [Warburton]176-warburton took up The Art World , which [[his]177-sherwood friend]321-his friend had left , and glanced again at the photogravure of " Sanctuary . "[177-sherwood] [He]177-sherwood knew , as [he]177-sherwood had declared , nothing about art , and judged pictures as [he]177-sherwood judged books , emotionally . [His]177-sherwood bent was to what is called the realistic point of view , and " Sanctuary "[177-sherwood] made [him]177-sherwood smile . But very good - naturedly ; for [he]177-sherwood liked [Norbert Franks]160-franks , and believed [he]160-franks would do better things than this . Unless ?

The thought broke off with an uneasy interrogative .

[He]177-sherwood turned to the few lines of text devoted to [the painter]389-the painter . [Norbert Franks]160-franks , [he]177-sherwood read , was still [a very young man]390-a very young man ; " Sanctuary , "[177-sherwood] now on exhibition at [Birmingham]25-birmingham , was [his]160-franks first important picture ; hitherto [he]160-franks had been chiefly occupied with work in black and white . There followed a few critical comments , and prophecy of achievements to come .

Yes . But again the uneasy interrogative .

[Their]391-their acquaintance dated from the year after [Warburton]176-warburton 's return from [St. Kitts]17-st. kitts . [Will]159-will had just established [himself]159-will in [[his]159-will flat near [Chelsea Bridge]1-chelsea bridge]392-his flat near chelsea bridge , delighted to be [a Londoner]393-a londoner , and was spending most of [his]159-will leisure in exploration of [[London]18-london 's vastness]394-london 's vastness . [He]159-will looked upon all [his]159-will earlier years as wasted , because they had not been passed in [the city]395-the city on [the Thames]26-the thames . The history of [London]18-london , the multitudinous life of [London]18-london as it lay about [him]159-will , with marvels and mysteries in [every highway and byway]396-every highway and byway , occupied [his]159-will mind , and wrought upon [his]159-will imagination . Being [a stout walker]397-a stout walker , and caring little for any other form of exercise , in [his]159-will free hours [he]159-will covered many a league of pavement . A fine summer morning would see [him]159-will set forth , long before milk - carts had begun to rattle along [the streets]398-the streets , and on one such expedition , as [he]159-will stepped briskly through [a poor district south of [the river]304-the river]399-a poor district south of the river , [he]159-will was surprised to see [an artist]401-an artist at work , painting seriously , [his]401-an artist easel in the dry gutter . [He]159-will slackened [his]159-will pace to have a glimpse of the canvas , and [the painter]389-the painter , [a young , pleasant - looking fellow]403-a young , pleasant - looking fellow , turned round and asked if [he]159-will had a match . Able to supply this demand , [Warburton]176-warburton talked whilst [the other]404-the other relit [his]404-the other pipe . It rejoiced [him]159-will , [he]159-will said , to see [a painter engaged upon such a subject]405-a painter engaged upon such a subject as this a bit of squalid [London]18-london 's infinite picturesqueness .

The next morning [Warburton]176-warburton took the same walk , and again found [the painter]389-the painter at work . [They]407-they talked freely ; [they]407-they exchanged invitations ; and that same evening [Norbert Franks]160-franks climbed the staircase to [[Will]159-will 's flat]408-will 's flat , and smoked [his]160-franks first pipe and drank [his]160-franks first whisky - and - soda in [the pleasant room overlooking [Ranelagh]4-ranelagh]409-the pleasant room overlooking ranelagh . [[His]160-franks own quarters]410-his own quarters were in [Queen 's Road]27-queen 's road , [Battersea]28-battersea , at no great distance . [The two young men]411-the two young men were soon seeing a great deal of [each other]412-each other . When [their]411-the two young men friendship had ripened through a twelvemonth , [Franks]160-franks , always impecunious , cheerily borrowed a five - pound note ; not long after , [he]160-franks mirthfully doubled [his]160-franks debt ; and this grew to a habit with [him]160-franks .

" [You]160-franks 're [a capitalist]2366-a capitalist , [Warburton]176-warburton , "[160-franks] [he]160-franks remarked one day , " and [a generous fellow]2367-a generous fellow , too . Excellent idea of [yours]160-franks to strike up a friendship , was n't it ? "[160-franks]

The benefit was reciprocal . [Warburton]176-warburton did not readily form intimacies ; indeed [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood had till now been almost [the only man [he]160-franks called [friend]414-friend]413-the only man he called friend , and the peculiarity of [his]177-sherwood temper exposed [him]177-sherwood to the risk of being too much alone . Though neither arrogant nor envious , [Will]159-will found little pleasure in the society of [people who , from any point of view , were notably [[his]159-will superiors]416-his superiors]415-people who , from any point of view , were notably his superiors ; even as [he]159-will could not subordinate [himself]159-will in money - earning relations , so did [he]159-will become ill - at - ease , lose all spontaneity , in company above [his]159-will social or intellectual level . [Such a man]417-such a man 's danger was obvious ; [he]417-such a man might , in default of [congenial associates]418-congenial associates , decline upon [inferiors]419-inferiors ; all the more that a softness of heart , a fineness of humanity , ever disposed [him]417-such a man to feel and show special kindness for [the poor]2324-the poor , [the distressed]421-the distressed , [the unfortunate]422-the unfortunate . [[Sherwood]177-sherwood 's acquaintances]423-sherwood 's acquaintances had little attraction for [him]417-such a man ; [they]423-sherwood 's acquaintances were mostly people who lived in a luxurious way , went in for sports , talked about the money market all of which things fascinated [Godfrey]177-sherwood , though in truth [he]177-sherwood was far from belonging by nature to [that particular world]424-that particular world . With [Franks]160-franks , [Will]159-will could be wholly [himself]159-will , enjoying the slight advantage of [his]159-will larger means , extending [his]159-will knowledge without undue obligation , and getting all the good that comes to [a man]2336-a man from the exercise of [his]159-will kindliest feelings .

With less of geniality , because more occupied with [himself]159-will , [Norbert Franks]160-franks resembled [[his]160-franks new friend]426-his new friend in a distaste for ordinary social pleasures and an enjoyment of the intimacies of life . [He]160-franks stood very much alone in [the world]364-the world , and from the age of eighteen [he]160-franks had in one way or another supported [himself]160-franks , chiefly by work on illustrated papers . [[His]160-franks father , who belonged to what is called [a good family]429-a good family]428-his father , who belonged to what is called a good family , began life in easy circumstances , and gained some reputation as [a connoisseur of art]430-a connoisseur of art ; imprudence and misfortune having obliged [him]428-his father , who belonged to what is called a good family to sell [his]428-his father , who belonged to what is called a good family collection , [Mr. Franks]160-franks took to buying pictures and bric - a - brac for profit , and during the last ten years of [his]428-his father , who belonged to what is called a good family life was associated in that capacity with [a [London]18-london firm]431-a london firm . [Norbert]160-franks , motherless from infancy and [an only child]432-an only child , received [his]160-franks early education at [expensive schools]433-expensive schools , but , showing little aptitude for study and much for use of the pencil , was taken by [[his]160-franks father]342-his father at twelve years old to [Paris]29-paris , and there set to work under [a good art - teacher]435-a good art - teacher . At sixteen [he]160-franks went to [Italy]30-italy , where [he]160-franks remained for a couple of years . Then , on a journey in [the East]31-the east , [the elder Franks]160-franks died . [Norbert]160-franks returned to [England]23-england , learnt that a matter of fifty pounds was all [his]160-franks heritage , and pluckily turned to the task of keeping [himself]160-franks alive . Herein [his]160-franks foreign sketch - books proved serviceable , but the struggle was long and hard before [he]160-franks could house [himself]160-franks decently , and get to serious work as [a painter]436-a painter . Later on , [he]160-franks was wo nt to say that this poverty had been the best possible thing for [him]160-franks , its enforced abstinences having come just at the time when [he]160-franks had begun to " wallow "[160-franks] [his]160-franks word for any sort of excess ; and " wallowing "[437-they] was undoubtedly a peril to which [Norbert]160-franks 's temper particularly exposed [him]160-franks . Short commons made [him]160-franks , as [they]437-they have made [many another youth]438-many another youth , sober and chaste , at all events in practice ; and when [he]160-franks began to lift up [his]160-franks head , a little ; when , at the age of three - and - twenty , [he]160-franks earned what seemed to [him]160-franks at first the luxurious income of a pound or so a week ; when , in short , the inclination to " wallow "[160-franks] might again have taken hold upon [him]160-franks , it was [his]160-franks chance to fall in love so seriously and hopefully that all the better features of [his]160-franks character were drawn out , emphasized , and , as it seemed , for good and all established in predominance .

Not long after [his]160-franks first meeting with [Warburton]176-warburton , [he]160-franks one day received , through the publishers of a book [he]160-franks had illustrated , a letter signed " [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret , "[439-the writer of which] [the writer of which]439-the writer of which asked whether " [Norbert Franks]160-franks "[439-the writer of which] was [the son of [an old friend of whom [he]160-franks had lost sight for many years]441-an old friend of whom he had lost sight for many years]440-the son of an old friend of whom he had lost sight for many years . Together or separately , [the two young men]411-the two young men were often to be seen at [Ashtead]32-ashtead , whither [they]411-the two young men were attracted not only by the kindly and amusing talk of [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret , but at least as much by the grace and sweetness and sympathetic intelligence of [the mistress of the house , for whom both entertained respect and admiration]447-the mistress of the house , for whom both entertained respect and admiration .

One Sunday afternoon , [Warburton]176-warburton , tempted as usual by the thought of tea and talk in [that delightful little garden]448-that delightful little garden , went out to [Ashtead]32-ashtead , and , as [he]160-franks pushed open the gate , was confused and vexed at the sight of [strangers]449-strangers ; there , before [the house]450-the house , stood [a middle - aged gentleman]451-a middle - aged gentleman and [a young girl]452-a young girl , chatting with [Mrs. Pomfret]168-mrs. pomfret . [He]160-franks would have turned away and taken [himself]160-franks off in disappointment , but that the clank of the gate had attracted attention , and [he]160-franks had no choice but to move forward . [The strangers]453-the strangers proved to be [[Mrs. Pomfret]168-mrs. pomfret 's brother]454-mrs. pomfret 's brother and [[his]454-mrs. pomfret 's brother daughter]455-his daughter ; [they]411-the two young men had been spending half a year in [the south of [France]34-france]456-the south of france , and were here for a day or two before returning to [[their]411-the two young men home at [Bath]35-bath]457-their home at bath . When [he]160-franks had recovered [his]160-franks equanimity , [Warburton]176-warburton became aware that [the young lady]458-the young lady was fair to look upon . [Her]458-the young lady age seemed about two - and - twenty ; not very tall , [she]458-the young lady bore [herself]458-the young lady with perhaps a touch of conscious dignity and impressiveness ; perfect health , a warm complexion , magnificent hair , eyes that shone with gaiety and good - nature , made of [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund a living picture such as [Will Warburton]176-warburton had not often seen ; [he]160-franks was shy in [her]458-the young lady presence , and by no means did [himself]160-franks justice that afternoon . [His]160-franks downcast eyes presently noticed that [she]458-the young lady wore shoes of a peculiar kind white canvas with soles of plaited cord ; in the course of conversation [he]160-franks learnt that these were a memento of [the Basque country]459-the basque country , about which [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan talked with a very pretty enthusiasm . [Will]159-will went away , after all , in a dissatisfied mood . [Girls]460-girls were to [him]159-will merely a source of disquiet . " If [she]458-the young lady be not fair for [me]159-will "[159-will] was [his]159-will ordinary thought ; and [he]159-will had never yet succeeded in persuading [himself]159-will that [any girl]461-any girl , fair or not , was at all likely to conceive the idea of devoting [herself]461-any girl to [his]159-will happiness . In this matter , an excessive modesty subdued [him]159-will . It had something to do with [his]159-will holding so much apart from [general society]462-general society .

CHAPTER 5

As [he]465-he sat musing , The Art World still in [his]465-he hand , [Warburton]176-warburton could hear [[his]465-he friend]321-his friend 's voice ring out that audacious vow . [He]465-he could remember , too , the odd little pang with which [he]465-he heard it , a half spasm of altogether absurd jealousy . Of course the feeling did not last . There was no recurrence of it when [he]465-he heard that [Franks]160-franks had again seen [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan before [she]164-miss elvan left [Ashtead]32-ashtead ; nor when [he]465-he learnt that [the artist]329-the artist had been spending a day or two at [Bath]35-bath . Less than a month after [their]468-their first meeting , [Franks]160-franks won [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's consent . [He]160-franks was frantic with exultation . Arriving with the news at ten o'clock one night , [he]160-franks shouted and maddened about [[Warburton]176-warburton 's room]469-warburton 's room until finally turned out at two in the morning . [His]160-franks circumstances being what they were , [he]160-franks could not hope for marriage yet awhile ; [he]160-franks must work and wait . Never mind ; see what work [he]160-franks would produce ! Yet it appeared to [[his]160-franks friend]321-his friend that all through the next twelvemonth [he]160-franks merely wasted time , such work as [he]160-franks did finish being of very slight value . [He]160-franks talked and talked , now of [Rosamund]167-rosamund , now of what [he]160-franks was going to do , until [Warburton]176-warburton , losing patience , would cut [him]160-franks short with " Oh , go to [Bath]35-bath ! "[176-warburton] an old ca nt phrase revived for its special appropriateness in this connection . [Franks]160-franks went to [Bath]35-bath far oftener than [he]160-franks could afford , money for [his]160-franks journey being generally borrowed from [[his]160-franks long - enduring friend]471-his long - enduring friend .

[Rosamund]167-rosamund [herself]167-rosamund had nothing , and but the smallest expectations should [[her]167-rosamund father]472-her father die . Two years before this , it had occurred to [her]167-rosamund that [she]167-rosamund should like to study art , and might possibly find in it a means of self - support . [She]167-rosamund was allowed to attend classes at [South Kensington]37-south kensington , but little came of this except a close friendship with [a girl of [her]167-rosamund own age]473-a girl of her own age , by name [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , who was following the art course with more serious purpose . When [she]167-rosamund had been betrothed for about a year , [Rosamund]167-rosamund chanced to spend a week in [London]18-london at [[[her]167-rosamund friend]474-her friend 's house]475-her friend 's house , and this led to acquaintance between [Franks]160-franks and [the Crosses]184-the crosses . For a time , [Warburton]176-warburton saw and heard less of [the artist]329-the artist , who made confidantes of [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross and [[her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter , and spent many an evening with [them]478-them talking , talking , talking about [Rosamund]167-rosamund ; but this intimacy did not endure very long , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross being [a person of marked peculiarities]479-a person of marked peculiarities , which in the end overtried [Norbert]160-franks 's temper . Only on the fourth story flat by [Chelsea Bridge]1-chelsea bridge could [the lover]480-the lover find that sort of sympathy which [he]480-the lover really needed , solacing yet tonic . But for [Warburton]176-warburton [he]480-the lover would have worked even less . To [Will]159-will it seemed an odd result of fortunate love that [the artist]329-the artist , though in every other respect [a better man than before]482-a better man than before , should have become , to all appearances , less zealous , less efficient , in [his]329-the artist art . Had [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund the right influence on [[her]167-rosamund lover]483-her lover ; in spite of [Norbert]160-franks 's lyric eulogy , had [she]167-rosamund served merely to confuse [his]329-the artist aims , perhaps to bring [him]329-the artist down to a lower level of thought ?

There was [his]329-the artist picture , " Sanctuary . "[329-the artist] Before [he]329-the artist knew [Rosamund]167-rosamund , [Franks]160-franks would have scoffed at such a subject , would have howled at such treatment of it . There was notable distance between this and what [Norbert]160-franks was painting in that summer sunrise four years ago , with [his]160-franks portable easel in the gutter . And [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan admired " Sanctuary "[164-miss elvan] at least , [Franks]160-franks said [she]164-miss elvan did . True , [she]164-miss elvan also admired the picture of [the pawnshop]484-the pawnshop and [the public - house]485-the public - house ; [Will]159-will had [himself]159-will heard [her]164-miss elvan speak of it with high praise , and with impatient wonder that [no purchaser]486-no purchaser could be found for it . Most likely [she]164-miss elvan approved of everything [Norbert]160-franks did , and had no more serious criterion . Unless , indeed , [her]164-miss elvan private test of artistic value were the financial result .

[Warburton]176-warburton could not altogether believe that . Annoyance with [the artist]329-the artist now and then inclined [him]329-the artist to slighting thought of [Rosamund]167-rosamund ; yet , on the whole , [his]329-the artist view of [her]167-rosamund was not depreciatory . The disadvantage to [his]329-the artist mind was [her]167-rosamund remarkable comeliness . [He]329-the artist could not but fear that so much beauty must be inconsistent with the sterling qualities which make [a good wife]488-a good wife .

[Will]159-will 's eye fell on [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's note , and [he]159-will went to bed wondering what the project might be which was to make [their]489-their fortune .

CHAPTER 6

[He]329-the artist had breakfasted , and was smoking [his]329-the artist pipe as [he]329-the artist wrote a letter , when [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper announced the visit , by appointment , of [[her]158-mrs. hopper brother - in - law]490-her brother - in - law , [Allchin]161-allchin . There entered [a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow , in a Sunday suit of respectable antiquity ; [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow features were rude , [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow aspect dogged ; but a certain intelligence showed in [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow countenance , and a not unamiable smile responded to the bluff heartiness of [Warburton]176-warburton 's greeting . By original calling , [Allchin]161-allchin was [[a grocer]492-a grocer 's assistant]493-a grocer 's assistant , but a troublesome temper had more than once set [him]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow adrift , [the outcast of grocerdom]494-the outcast of grocerdom , to earn a living as best [he]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow could by [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow vigorous thews , and it was in one of these intervals that , having need of [a porter]495-a porter at [the works]496-the works , [Warburton]176-warburton had engaged [him]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow , on [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper 's petition . Then , by good luck , [Allchin]161-allchin was enabled to resume [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow vocation ; [he]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow got a place at [[a grocer]492-a grocer 's in [Fulham Road]38-fulham road]503-a grocer 's in fulham road , and in a few weeks presented [himself]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow before [[his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow benefactor]504-his benefactor , bringing half - a - crown as a first instalment toward the discharge of [his]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow debt ; for only on this condition had [he]491-a short , sturdy , red - headed young fellow accepted the money . Half a year elapsed without troublesome incident ; [the man]2363-the man made regular repayment in small sums ; then came the disaster which [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper had yesterday announced .

" Well , [Allchin]161-allchin , "[176-warburton] cried [Warburton]176-warburton , " what 's the latest ? "[176-warburton]

Before speaking , [the other]404-the other pressed [his]404-the other lips tightly together and puffed out [his]404-the other cheeks , as if it cost [him]404-the other an effort to bring words to the surface . [His]404-the other reply came forth with explosive abruptness .

" Lost [my]404-the other place at [Boxon 's]186-boxon , [sir]2259-sir . "[404-the other]

" And how 's that ? "[404-the other]

" It happened last Saturday , [sir]2259-sir . [I]404-the other do n't want to make out as [I]404-the other was n't at all to blame . [I]404-the other know as well as [anybody]2377-anybody that [I]404-the other 've got a will of [my]404-the other own . But [we]2378-we 're open late , as perhaps [you]2259-sir know , [sir]2259-sir , on Saturday night , and [Mr. Boxon]186-boxon well , it 's only the truth [he]186-boxon 's never quite [himself]186-boxon after ten o'clock . [I]404-the other 'd worked from eight in the morning to something past midnight of course [I]404-the other do n't think nothing of that , 'cause it 's reg'lar in the trade . And so well , [sir]2259-sir , there was unpleasantness , as [they]2384-they say "[404-the other]

[He]507-he hesitated , [Warburton]176-warburton eyeing [him]507-he with a twinkle of subdued amusement .

" A quarrel , in fact , eh ? "[404-the other]

" It did about come to that , [sir]2259-sir ! "[404-the other]

" [You]2259-sir lost [your]2259-sir temper , of course . "[404-the other]

" That 's about the truth , [sir]2259-sir . "[404-the other]

" And [Boxon]186-boxon turned [you]2259-sir out ? "[404-the other]

[Allchin]161-allchin looked hurt .

" Well , [sir]2259-sir , [I]404-the other 've no doubt [he]507-he 'd have liked to , but [I]404-the other was a bit beforehand with [him]507-he . When [I]404-the other see [him]507-he last , [he]507-he was settin ' on the pavement , [sir]2259-sir , rubbin ' [his]507-he ' ead . "[404-the other]

CHAPTER 8

[Warburton]176-warburton often returned from [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel to [Chelsea]50-chelsea on foot , enjoying the long walk after [his]523-he day in [the office]524-the office . This evening , a heavily clouded sky and sobbing wind told that rain was not far off ; nevertheless , wishing to think hard , which [he]523-he could never do so well as when walking at a brisk pace , [he]523-he set off in the familiar direction a straight cut across [South London]51-south london .

In [Lower Kennington Lane]52-lower kennington lane [he]523-he stopped , as [his]523-he habit was , at [a little stationer 's shop]525-a little stationer 's shop , over which was the name [Potts]198-mr. potts . During [his]523-he last year in [the West Indies]53-the west indies , [he]523-he had befriended [an English lad whose health was suffering from the climate]526-an english lad whose health was suffering from the climate , and eventually had paid [his]523-he passage to [the United States]527-the united states , whither [the young adventurer]528-the young adventurer wished to go in pursuit of [his]523-he fortune . Not long after [he]523-he received a letter of thanks from [[the lad]349-the lad 's father]530-the lad 's father , and , on coming to [London]18-london , [he]523-he sought out [Mr. Potts]198-mr. potts , whose gratitude and its quaint expression had pleased [him]523-he . The acquaintance continued ; whenever [Warburton]176-warburton passed [the shop]2401-the shop [he]523-he stepped in and made purchases generally of things [he]523-he did not in the least want . [Potts]198-mr. potts had all the characteristics which were wo nt to interest [Will]159-will , and touch [his]159-will sympathies ; [he]198-mr. potts was poor , weak of body , humble - spirited , and of an honest , simple mind . Nothing more natural and cordial than [Will]159-will 's bearing as [he]159-will entered and held out [his]159-will hand to [the shopkeeper]532-the shopkeeper . How was business ? Any news lately from [Jack]199-jack ? [Jack]199-jack , it seemed , was doing pretty well at [Pittsburgh]54-pittsburgh ; would [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton care to read a long letter that had arrived from [him]199-jack a week ago ? To [his]159-will satisfaction , [Will]159-will found that the letter had enclosed a small sum of money , for a present on [the father]533-the father 's birthday . Having , as usual , laden [himself]159-will with newspapers , periodicals and notepaper , [he]159-will went [his]159-will way .

At grimy [Vauxhall]55-vauxhall [he]159-will crossed [the river]304-the river , and pursued [his]159-will course along [Grosvenor Road]56-grosvenor road . Rain had begun to fall , and the driving of the wind obliged [him]159-will to walk with the umbrella before [his]159-will face . Happening to glance ahead , when not far from [home]354-home , [he]159-will saw , at a distance of twenty yards , [a man whom [he]159-will took for [Norbert Franks]160-franks]536-a man whom he took for norbert franks . [The artist]329-the artist was coming toward [him]159-will , but suddenly [he]329-the artist turned round about , and walked rapidly away , disappearing in a moment down [a side street]538-a side street . [Franks]160-franks it certainly was ; impossible to mistake [his]160-franks figure , [his]160-franks gait ; and [Warburton]156-warburton felt sure that the abrupt change of direction was caused by [[his]156-warburton friend]321-his friend 's desire to avoid [him]159-will . At the end of [the byway]540-the byway [he]156-warburton looked , and there was [the familiar figure , marching with quick step into the rainy distance]541-the familiar figure , marching with quick step into the rainy distance . Odd ! but perhaps it simply meant that [Franks]160-franks had not seen [him]159-will .

[He]159-will reached [home]354-home , wrote some letters , made preparations for leaving [town]2424-town by [an early train]544-an early train next morning , and dined with [his]159-will customary appetite . Whilst smoking [his]159-will after - dinner pipe , [he]159-will thought again of that queer little incident in [Grosvenor Road]56-grosvenor road , and resolved of a sudden to go and see [Franks]160-franks . It still rained , so [he]159-will took advantage of [a passing hansom]545-a passing hansom , and drove in a few minutes to [[the artist]329-the artist 's lodging]547-the artist 's lodging on [the south side of [Battersea Park]5-battersea park]548-the south side of battersea park . The door was opened to [him]159-will by [the landlady , who smiled recognition]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition .

" No , [sir]2259-sir , [Mr. Franks]160-franks is n't at [home]354-home , and has n't been since after breakfast this morning . And [I]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition do n't understand it ; because [he]160-franks told [me]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition last night that [he]160-franks 'd be working all day , and [I]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition was to get meals for [him]160-franks as usual . And at ten o'clock [the model]2459-the model came that rough man [he]160-franks 's putting into the new picture , [you]2259-sir know , [sir]2259-sir ; and [I]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition had to send [him]160-franks away , when [he]160-franks 'd waited more than an hour . "[549-the landlady , who smiled recognition]

[Warburton]156-warburton was puzzled .

" [I]156-warburton 'll take [my]156-warburton turn at waiting , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton said . " Will [you]549-the landlady , who smiled recognition please light the gas for [me]156-warburton in [the studio]2461-the studio ? "[156-warburton]

[The studio]2461-the studio was merely , in lodging - house language , the first floor front ; [a two - windowed room , with the advantage of north light]551-a two - windowed room , with the advantage of north light . On the walls hung a few framed paintings , several unframed and unfinished , water - colour sketches , studies in crayon , photographs , and so on . In the midst stood the easel , supporting a large canvas , [the artist]329-the artist 's work on which showed already in a state of hopeful advancement . " [The Slummer]172-the slummer "[329-the artist] was [his]329-the artist provisional name for this picture ; [he]329-the artist had not yet hit upon that more decorous title which might suit the Academy catalogue . A glance discovered the subject . In [a typical London slum]553-a typical london slum , between [small and vile houses , which lowered upon the narrow way]554-small and vile houses , which lowered upon the narrow way , stood [a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman , obviously [a visitant from other spheres]556-a visitant from other spheres ; [her]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman one hand carried a book , and the other was held by [a ragged , cripple child]557-a ragged , cripple child , who gazed up at [her]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman with a look of innocent adoration . Hard by stood [a miserable creature with an infant at [her]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman breast]558-a miserable creature with an infant at her breast , [she]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman too adoring [the representative of health , wealth , and charity]559-the representative of health , wealth , and charity . Behind , [a costermonger]560-a costermonger , out of work , sprawled on the curbstone , viewing [the invader]561-the invader ; [he]329-the artist , with resentful eye , [his]329-the artist lip suggestive of words unreportable . Where the face of [the central figure]562-the central figure should have shone , the canvas still remained blank .

" [I]563-the landlady 'm afraid [he]329-the artist 's worried about [her]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman , "[563-the landlady] said [the landlady]563-the landlady , when [she]563-the landlady had lit the gas , and stood with [Warburton]156-warburton surveying the picture . " [He]329-the artist ca n't find [a model]2462-a model good - looking enough . [I]563-the landlady say to [Mr. Franks]160-franks why not make it the portrait of [[his]329-the artist own young lady]2463-his own young lady ? [I]563-the landlady 'm sure [she]555-a tall , graceful , prettily - clad young woman 's good - looking enough for anything and "[563-the landlady]

Whilst speaking , [the woman]296-the woman had turned to look at a picture on the wall . Words died upon [her]296-the woman lips ; consternation appeared in [her]296-the woman face ; [she]296-the woman stood with finger extended . [Warburton]156-warburton , glancing where [he]156-warburton was accustomed to see the portrait of [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund , also felt a shock . For , instead of the face which should have smiled upon [him]156-warburton , [he]156-warburton saw an ugly hole in the picture , the canvas having been violently cut , or rent with a blow .

" Hallo ! What the deuce has [he]329-the artist been doing ? "[563-the landlady]

" Well , [I]563-the landlady never ! "[563-the landlady] exclaimed [the landlady]563-the landlady . " It must be [himself]329-the artist that 's done it ! What does that mean now , [I]563-the landlady wonder ? "[563-the landlady]

[Warburton]156-warburton was very uneasy . [He]156-warburton no longer doubted that [Franks]160-franks had purposely avoided [him]156-warburton this afternoon .

" [I]156-warburton daresay , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton added , with a pretence of carelessness , " the portrait had begun to vex [him]329-the artist . [He]329-the artist 's often spoken of it discontentedly , and talked of painting another . It was n't very good . "[156-warburton]

Accepting , or seeming to accept this explanation , [the landlady]563-the landlady withdrew , and [Will]159-will paced thoughtfully about the floor . [He]159-will was back in [Switzerland]8-switzerland , in [the valley which rises to [the glacier of [Trient]9-trient]568-the glacier of trient]567-the valley which rises to the glacier of trient . Before [him]159-will rambled [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret and [[his]170-ralph pomfret wife]569-his wife ; at [his]159-will side was [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund , who listened with a flattering air of interest to all [he]159-will said , but [herself]167-rosamund spoke seldom , and seemed , for the most part , preoccupied with some anxiety . [He]159-will spoke of [Norbert Franks]160-franks ; [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan replied mechanically , and at once made a remark about [the landscape]570-the landscape . At the time , [he]159-will had thought little of this ; now it revived in [his]159-will memory , and disturbed [him]159-will .

An hour passed . [His]159-will patience was nearly at an end . [He]159-will waited another ten minutes , then left [the room]305-the room , called to [the landlady]563-the landlady that [he]159-will was going , and let [himself]159-will out .

Scarcely had [he]159-will walked half a dozen yards , when [he]159-will stood face to face with [Franks]160-franks .

" Ah ! Here [you]160-franks are ! [I]160-franks waited as long as [I]160-franks could "[160-franks]

" [I]329-the artist 'll walk with [you]160-franks , "[329-the artist] said [the artist]329-the artist , turning on [his]329-the artist heels .

[He]329-the artist had shaken hands but limply . [His]329-the artist look avoided [Warburton]156-warburton 's . [His]329-the artist speech was flat , wearied .

" What 's wrong , [Franks]160-franks ? "[329-the artist]

" As [you]160-franks 've been in [the studio]2461-the studio , [I]329-the artist daresay [you]160-franks know . "[329-the artist]

" [I]329-the artist saw something that surprised [me]329-the artist . "[329-the artist]

" Did it surprise [you]160-franks ? "[160-franks] asked [Norbert]160-franks , in a half - sullen undertone .

" What do [you]159-will mean by that ? "[159-will] said [Will]159-will with subdued resentment .

The rain had ceased ; a high wind buffeted [them]574-them as [they]574-them went along [the almost deserted street]575-the almost deserted street . The necessity of clutching at [his]329-the artist hat might have explained [Norbert]160-franks 's silence for a moment ; but [he]329-the artist strode on without speaking .

" Of course , if [you]160-franks do n't care to talk about it , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , stopping short .

" [I]160-franks 've been walking about all day , "[160-franks] [Franks]160-franks replied ; " and [I]160-franks 've got hell inside [me]160-franks ; [I]160-franks 'd rather not have met [you]160-franks to - night , that 's the truth . " Very much . What do [you]160-franks hint at ? "[160-franks]

" [I]160-franks had a letter this morning from [Rosamund]167-rosamund , saying [she]167-rosamund could n't marry [me]160-franks , and that all must be over between [us]2465-us . Does that surprise [you]160-franks ? "[160-franks]

[Franks]160-franks checked [his]160-franks step , just where the wind roared at an unprotected corner .

"[156-warburton]

" Very well . Good - night . "[160-franks]

This time [they]576-they did not shake hands . [Franks]160-franks turned abruptly , with a wave of the arm , and walked off unsteadily , like [a man in liquor]577-a man in liquor . Observing this , [Warburton]156-warburton said to [himself]156-warburton that not improbably [the artist]329-the artist had been trying to drown [his]160-franks misery , which might account for [his]160-franks strange delusion . Yet this explanation did not put [Will]159-will 's mind at ease . Gloomily [he]159-will made [his]159-will way homeward through the roaring night .

CHAPTER 9

Ten o'clock next morning saw [him]159-will alighting from [the train]579-the train at [St. Neots]49-st. neots . [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull was [a grey - headed man of threescore]585-a grey - headed man of threescore , much troubled with lumbago , which made [him]195-mr. turnbull stoop as [he]195-mr. turnbull walked . [He]159-will drove out of [the town]592-the town again , in a different direction , for about a mile . The question was answered by [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton [herself]176-warburton , who at that moment came forth from [the house]450-the house ; [a tall , graceful woman , prematurely white - headed , and enfeebled by ill - health]608-a tall , graceful woman , prematurely white - headed , and enfeebled by ill - health . It was only when all the sights of [the little garden]613-the little garden had been visited , [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton forgetting [her]176-warburton weakness as [she]176-warburton drew [Will]159-will hither and thither , that the business for which [they]614-they had met came under discussion . Discussion , indeed , it could hardly be called , for [the mother]615-the mother and [sister]2444-sister were quite content to listen whilst [Will]159-will talked , and accept [his]159-will view of things . Small as [their]614-they income was , [they]614-they never thought of [themselves]614-they as poor ; with [one maid - servant]617-one maid - servant and the occasional help of [a gardener]618-a gardener , [they]614-they had all the comfort [they]614-they wished for , and were able to bestow of [their]614-they superfluity in vegetables and flowers upon [less fortunate acquaintances]619-less fortunate acquaintances . Until a year or two ago , [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton had led a life of ceaseless activity , indoors and out ; such was the habit of [[her]176-warburton daughter]477-her daughter , who enjoyed vigorous health , and cared little for sedentary pursuits and amusements . [[Their]614-they property]621-their property , land and [cottages hard by]622-cottages hard by , had of late given [them]614-they a good deal of trouble , and the proposal to sell had more than once been considered , but [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull , most cautious of [counsellors]623-counsellors , urged delay . Now , at length , the hoped - for opportunity of a good investment seemed to have presented itself ; [Will]159-will 's sanguine report of what [he]159-will had learnt from [Sherwood]177-sherwood was gladly accepted .

" It 'll be a good thing for [you]159-will as well , "[202-jane] said [Jane]202-jane . " Yes , it comes just in time . " [I]176-warburton daresay [you]159-will had [your]159-will share in that , [Will]159-will , "[176-warburton] said [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton .

" A very small one ; [my]202-jane work has never been more than routine . [I]202-jane do n't pretend to be [a man of business]2483-a man of business .
