[House]2484-house after [house]2484-house has gone down ; [our]2486-we turn must have come very soon . As it is , [we]2486-we shall clear out with credit , and start afresh gloriously . By the bye , do n't get any but [Applegarth]193-applegarth 's jams in future . "[202-jane]

" That depends , "[202-jane] said [Jane]202-jane laughing , " if [we]2486-we like them . "[202-jane]

In [their]624-their simple and wholesome way of living , [the Warburtons of course]625-the warburtons of course dined at midday , and [Will]159-will , who rarely ate without appetite , surpassed [himself]159-will as [trencherman]626-trencherman ; nowhere had food such a savour for [him]159-will as under this roof . The homemade bread and home - grown vegetables [he]159-will was never tired of praising ; such fragrant and toothsome loaves , [he]159-will loudly protested , were to be eaten nowhere else in [England]23-england . [He]159-will began to talk of [his]159-will holiday abroad , when all at once [his]159-will countenance fell , [his]159-will lips closed ; in the pleasure of being " at [home]354-home , "[159-will] [he]159-will had forgotten all about [Norbert Franks]160-franks , and very unwelcome were the thoughts which attached themselves to this recollection of [his]159-will days at [Trient]9-trient .

" What 's the matter ? "[202-jane] asked [Jane]202-jane , noticing [his]159-will change of look .

" Oh , nothing a stupid affair . [I]202-jane wrote to [you]159-will about [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets and [[their]165-the pomfrets niece]2299-their niece . " Oh ! "[202-jane] exclaimed both the ladies , who had been interested in [the artist]329-the artist 's love story , as narrated to [them]628-them , rather badly , by [Will]159-will on former occasions .

" But [you]159-will gave [us]2491-us quite another idea of [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan , "[346-his mother] said [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother .

" Yes , [I]202-jane daresay [I]202-jane did . Who knows ? [I]202-jane do n't pretend to understand such things . "[202-jane]

A little before sunset came [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull , who took supper at [The Haws]59-the haws , and was fetched away by [[his]195-mr. turnbull coachman]630-his coachman at ten o'clock . With [this old friend]631-this old friend , who in [Will]159-will 's eyes looked no older now than when [he]159-will first knew [him]159-will in early childhood , [they]632-they talked freely of the Applegarth business , and [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull promised to make inquiries at once . Of course , [he]159-will took a despondent view of [jam]197-jam . [Jam]197-jam , [he]159-will inclined to think , was being overdone ; after all , [the country]2354-the country could consume only a certain quantity of even the most wholesome preserves , and a glut of jam already threatened the market . [Applegarth]193-applegarth ? By the bye , did [he]159-will not remember proceedings in bankruptcy connected with that unusual name ? [He]159-will must look into the matter . And , talking about bankruptcy oh ! how bad [his]159-will lumbago was to - night ! poor [Thomas Hart]208-thomas hart , of [Three Ash Farm]634-three ash farm , was going to be sold up . [Dear]635-dear , [dear]635-dear ! On every side , look where [one]2293-one would , nothing but decline and calamity . What was [England]23-england coming to ? Day by day [he]159-will had expected to see the failure of [Sherwood Brothers]175-sherwood brothers ; how had [they]175-sherwood brothers escaped the common doom of [sugar refiners]638-sugar refiners ? Free trade , free trade ; all very fine in theory , but look at its results on corn and sugar . For [his]159-will own part [he]159-will favoured a policy of moderate protection .

All this was not more than [Will]159-will had foreseen . It would be annoying if [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull ultimately took an adverse view of [his]159-will proposal ; in that case , though [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother was quite free to manage [[her]346-his mother property]640-her property as [she]346-his mother chose , [Will]159-will felt that [he]159-will should hot venture to urge [his]159-will scheme against [the lawyer]588-the lawyer 's advice , and money must be sought elsewhere . A few days would decide the matter . As [he]159-will went [upstairs]642-upstairs to bed , [he]159-will dismissed worries from [his]159-will mind .

The old quiet , the old comfort of [home]354-home . Not a sound but that of pattering rain in the still night . As always , [the room]305-the room smelt of lavender , blended with that indescribable fragrance which comes of extreme cleanliness in [an old country house]645-an old country house . But for changed wall paper and carpet , everything was as [Will]159-will remembered it ever since [he]159-will could remember anything at all ; the same simple furniture , the same white curtains , the same pictures , the same little hanging shelf , with books given to [him]159-will in childhood . [He]159-will thought of [the elder brother who had died at [school]351-school]646-the elder brother who had died at school , and lay in [the little churchyard far away]648-the little churchyard far away . [His]159-will only dark memory , that of [the poor boy]649-the poor boy 's death after a very short illness , before that other blow which made [him]159-will fatherless .

The earlier retrospect was one of happiness unbroken ; for all childish sorrows lost themselves in the very present sense of peace and love enveloping those far - away years . [[His]159-will parents]650-his parents ' life , as [he]159-will saw it then , as in reflection [he]159-will saw it now , remained an ideal ; [he]159-will did not care to hope for [himself]159-will , or to imagine , any other form of domestic contentment . As [a child]651-a child , [he]159-will would have held nothing less conceivable than a moment 's discord between [father]652-father and [mother]2480-mother , and manhood 's meditation did but confirm [him]159-will in the same view .

The mutual loyalty of kindred hearts and minds that was the best life had to give . And [Will]159-will 's thoughts turned once more to [Norbert Franks]160-franks ; [he]160-franks , poor fellow , doubtless now raging against the faithlessness which had blackened all [his]160-franks sky . In this moment of softened feeling , of lucid calm , [Warburton]176-warburton saw [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's behaviour in a new light . Perhaps [she]167-rosamund was not blameworthy at all , but rather deserving of all praise ; for , if [she]167-rosamund had come to know , beyond doubt , that [she]167-rosamund did not love [Norbert Franks]160-franks as [she]167-rosamund had thought , then to break the engagement was [her]167-rosamund simple duty , and the courage with which [she]167-rosamund had taken this step must be set to [her]167-rosamund credit . Naturally , it would be some time before [Franks]160-franks [himself]160-franks took that view . [A third person]654-a third person , whose vanity was not concerned , might moralise thus

[Will]159-will checked [himself]159-will on an unpleasant thought . Was [his]159-will vanity , in truth , unconcerned in this story ? Why , then , had [he]159-will been conscious of a sub - emotion , quite unavowable , which contradicted [his]159-will indignant sympathy during that talk last night in [the street]655-the street ? If [the lover]480-the lover 's jealousy were as ridiculous as [he]159-will pretended , why did [he]159-will feel what now [he]159-will could confess to [himself]159-will was an unworthy titillation , when [Franks]160-franks seemed to accuse [him]159-will of some part in [the girl]2296-the girl 's disloyalty ? Vanity , that , sure enough ; vanity of a very weak and futile kind . [He]159-will would stamp the last traces of it out of [his]159-will being . Happily it was but vanity , and no deeper feeling . Of this [he]159-will was assured by the reposeful sigh with which [he]159-will turned [his]159-will head upon the pillow , drowsing to oblivion .

One unbroken sleep brought [him]159-will to sunrise ; a golden glimmer upon the blind in [his]159-will return to consciousness told [him]159-will that the rain was over , and tempted [him]159-will to look forth . What [he]159-will saw was decisive ; with such a sky as that gleaming over [the summer world]658-the summer world , who could lie in bed ? [Will]159-will always dressed as if in a fury ; seconds sufficed [him]159-will for details of the toilet , which , had [he]159-will spent minutes over them , would have fretted [his]159-will nerves intolerably . [His]159-will bath was one wild welter not even the ceiling being safe from splashes ; [he]159-will clad [himself]159-will in a brief series of plunges ; [his]159-will shaving might have earned the applause of [an assembly gathered to behold feats of swift dexterity]659-an assembly gathered to behold feats of swift dexterity . Quietly [he]159-will descended the stairs , and found the house - door already open ; this might only mean that [the servant]660-the servant was already up , but [he]159-will suspected that [the early riser]661-the early riser was [Jane]202-jane . So it proved ; [he]159-will walked toward [the kitchen garden]662-the kitchen garden , and there stood [[his]159-will sister]663-his sister , the sun making [her]663-his sister face rosy .

" Come and help to pick scarlet runners , "[663-his sister] was [her]663-his sister greeting , as [he]159-will approached . " Are n't they magnificent ? "[663-his sister]

[Her]663-his sister eyes sparkled with pleasure as [she]663-his sister pointed to the heavy clusters of dark - green pods , hanging amid leaves and scarlet bloom .

" Splendid crop ! "[159-will] exclaimed [Will]159-will , with answering enthusiasm .

" Does n't the scent do one good ? "[663-his sister] went on [[his]159-will sister]663-his sister . " When [I]663-his sister come into [the garden]603-the garden on a morning like this , [I]663-his sister have a feeling oh , [I]663-his sister ca n't describe it to [you]663-his sister perhaps [you]663-his sister would n't understand "[663-his sister]

" [I]159-will know , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , nodding .

" It 's as if nature were calling out to [me]663-his sister , like [a friend]2493-a friend , to come and admire and enjoy what [she]202-jane has done . [I]663-his sister feel grateful for the things that [earth]2494-earth offers [me]663-his sister . "[663-his sister]

Not often did [Jane]202-jane speak like this ; as a rule [she]202-jane was anything but effusive or poetical . But a peculiar animation shone in [her]202-jane looks this morning , and sounded in [her]202-jane voice . Very soon the reason was manifest ; [she]202-jane began to speak of the Applegarth business , and declared [her]202-jane great satisfaction with it .

" There 'll be an end of [mother]2480-mother 's worry , "[202-jane] [she]202-jane said , " and [I]202-jane ca n't tell [you]663-his sister how glad [I]202-jane shall be . It seems to [me]202-jane that [women]2496-women ought n't to have to think about money , and [mother]2480-mother hates the name of it ; [she]2480-mother always has done . Oh , what a blessing when it 's all off [our]2498-our hands ! [We]2498-our should n't care , even if the new arrangement brought [us]2498-our less . "[202-jane]

" And it is certain to bring [you]202-jane more , "[159-will] remarked [Will]159-will , " perhaps considerably more . "[159-will]

" Well , [I]202-jane sha n't object to that ; there are lots of uses for money ; but it does n't matter . "[202-jane]

[Jane]202-jane 's sincerity was evident . [She]202-jane dismissed the matter , and [her]202-jane basket being full of beans , seized a fork to dig potatoes .

" Here , let [me]159-will do that , "[159-will] cried [Will]159-will , interposing .

" [You]202-jane ? Well then , as a very great favour . "[202-jane]

" Of course [I]202-jane mean that . It 's grand to turn up potatoes . What sort are these ? "[202-jane]

" Pink - eyed flukes , "[202-jane] replied [Jane]202-jane , watching [him]159-will with keen interest . " [We]665-they have n't touched them yet . "[202-jane]

" Mealy , eh ? "[202-jane]

" Balls of flour ! "[202-jane]

[Their]665-they voices joined in a cry of exultation , as the fork threw out even a finer root than [they]665-they had expected . When enough had been dug , [they]665-they strolled about , looking at other vegetables . [Jane]202-jane pointed to some Savoy seedlings , which [she]202-jane was going to plant out to - day . Then there sounded a joyous bark , and [Pompey]204-pompey came bounding toward [them]665-they .

" That means [the milk - boy]2499-the milk - boy is here , "[202-jane] said [Jane]202-jane . " [Pompey]204-pompey always goes to meet [him]2499-the milk - boy in the morning . Come and drink a glass warm . "[202-jane]

CHAPTER 10

Back at [Chelsea]50-chelsea , [Will]159-will sent a note to [Norbert Franks]160-franks , a line or two without express reference to what had happened , asking [him]160-franks to come and have a talk . Three days passed , and there was no reply . [Will]159-will grew uneasy ; for , though [the artist]329-the artist 's silence perhaps meant only sullenness , danger might lurk in [such a man]417-such a man 's thwarted passion . On the fourth evening , just as [he]159-will had made up [his]159-will mind to walk over to [Queen 's Road]27-queen 's road , the familiar knock sounded . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper had left ; [Will]159-will went to the door , and greeted [[his]159-will visitor]668-his visitor in the usual way . But [Franks]160-franks entered without speaking . The lamplight showed a pitiful change in [him]160-franks ; [he]160-franks was yellow and fishy - eyed , unshaven , disorderly in dress indeed , so well did [he]160-franks look the part of [the despairing lover]669-the despairing lover that [Warburton]176-warburton suspected a touch of theatric consciousness .

" If [you]160-franks had n't come to - night , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , " [I]159-will should have looked [you]160-franks up . "[159-will]

[Franks]160-franks lay limply in the armchair , staring blankly .

" [I]160-franks ought to have come before , "[160-franks] [he]160-franks replied in low , toneless voice . " That night when [I]160-franks met [you]160-franks , [I]160-franks made a fool of [myself]160-franks . For one thing , [I]160-franks was drunk , and [I]160-franks 've been drunk ever since . "[160-franks]

" Ha ! That accounts for [your]160-franks dirty collar , "[159-will] remarked [Will]159-will , in [his]159-will note of dry drollery .

" Is it dirty ? "[404-the other] said [the other]404-the other , passing a finger round [his]160-franks neck . " What does it matter ? A little dirt more or less , in a world so full of it "[404-the other]

[Warburton]176-warburton could not contain [himself]176-warburton ; [he]160-franks laughed , and laughed again . And [his]160-franks mirth was contagious ; [Franks]160-franks chuckled , unwillingly , dolefully .

" [You]160-franks are not extravagant in sympathy , "[329-the artist] said [the artist]329-the artist , moving with fretful nervousness .

" If [I]160-franks were , would it do [you]160-franks any good , [old fellow]2500-old fellow ? Look here , are [we]2501-we to talk of this affair or not ? Just as [you]160-franks like . " [You]160-franks think so ? "[160-franks] [Franks]160-franks sat a little straighter , but still with vacant eye . " Yes , not bad , [I]160-franks think . But who knows whether [I]160-franks shall finish the thing . "[160-franks]

" If [you]160-franks do n't , "[321-his friend] replied [[his]160-franks friend]321-his friend , in a matter - of - fact tone , " [you]160-franks 'll do something better . " [They]2503-they would n't hang it , and [nobody]2504-nobody would buy it . [He]321-his friend sprang up , and paced , as of old , about [the room]305-the room . [Will]159-will purposely kept silence .

" Quite the same ? "[160-franks]

[Warburton]176-warburton sat in meditation , only half smiling .

" Of course , [she]2507-her 's ashamed to face [me]674-i . [He]674-i took another turn across [the room]305-the room , then checked [himself]674-i before [Warburton]176-warburton .

CHAPTER 11

[The Crosses]184-the crosses , [mother]2480-mother and [daughter]678-daughter , lived at [Walham Green]60-walham green . [The house]450-the house was less pleasant than another which [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross owned at [Putney]61-putney , but it also represented a lower rental , and poverty obliged [them]676-their to take this into account . When [the second house]680-the second house stood tenantless , as had now been the case for half a year , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross ' habitually querulous comment on life rose to a note of acrimony very afflictive to [[her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter [Bertha]183-bertha . [The two]682-the two bore as little resemblance to [each other]412-each other , physical or mental , as [mother]2480-mother and [child]685-child well could . [Bertha Cross]183-bertha was [a sensible , thoughtful girl , full of kindly feeling]686-a sensible , thoughtful girl , full of kindly feeling , and blest with a humorous turn that enabled [her]183-bertha to see the amusing rather than the carking side of [her]183-bertha pinched life . These virtues [she]183-bertha had from [[her]183-bertha father]472-her father . Poor Cross , who supplemented a small income from office routine by occasional comic journalism , and even wrote a farce which brought money to [a theatrical manager]688-a theatrical manager , made on [his]472-her father deathbed a characteristic joke . [He]472-her father had just signed [his]472-her father will , and was left alone with [[his]472-her father wife]569-his wife . " [I]690-the afflicted woman 'm sure [I]690-the afflicted woman 've , always wished to make [your]472-her father life happy , "[690-the afflicted woman] piped [the afflicted woman]690-the afflicted woman . " And [I]472-her father yours , "[472-her father] [he]472-her father faintly answered ; adding , with a sad , kind smile , as [he]472-her father pointed to the testamentary document , " Take the will for the deed . "[472-her father]

[The two sons]691-the two sons had emigrated to [British Columbia]62-british columbia , and [Bertha]183-bertha would not have been sorry to join [[her]183-bertha brothers]692-her brothers [there]2302-there , for domestic labour on [a farm]694-a farm , in peace and health , seemed to [her]183-bertha considerably better than the quasi - genteel life [she]183-bertha painfully supported . [She]183-bertha had never dreamt of being [an artist]401-an artist , but , showing some facility with the pencil , was sent by [[her]183-bertha father]472-her father to [South Kensington]37-south kensington , where [she]183-bertha met and made friends with [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund . [Her]183-bertha necessity and [her]183-bertha application being greater than [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's , [Bertha]183-bertha before long succeeded in earning a little money ; without this help , life at [home]354-home would scarcely have been possible for [her]183-bertha . [They]698-they might , to be sure , have taken [a lodger]699-a lodger , having [spare rooms]700-spare rooms , but [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross could only face that possibility if [the person]701-the person received into [the house]450-the house were " respectable "[699-a lodger] enough to be called [a paying guest]703-a paying guest , and [no such person]704-no such person offered . So [they]698-they lived , as no end of " [respectable "[699-a lodger] families]2522-respectable " families do , a life of penury and seclusion , sometimes going without a meal that [they]698-they might have decent clothing to wear abroad , never able to buy a book , to hear a concert , and only by painful sacrifice able to entertain [a friend]2493-a friend . When , on a certain occasion , [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan passed a week at [[their]698-they house]706-their house [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross approved of this friendship , and hoped it might be a means of discovering [the paying guest]707-the paying guest , it meant for [them]698-they a near approach to starvation during the month that ensued .

Time would have weighed heavily on [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross but for [her]174-mrs. cross one recreation , which was perennial , ever fresh , constantly full of surprises and excitement . Poor as [she]174-mrs. cross was , [she]174-mrs. cross contrived to hire [a domestic servant]708-a domestic servant ; to say that [she]174-mrs. cross " kept "[2293-one] [one]2293-one would come near to a verbal impropriety , seeing that [no servant]710-no servant ever remained in [the house]450-the house for more than a few months , whilst it occasionally happened that the space of half a year would see [a succession of some half dozen " generals]2523-a succession of some half dozen " generals . "[2293-one] Underpaid and underfed , [these persons [they]712-these persons they varied in age from fourteen to forty varied in age from fourteen to forty]712-these persons they varied in age from fourteen to forty were of course incompetent , careless , rebellious , and [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross found the sole genuine pleasure of [her]174-mrs. cross life in the war [she]174-mrs. cross waged with [them]712-these persons they varied in age from fourteen to forty . Having no reasonable way of spending [her]174-mrs. cross hours , [she]174-mrs. cross was thus supplied with occupation ; being of acrid temper , [she]174-mrs. cross was thus supplied with a subject upon whom [she]174-mrs. cross could fearlessly exercise it ; being remarkably mean of disposition , [she]174-mrs. cross saw in the paring - down of [[her]174-mrs. cross servant]713-her servant 's rations to a working minimum , at once profit and sport ; lastly , being fond of the most trivial gossip , [she]174-mrs. cross had a never - failing topic of discussion with [such ladies as could endure [her]174-mrs. cross society]714-such ladies as could endure her society .

[Bertha]183-bertha , having been accustomed to this domestic turbulence all [her]183-bertha life long , for the most part paid no heed to it . [She]183-bertha knew that if the management of [the house]450-the house were in [her]183-bertha hands , instead of [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother 's , things would go much more smoothly , but the mere suggestion of such a change ventured once at a moment of acute crisis had so amazed and exasperated [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , that [Bertha]183-bertha never again looked in that direction . Yet from time to time a revolt of common sense forced [her]183-bertha to speak , and as the only possible way , if quarrel were to be avoided , [she]183-bertha began [her]183-bertha remonstrance on the humorous note . Then when [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother had been wearying [her]183-bertha for half an hour with complaints and lamentations over the misdoings of [one Emma]211-one emma , [Bertha]183-bertha as the alternative to throwing up [her]183-bertha hands and rushing out of [the house]450-the house , began laughing to [herself]183-bertha , whereat [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross indignantly begged to be informed what there was so very amusing in a state of affairs which would assuredly bring [her]183-bertha to [her]183-bertha grave .

" If only [you]174-mrs. cross could see the comical side of it , [mother]2480-mother , "[183-bertha] replied [Bertha]183-bertha . " It really has one , [you]174-mrs. cross know . [Emma]211-one emma , if only [you]174-mrs. cross would be patient with [her]211-one emma , is [a well - meaning creature]2525-a well - meaning creature , and [she]211-one emma says the funniest things . [I]183-bertha asked [her]211-one emma this morning if [she]211-one emma did n't think [she]211-one emma could find some way of remembering to put the salt on the table . And [she]211-one emma looked at [me]183-bertha very solemnly , and said , ' Indeed , [I]183-bertha will , [miss]2526-miss . [I]183-bertha 'll put it into [my]183-bertha prayers , just after ' [our]2527-our daily bread . ' "[183-bertha]

[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross saw nothing in this but profanity . [She]174-mrs. cross turned the attack on [Bertha]183-bertha , who , by [her]183-bertha soft way of speaking , simply encouraged [the servants]719-the servants , [she]174-mrs. cross declared , in negligence and insolence .

" Look at it in this way , [mother]2480-mother , "[2296-the girl] replied [the girl]2296-the girl , as soon as [she]2296-the girl was suffered to speak . " To be badly served is bad enough , in itself ; why make it worse by ceaseless talking about it , so leaving [ourselves]2527-our not a moment of peace and quiet ? [I]2296-the girl 'm sure [I]2296-the girl 'd rather put the salt on the table [myself]2296-the girl at every meal , and think no more about it , than worry , worry , worry over the missing salt - cellars from one meal to the next . Do n't [you]2480-mother feel , [dear mother]2529-dear mother , that it 's shocking waste of life ? "[2296-the girl]

" What nonsense [you]2480-mother talk , [child]685-child ! Are [we]2527-our to live in dirt and disorder ? Am [I]174-mrs. cross never to correct [a servant]2531-a servant , or teach [her]2531-a servant [her]2531-a servant duties ? But of course everything [I]174-mrs. cross do is wrong . Of course [you]2480-mother could do everything so very much better . That 's what [children]2532-children are nowadays . "[174-mrs. cross]

Whilst [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross piped on , [Bertha]183-bertha regarded [her]2296-the girl with eyes of humorous sadness . [The girl]2296-the girl often felt it a dreary thing not to be able to respect nay , not to be able to feel much love for [[her]2296-the girl mother]716-her mother . At such times , [her]2296-the girl thought turned to [the other parent , with whom , had [he]723-the other parent , with whom , had he and she been left alone and [she]2296-the girl been left alone]723-the other parent , with whom , had he and she been left alone , [she]2296-the girl could have lived so happily , in so much mutual intelligence and affection . [She]2296-the girl sighed and moved away .

[The unlet house]724-the unlet house was a very serious matter , and when one day [Norbert Franks]160-franks came to talk about it , saying that [he]160-franks would want [a house]725-a house very soon , and thought this of [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross 's might suit [him]160-franks , [Bertha]183-bertha rejoiced no less than [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother . In consequence of [the artist]329-the artist 's announcement , [she]183-bertha wrote to [[her]183-bertha friend]474-her friend [Rosamund]167-rosamund , saying how glad [she]167-rosamund was to hear that [her]167-rosamund marriage approached . The reply to this letter surprised [her]183-bertha . [Rosamund]167-rosamund had been remiss in correspondence for the last few months ; [her]167-rosamund few and brief letters , though they were as affectionate as ever , making no mention of what had formerly been an inexhaustible topic the genius , goodness , and brilliant hopes of [Franks]160-franks . Now [she]167-rosamund wrote as if in utter despondency , a letter so confused in style and vague in expression , that [Bertha]183-bertha could gather from it little or nothing except a grave doubt whether [Franks]160-franks ' marriage was as near as [he]160-franks supposed . A week or two passed , and [Rosamund]167-rosamund again wrote from [Switzerland]8-switzerland ; again the letter was an unintelligible maze of dreary words , and a mere moaning and sighing , which puzzled [Bertha]183-bertha as much as it distressed [her]183-bertha . [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's epistolary style , when [she]167-rosamund wrote to [this bosom friend]729-this bosom friend , was always pitched in a key of lyrical emotion , which now and then would have been trying to [Bertha]183-bertha 's sense of humour but for the sincerity manifest in every word ; hitherto , however , [she]167-rosamund had expressed [herself]167-rosamund with perfect lucidity , and this sudden change seemed ominous of alarming things . Just when [Bertha]183-bertha was anxiously wondering what could have happened , of course inclined to attribute blame , if blame there were , to [the artist]329-the artist rather than to [[his]329-the artist betrothed]731-his betrothed [a stranger]2438-a stranger came to inquire about [the house]450-the house to let . It was necessary to ascertain at once whether [Mr. Franks]160-franks intended to become [[their]734-we tenant]735-their tenant or not . [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross wrote to [him]160-franks , and received the briefest possible reply , to the effect that [his]160-franks plans were changed .

" How vexatious ! "[174-mrs. cross] exclaimed [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross . " [I]174-mrs. cross had very much rather have let to [people]2321-people [we]734-we know [I]174-mrs. cross suppose [he]160-franks 's seen [a house that suits [him]160-franks better]2534-a house that suits him better . "[174-mrs. cross]

" [I]183-bertha think there 's another reason , "[183-bertha] said [Bertha]183-bertha , after gazing for a minute or two at the scribbled , careless note . " The marriage is put off . "[183-bertha]

" And [you]183-bertha knew that , "[716-her mother] cried [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother , " all the time , and never told [me]716-her mother ! And [I]716-her mother might have missed twenty chances of letting . Really , [Bertha]183-bertha , [I]716-her mother never did see anything like [you]183-bertha . CHAPTER 12

There passed a fortnight . [Bertha]183-bertha heard nothing more of [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan , till a letter arrived one morning in an envelope , showing on the back an address at [Teddington]64-teddington . [Rosamund]167-rosamund wrote that [she]167-rosamund had just returned from [Switzerland]8-switzerland , and was staying for a few days with [friends]737-friends ; would it be possible for [Bertha]183-bertha to come to [Teddington]64-teddington the same afternoon , for an hour or two 's talk ? [Bertha]183-bertha took train early in the afternoon . " [I]183-bertha do n't know about that . Why should n't poor [Mr. Franks]160-franks have enough to eat it [he]2584-him can get it ? "[183-bertha]

" Well but [you]183-bertha promise to help [him]2584-him in the other way ? [You]183-bertha need n't say very bad things ; just a smile , a hint "[183-bertha]

" [I]183-bertha quite understand , "[183-bertha] said [Bertha]183-bertha , nodding .

CHAPTER 13

[Warburton]176-warburton had never seen [Godfrey]177-sherwood Sherwood so restless and excitable as during these weeks when the business in [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street was being brought to an end , and the details of the transfer to [Bristol]45-bristol were being settled . Had it not been inconsistent with all the hopeful facts of the situation , as well as with [the man]2363-the man 's temper , one would have thought that [Godfrey]177-sherwood suffered from extreme nervousness ; that [he]177-sherwood lived under some oppressive anxiety , which it was [his]177-sherwood constant endeavour to combat with resolute high spirits . It seemed an odd thing that [a man who had gone through the very real cares and perils of the last few years without a sign of perturbation , nay , with the cheeriest equanimity]755-a man who had gone through the very real cares and perils of the last few years without a sign of perturbation , nay , with the cheeriest equanimity , should let [himself]755-a man who had gone through the very real cares and perils of the last few years without a sign of perturbation , nay , with the cheeriest equanimity be thrown into disorder by the mere change to a more promising state of things . Now and then [Warburton]176-warburton asked [himself]176-warburton whether [[his]177-sherwood partner]385-his partner could be concealing some troublesome fact with regard to [Applegarth]193-applegarth 's concern ; but [he]177-sherwood dismissed the idea as too improbable ; [Sherwood]177-sherwood was far too good [a fellow]2512-a fellow , far too conscientious [a man of business]2483-a man of business , to involve [[his]177-sherwood friend]321-his friend in obvious risk especially since it had been decided that [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton 's and [her]176-warburton money should go into the affair . The inquiries made by [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull had results so satisfactory that even [the resolute pessimist]760-the resolute pessimist could not but grudgingly admit [his]760-the resolute pessimist inability to discover storm - signals . Though a sense of responsibility made a new element in [his]177-sherwood life , which would not let [him]177-sherwood sleep quite so soundly as hitherto , [Will]159-will persuaded [himself]159-will that [he]159-will had but to get to work , and all would be right .

The impression made upon [him]177-sherwood by [Applegarth]193-applegarth [himself]193-applegarth was very favourable . The fact that [the jam manufacturer]761-the jam manufacturer was [a university man]762-a university man , [an astronomer]2430-an astronomer , and [a musician]764-a musician , had touched [Warburton]176-warburton 's weak point , and [he]177-sherwood went down to [Bristol]45-bristol the first time with an undeniable prejudice at the back of [his]177-sherwood mind ; but this did not survive a day or two 's intercourse . [Applegarth]193-applegarth recommended [himself]193-applegarth by an easy and humorous geniality of bearing which [Warburton]176-warburton would have been [the last man to resist]765-the last man to resist ; [he]193-applegarth talked of [his]193-applegarth affairs with the utmost frankness .

" The astonishing thing to [me]193-applegarth is , "[193-applegarth] [he]193-applegarth said , " that [I]193-applegarth 've made this business pay . [I]193-applegarth went into it on abstract principle . [I]193-applegarth knew nothing of business . At [school]351-school , [I]193-applegarth rather think , [I]193-applegarth learnt something about ' single and double entry , ' but [I]193-applegarth had forgotten it all just as [I]193-applegarth find [myself]193-applegarth forgetting how to multiply and divide , now that [I]193-applegarth am accustomed to the higher mathematics . However , [I]193-applegarth had to earn a little money , somehow , and [I]193-applegarth thought [I]193-applegarth 'd try jam . And it went by itself , [I]193-applegarth really do n't understand it , mere good luck , [I]193-applegarth suppose . [I]193-applegarth hear of [fellows who have tried business]2587-fellows who have tried business , and come shocking [croppers]2588-croppers . [I]193-applegarth beg [your]2590-your pardon ; before saying that , [I]193-applegarth ought to have found out whether either of [you]2590-your is a classic . "[193-applegarth]

[The listeners]766-the listeners both shook [their]766-the listeners heads , and laughed .

" So much the better . [An astronomer]2430-an astronomer , it is plain , may manufacture jam ; [a fellow brought up on Greek and Latin verses]2592-a fellow brought up on greek and latin verses could n't possibly . "[766-the listeners]

[They]767-they were together at [Bristol]45-bristol for a week , then [Sherwood]177-sherwood received a telegram , and told [Warburton]176-warburton that [he]177-sherwood must return to [London]18-london immediately .

" Something that bothers [you]321-his friend ? "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , noting a peculiar tremor on [[his]159-will friend]321-his friend 's countenance .

" No , no ; a private affair ; nothing to do with [us]767-they . [You]321-his friend stay on till Saturday ? [I]159-will might be back in twenty - four hours . "[159-will]

" Good . Yes ; [I]177-sherwood want to have some more talk with [Applegarth]193-applegarth about that advertising proposal . [I]177-sherwood do n't like to start with quite such a heavy outlay . "[177-sherwood]

" Nor [I]177-sherwood either , "[177-sherwood] replied [Godfrey]177-sherwood , [his]177-sherwood eyes wandering . [He]177-sherwood paused , bit the end of [his]177-sherwood moustache , and added . " [I]177-sherwood believe so . Or early next week . "[177-sherwood]

" That 's right . [I]177-sherwood want to get done . Queer how these details fidget [me]177-sherwood . Nerves ! [I]177-sherwood ought to have had a holiday this summer . [You]177-sherwood were wiser . "[177-sherwood]

The next day [Warburton]176-warburton went out with [Applegarth]193-applegarth to [[his]193-applegarth house]769-his house some [ten miles south of [Bristol]45-bristol]770-ten miles south of bristol , and dined [there]2302-there , and stayed over night . " Oh , [Sherwood]177-sherwood looks far ahead . "[176-warburton]

[Applegarth]193-applegarth nodded , and for a minute or two each was occupied with [his]193-applegarth own reflections .

CHAPTER 14

[Godfrey]177-sherwood having telegraphed that [he]177-sherwood must remain in [town]2424-town , [Warburton]176-warburton soon joined [him]177-sherwood . [[His]177-sherwood partner]385-his partner was more cheerful and sanguine than ever ; [he]177-sherwood had cleared off numberless odds and ends of business ; there remained little to be done before the day , a week hence , appointed for the signature of the new deed , for which purpose [Applegarth]193-applegarth would come to [London]18-london . [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull , acting with [his]195-mr. turnbull wonted caution , had at length concluded the sale of [[Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton 's property]782-mrs. warburton 's property , and on the day after [his]177-sherwood return , [Will]159-will received from [St. Neots]49-st. neots a letter containing a cheque for four thousand pounds ! All [his]195-mr. turnbull own available capital was already in the hands of [Sherwood]177-sherwood ; a sum not much greater in amount than that invested by [[his]195-mr. turnbull mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister . [Sherwood]177-sherwood , for [his]177-sherwood part , put in sixteen thousand , with regrets that it was all [he]177-sherwood had at command just now ; before long , [he]177-sherwood might see [his]177-sherwood way greatly to increase [their]785-their capital , but [they]785-their had enough for moderate enterprise in the meanwhile .

Not half an hour after the post which brought [him]177-sherwood the cheque , [Warburton]176-warburton was surprised by a visit from [[his]177-sherwood friend]321-his friend .

" [I]177-sherwood thought [you]159-will would n't have left [home]354-home yet , "[177-sherwood] said [Godfrey]177-sherwood , with a nervous laugh . " [I]177-sherwood had a letter from [Applegarth]193-applegarth last night , which [I]177-sherwood wanted [you]159-will to see at once . "[177-sherwood]

[He]177-sherwood handed it , and [Will]159-will , glancing over the sheet , found only an unimportant discussion of a small detail .

" Well , that 's all right , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood said , " but [I]177-sherwood do n't see that it need have brought [you]159-will from [Wimbledon]67-wimbledon to [Chelsea]50-chelsea before nine o'clock in the morning . [Godfrey]177-sherwood looked it . [His]177-sherwood face was noticeably thinner than a month ago , and [his]177-sherwood eyes had a troubled fixity such as comes of intense preoccupation .

" Daresay [I]177-sherwood am , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood admitted with a show of careless good - humour . " Ca n't get much sleep lately . "[177-sherwood]

" No yes , [I]177-sherwood mean , yes , of course , long ago . "[177-sherwood]

[Will]159-will did not believe the corrected statement . [He]159-will gazed at [[his]159-will friend]321-his friend curiously and with some anxiety .

" It 's an unaccountable thing that [you]159-will should fret [your]159-will gizzard out about this new affair , which seems all so smooth , when [you]159-will took [the Ailie Street]21-little ailie street worries without turning a hair . "[159-will]

" Stupid nerves out of order , "[177-sherwood] muttered [Godfrey]177-sherwood , as [he]177-sherwood crossed , uncrossed , recrossed [his]177-sherwood legs , and bit at a cigar , as if [he]177-sherwood meant to breakfast on it . " [I]177-sherwood must get away for a week or two as soon as [we]2600-we 've signed . "[177-sherwood]

But [Will]159-will was only half satisfied .

" [You]404-the other have no doubts of [Applegarth]193-applegarth ? "[176-warburton]

" There was a pause . [Will]159-will glanced again at [Applegarth]193-applegarth 's note , whilst [Sherwood]177-sherwood went , as usual , to stand before the bookcase , and run [his]177-sherwood eye along the shelves .[176-warburton]

Nothing could be more unworthy than distrust of [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood ; nothing less consonant with all [his]159-will experience of [the man]2363-the man ; and , had the money been [his]159-will , [he]159-will would have handed it over as confidently as when , in fact , dealing with [his]159-will own capital the other day . [He]159-will , too , was perhaps a little overstrung in the nerves . Not for the first time , [he]159-will mentally threw a malediction at business , and all its sordid appurtenances .

A change came over [Sherwood]177-sherwood . [His]177-sherwood smile grew more natural ; [his]177-sherwood eye lost its fixity ; [he]177-sherwood puffed at [his]177-sherwood cigar with enjoyment .

" What news of [Franks]160-franks ? "[159-will] were [his]159-will next words .

"[159-will]

[They]792-they talked for a few minutes of business matters , and [Sherwood]177-sherwood briskly went [his]177-sherwood way .

Four days passed . [Warburton]176-warburton paid a visit to [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets , and had from [them]165-the pomfrets a confirmation of all [he]177-sherwood suspected regarding [Norbert Franks]160-franks . [The artist]329-the artist 's behaviour at [Ashstead]70-ashstead had been very theatrical indeed ; [he]329-the artist talked much of suicide , preferably by the way of drink , and , when dissuaded from this , with a burst of tears veritable tears begged [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret to lend [him]329-the artist money enough to go to [Cairo]71-cairo ; on which point , also , [he]329-the artist met with kindliest opposition . Thereupon , [he]329-the artist had raged for half an hour against [some treacherous friend]794-some treacherous friend , unnamed . Who this could be , [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets had no idea . [Warburton]176-warburton , though [he]177-sherwood affected equal ignorance , could not doubt but that it was [himself]177-sherwood , and [he]177-sherwood grew inwardly angry . [Franks]160-franks had been to [Bath]35-bath , and had obtained a private interview with [Winifred Elvan]214-winifred , in which [Winifred]214-winifred wrote to [[her]214-winifred aunt]795-her aunt [he]329-the artist had demeaned [himself]329-the artist very humbly and pathetically , first of all imploring [the sister]796-the sister 's help with [Rosamund]167-rosamund , and , when [she]214-winifred declared [she]214-winifred could do nothing , entreating to be told whether or not [he]329-the artist was ousted by [a rival]797-a rival . Rather impatient with [the artist]329-the artist 's follies than troubled about [his]329-the artist sufferings , [Will]159-will came [home]354-home again . [He]159-will wrote a brief , not unfriendly letter to [Franks]160-franks , urging [him]160-franks to return to [his]160-franks better mind the half - disdainful , half - philosophical resignation which [he]160-franks seemed to have attained a month ago . The answer to this was a couple of lines ; " Thanks . [Your]160-franks advice , no doubt , is well meant , but [I]159-will had rather not have it just now . Do n't let [us]2618-us meet for the present . "[159-will] [Will]159-will shrugged [his]159-will shoulders , and tried to forget all about the affair .

[He]159-will did not see [Sherwood]177-sherwood , but had a note from [him]177-sherwood written in high spirits . [Applegarth]193-applegarth would be in [town]2424-town two days hence , and [all three]801-all three were to dine at [[his]177-sherwood hotel]802-his hotel . Having no occupation , [Warburton]176-warburton spent most of [his]160-franks time in walking about [London]18-london ; but these rambles did not give [him]160-franks the wonted pleasure , and though at night [he]160-franks was very tired , [he]160-franks did not sleep well . An inexplicable nervousness interfered with all [his]160-franks habits of mind and body [He]160-franks was on the point of running down to [St. Neots]49-st. neots , to get through the last day of intolerable idleness , when the morning post again brought a letter from [Sherwood]177-sherwood .

" Confound [the fellow]2619-the fellow ! "[160-franks] [he]160-franks muttered , as [he]160-franks tore open the envelope . " What else can [he]2619-the fellow have to say ? No infernal postponement , [I]160-franks hope "[160-franks]

[He]160-franks read the first line and drew [himself]160-franks up like [a man pierced with pain]803-a man pierced with pain .

" [[My]385-his partner dear]2542-my dear [Warburton]176-warburton "[385-his partner] thus wrote [[his]160-franks partner]385-his partner , in a hand less legible than of wo nt " [I]385-his partner have such bad news for [you]176-warburton that [I]385-his partner hardly know how to tell it . If [I]385-his partner dared , [I]385-his partner would come to [you]176-warburton at once , but [I]385-his partner simply have not the courage to face [you]176-warburton until [you]176-warburton know the worst , and have had time to get accustomed to it . It is seven o'clock ; an hour ago [I]385-his partner learnt that all [our]2621-our money is lost all [yours]176-warburton , all that from [St. Neots]49-st. neots , all [mine]385-his partner every penny [I]385-his partner have . [I]385-his partner have been guilty of unpardonable folly how explain [my]385-his partner behaviour ? The truth is , after the settlement in [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street ; [I]385-his partner found [myself]385-his partner much worse off than [I]385-his partner had expected . [I]385-his partner went into the money market , and made a successful deal . Counting on being able to repeat this , [I]385-his partner guaranteed the sixteen thousand for [Bristol]45-bristol ; but the second time [I]385-his partner lost . So it has gone on ; all these last weeks [I]385-his partner have been speculating , winning and losing . Last Tuesday , when [I]385-his partner came to see [you]176-warburton , [I]385-his partner had about twelve thousand , and hoped somehow to make up the deficiency . As the devil would have it , that same morning [I]385-his partner met [a City acquaintance]2622-a city acquaintance , who spoke of a great coup to be made by [any one who had some fifteen thousand at command]2623-any one who had some fifteen thousand at command . It meant an immediate profit of 25 per cent . Like [a fool]2516-a fool , [I]385-his partner was persuaded as [you]176-warburton will see when [I]385-his partner go into details , the thing looked horribly tempting . [I]385-his partner put it all every penny that lay at [[our]2625-our bank]2626-our bank in the name of [Sherwood Bros.]72-sherwood bros. And now [I]385-his partner learn that [the house]450-the house [I]385-his partner trusted has smashed . It 's in the papers this evening [Biggles]218-biggles , [Thorpe]73-thorpe and [Biggles]218-biggles [you]176-warburton 'll see it . [I]385-his partner dare not ask [you]176-warburton to forgive [me]385-his partner . Of course [I]385-his partner shall at once take steps to raise the money owing to [you]176-warburton , and hope to be able to do that soon , but it 's all over with the [Bristol]45-bristol affair . [I]385-his partner shall come to see [you]176-warburton at twelve to - morrow .[385-his partner]

" [Yours]176-warburton , "[177-sherwood] G. F. [SHERWOOD]74-sherwood . "[177-sherwood]

CHAPTER 15

" After all , there 's something in presentiment . "[385-his partner]

This was the first thought that took shape in [Will]159-will 's whirling mind . The second was , that [he]159-will might rationally have foreseen disaster . All the points of strangeness which had struck [him]159-will in [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's behaviour came back now with such glaring significance that [he]159-will accused [himself]159-will of inconceivable limpness in having allowed things to go their way above all in trusting [Godfrey]177-sherwood with the St. Neots cheque . On this moment of painful lucidity followed blind rage . Why , what [a grovelling imbecile]805-a grovelling imbecile was [this fellow]806-this fellow ! To plunge into wild speculation , on the word of [some City shark]807-some city shark , with money not [his]806-this fellow own ! But could one credit the story ? Was it not more likely that [Sherwood]177-sherwood had got involved in some cunning thievery which [he]177-sherwood durst not avow ? Perhaps [he]177-sherwood was [a mere liar and hypocrite]808-a mere liar and hypocrite . That story of the ten thousand pounds [he]177-sherwood had lent to [somebody]2334-somebody how improbable it sounded ; why might [he]177-sherwood not have invented it , to strengthen confidence at a critical moment ? The incredible baseness of [the man]2363-the man ! [He]177-sherwood , who knew well all that depended upon the safe investment of the St. Neots money to risk it in this furiously reckless way . In all the records of City scoundrelism , was there a blacker case ?

Raging thus , [Warburton]176-warburton became aware that [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper spoke to [him]177-sherwood . [She]158-mrs. hopper had just laid breakfast , and , as usual when [she]158-mrs. hopper wished to begin a conversation , had drawn back to the door , where [she]158-mrs. hopper paused .

" That [Boxon]186-boxon , [the grocer]2628-the grocer , has had a bad accident , [sir]2259-sir . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" [Boxon]186-boxon ? [grocer]2630-grocer ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" In [the Fulham Road]38-fulham road , [sir]2259-sir ; [him]186-boxon as [Allchin]161-allchin was with . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Ah ! "[158-mrs. hopper]

Heedless of [[her]158-mrs. hopper master]310-her master 's gloomy abstraction , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper continued . [She]158-mrs. hopper related that [Boxon]186-boxon had been at certain races where [he]186-boxon had lost money and got drunk ; driving away in a trap , [he]186-boxon had run into something , and been thrown out , with serious injuries , which might prove fatal .

" So much the worse for [him]186-boxon , "[176-warburton] muttered [Warburton]176-warburton . " [I]176-warburton 've no pity to spare for [fools and blackguards]2632-fools and blackguards . "[176-warburton]

" [I]176-warburton should think not , indeed [sir]2259-sir . [I]176-warburton just mentioned it , [sir]2259-sir , because [Allchin]161-allchin was telling [us]2635-they about it last night . [He]2259-sir and [[his]2259-sir wife]569-his wife looked in to see [[my]176-warburton sister]2275-my sister , [Liza]162-liza , and [they]2635-they both said [they]2635-they never see such a change in [anybody]2377-anybody . And [they]2635-they said how grateful [we]2635-they ought to be to [you]176-warburton , [sir]2259-sir , and that [I]176-warburton 'm sure [we]2635-they are , for [Liza'd]219-liza'd never have been able to go away without [your]176-warburton kindness . "[176-warburton]

Listening as if this talk sounded from a vague distance , [Warburton]176-warburton was suddenly reminded of what had befallen [himself]176-warburton ; for as yet [he]812-he had thought only of [[his]812-he mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister . [He]812-he was ruined . Some two or three hundred pounds , [his]812-he private bank account , represented all [he]812-he had in [the world]364-the world , and all prospect of making money had been taken away from [him]812-he . Henceforth , small must be [his]812-he charities . If [he]812-he gained [his]812-he own living , [he]812-he must count [himself]812-he lucky ; nothing more difficult than for [a man of [his]812-he age and position , unexpectedly cut adrift , to find work and payment]816-a man of his age and position , unexpectedly cut adrift , to find work and payment . By good fortune , [his]812-he lease of [this flat]817-this flat came to an end at [Michaelmas]76-michaelmas , and already [he]812-he had given notice that [he]812-he did not mean to renew . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper knew that [he]812-he was on the point of leaving [London]18-london , and mot a little lamented it , for to [her]158-mrs. hopper the loss would be serious indeed . [Warburton]176-warburton 's habitual generosity led [her]158-mrs. hopper to hope for some signal benefaction ere [his]812-he departure ; perhaps on that account [she]158-mrs. hopper was specially emphatic in gratitude for [[her]158-mrs. hopper sister]818-her sister 's restoration to health .

" [We]2640-we was wondering , [sir]2259-sir , "[158-mrs. hopper] [she]158-mrs. hopper added , now having wedged [herself]158-mrs. hopper between door and jamb , " whether [you]2259-sir 'd be so kind as to let [[my]158-mrs. hopper sister]2275-my sister [Liza]162-liza see [you]2259-sir just for a minute or two , to thank [you]2259-sir [herself]162-liza as [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm sure [she]162-liza ought ? [She]162-liza could come any time as would n't be ill - convenient to [you]2259-sir . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" [I]159-will 'm extremely busy , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , "[159-will] [Will]159-will replied . " Please tell [[your]158-mrs. hopper sister]2643-your sister [I]159-will 'm delighted to hear [she]162-liza 's done so well at [Southend]6-southend , and [I]159-will hope to see [her]162-liza some day ; but not just now . By the bye , [I]159-will 'm not going out this morning , so do n't wait , when [you]158-mrs. hopper 've finished . "[159-will]

By force of habit [he]159-will ate and drank . [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's letter lay open before [him]159-will ; [he]159-will read it through again and again . But [he]159-will could not fix [his]159-will thoughts upon it . [He]159-will found [himself]159-will occupied with the story of [Boxon]186-boxon , wondering whether [Boxon]186-boxon would live or die . [Boxon]186-boxon , [the grocer]2628-the grocer why , what [an ass]2292-an ass [a man]2336-a man must be , [a man with a good grocery business]822-a man with a good grocery business , to come to grief over drink and betting ! Shopkeeping what a sound and safe life it was ; independent , as far as any money - earning life can be so . There must be a pleasure in counting the contents of one 's till every night . [Boxon]186-boxon ! Of course , [a mere brute]823-a mere brute . There came into [Will]159-will 's memory the picture of [Boxon]186-boxon landed on [the pavement]824-the pavement one night , by [Allchin]161-allchin 's fist or toe and of a sudden [he]186-boxon laughed . When [he]186-boxon had half - smoked [his]186-boxon pipe , comparative calmness fell upon [him]186-boxon . [Sherwood]177-sherwood spoke of at once raising the money [he]177-sherwood owed , and , if [he]177-sherwood succeeded in doing so , much of the mischief would be undone . The four thousand pounds might be safely invested somewhere , and life at [The Haws]59-the haws would go on as usual . But was it certain that [Sherwood]177-sherwood could " raise "[177-sherwood] such sums , being [himself]177-sherwood , as [he]177-sherwood declared , penniless ? This disclosure showed [him]177-sherwood in an unpleasantly new light , as anything but [the cautious man of business]825-the cautious man of business , [the loyal friend]826-the loyal friend , [he]177-sherwood had seemed to be . Who could put faith in [a money - market gambler]827-a money - market gambler ? Why , there was no difference to speak of between [him]177-sherwood and [Boxon]186-boxon . And if [his]177-sherwood promise proved futile what was to be done ?

For a couple of hours , [Will]159-will stared at this question . When the clock on [his]159-will mantelpiece struck eleven , [he]159-will happened to notice it , and was surprised to find how quickly time had passed . By the bye , [he]159-will had never thought of looking at [his]159-will newspaper , though [Sherwood]177-sherwood referred [him]159-will to that source of information on the subject of [Biggles]218-biggles , [Thorpe]73-thorpe and [Biggles]218-biggles . Yes , here it was . [A firm of [brokers]829-brokers]828-a firm of brokers ; unfortunate speculations ; failure of [another house]830-another house all the old story . As likely as not , the financial trick of [a cluster of [thieves]832-thieves]831-a cluster of thieves . [Will]159-will threw the paper aside . [He]159-will had always scorned that cunning of [the Stock Exchange]833-the stock exchange , now [he]159-will thought of it with fiery hatred .

Another hour passed in feverish waiting ; then , just at mid - day , a knock sounded at the outer door . Anything but a loud knock ; anything but the confident summons of [a friend]2493-a friend . [Will]159-will went to open . There stood [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood , shrunk together like [a man suffering from cold]835-a man suffering from cold ; [he]177-sherwood scarcely raised [his]177-sherwood eyes .

[Will]159-will 's purpose , on finding [Sherwood]177-sherwood at [his]159-will door , was to admit [him]177-sherwood without a word , or any form of greeting ; but the sight of that changed face and pitiful attitude overcame [him]159-will ; [he]159-will offered a hand , and felt it warmly pressed .

[They]836-they were together in [the room]305-the room ; [neither]838-neither had spoken . [Will]159-will pointed to a chair , but did not [himself]159-will sit down .

" [I]404-the other suppose it 's all true , [Warburton]176-warburton , "[404-the other] began [the other]404-the other in a low voice , " but [I]404-the other ca n't believe it yet . [I]404-the other seem to be walking in a nightmare ; and when [you]159-will gave [me]404-the other [your]159-will hand at the door , [I]404-the other thought for a second that [I]404-the other 'd just woke up . "[404-the other]

" That 's exactly what [I]404-the other wish to do . Of course [I]404-the other have n't been to bed , and [I]404-the other 've spent the night in writing out a statement of all [my]404-the other dealings for the past fifteen months . [Will]159-will took the paper , a half - sheet of foolscap , one side almost covered with figures . At a glance [he]159-will saw that the statement was perfectly intelligible . The perusal of a few lines caused [him]159-will to look up in astonishment .

" [You]159-will mean to say that between last September and the end of the year [you]159-will lost twenty - five thousand pounds ? "[404-the other]

" [I]404-the other did . "[404-the other]

" And [you]159-will mean to say that [you]159-will still went on with [your]159-will gambling ? "[404-the other]

" And [you]159-will did [your]159-will best to make [them]2644-them desperate . " [The devil of [the City]395-the city]2645-the devil of the city got hold of [me]177-sherwood , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood replied , with a miserable attempt to look [Warburton]176-warburton in the face .

" Yes , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , " that 's clear . Then , a month ago , [you]159-will really possessed only nine thousand pounds ? "[159-will]

" That was all [I]177-sherwood had left , out of nearly forty thousand . "[177-sherwood]

" What astonishes [me]159-will is , that [you]159-will won from time to time . "[159-will]

" [I]177-sherwood did ! "[177-sherwood] exclaimed [Godfrey]177-sherwood , with sudden animation . " Look at the fifth of February that was a great day ! And [I]177-sherwood had to make a good deal , if [we]2648-we were to come to terms with [Applegarth]193-applegarth . [I]177-sherwood nearly did it . [Sherwood]177-sherwood replied with a brief , clear , and obviously honest account of the speculation into which [he]177-sherwood had been drawn . To [the listener]746-the listener it seemed astounding that [any responsible man]842-any responsible man should be lured by [such gambler]843-such gambler 's chance ; [he]177-sherwood could hardly find patience to point out the manifest risks so desperately incurred . And [Sherwood]177-sherwood admitted the full extent of [his]177-sherwood folly ; [he]177-sherwood could only repeat that [he]177-sherwood had acted on an irresistible impulse , to be explained , though not defended , by the embarrassment in which [he]177-sherwood found [himself]177-sherwood .

" Thank Heaven , this is over ! "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood exclaimed at last , passing [his]177-sherwood handkerchief over a moist forehead . " [I]177-sherwood do n't know how [I]177-sherwood got through last night . " No ; [I]177-sherwood have n't the right to tell [you]2652-you , though [I]177-sherwood should like to , to give [you]2652-you confidence .
