" [We]845-them must hope [he]193-applegarth 'll live up to [his]193-applegarth reputation , "[176-warburton] said [Warburton]176-warburton , with the first smile , and that [no cheery one]844-no cheery one , which had risen to [his]177-sherwood lips during this interview .

From that point the talk became easier . All the aspects of [their]845-them position were considered , without stress of feeling , for [Will]159-will had recovered [his]159-will self - control ; and [Sherwood]177-sherwood , soothed by the sense of having discharged an appalling task , tended once more to sanguine thoughts . To be sure , [neither of [them]845-them]846-neither of them could see any immediate way out of the gulf in which [they]845-them found [themselves]845-them ; all hope of resuming business was at an end ; the only practical question was , how to earn a living ; but [both]847-both were [young men]848-young men , and [neither]838-neither had ever known privation ; it was difficult for [them]845-them to believe all at once that [they]845-them were really face to face with that grim necessity which [they]845-them had thought of as conquering [others]2398-others , but never [them]845-them . Certain unpleasant steps , however , had at once to be taken . [Sherwood]177-sherwood must give up [[his]177-sherwood house at [Wimbledon]67-wimbledon]851-his house at wimbledon ; [Warburton]176-warburton must look about for [a cheap lodging into which to remove at [Michaelmas]76-michaelmas]852-a cheap lodging into which to remove at michaelmas . Worse still , and more urgent , was the duty of making known to [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton what had happened .

" [I]159-will suppose [I]159-will must go down at once , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will gloomily .

" [I]404-the other see no hurry , "[404-the other] urged [the other]404-the other . " As a matter of fact , [[your]159-will mother]2657-your mother and [sister]2444-sister will lose nothing . [You]159-will undertook to pay [them]2659-them a minimum of three per cent . on [their]2659-them money , and that [you]159-will can do ; [I]404-the other guarantee [you]159-will that , in any case . "[404-the other]

[Will]159-will mused . If indeed it were possible to avoid the disclosure ? But that would involve much lying , a thing , even in a good cause , little to [his]159-will taste . Still , when [he]159-will thought of [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother 's weak health , and how [she]346-his mother might be affected by the news of this catastrophe , [he]159-will began seriously to ponder the practicability of well - meaning deception . That , of course , must depend upon [their]855-their difficulties with [Applegarth]193-applegarth remaining strictly private ; and even so , could [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull 's scent for disaster be successfully reckoned with ?

" Do n't do anything hastily , [Warburton]176-warburton , [I]404-the other beg of [you]176-warburton , "[404-the other] continued [the other]404-the other . " Things are never so bad as they look at first sight . Wait till [I]404-the other have seen [you]176-warburton know who . [I]404-the other might even be able to but it 's better not to promise . Wait a day or two , at all events . "[404-the other]

And this [Warburton]176-warburton resolved to do ; for , if the worst came to the worst , [he]159-will had some three hundred pounds of [his]159-will own still in the bank , and so could assure , for two years at all events , the income of which [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [Jane]202-jane had absolute need . For [himself]159-will , [he]159-will should find some way of earning bread and cheese ; [he]159-will could no longer stand on [his]159-will dignity , and talk of independence , that was plain .

When at length [[his]159-will calamitous partner]858-his calamitous partner had gone , [he]159-will made an indifferent lunch on the cold meat [he]159-will found in [[Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper 's precincts]859-mrs. hopper 's precincts , and then decided that [he]159-will had better take a walk ; to sit still and brood was the worst possible way of facing such a crisis . There was [no friend]860-no friend with whom [he]159-will could discuss the situation ; none whose companionship would just now do [him]159-will any particular good . Better to walk twenty miles , and tire [himself]159-will out , and see how things looked after a good night 's sleep , So [he]159-will put on [his]159-will soft hat , and took [his]159-will walking - stick , and slammed the door behind [him]159-will . [Some one]2365-some one was coming up the stairs ; sunk in [his]159-will own thoughts [he]159-will paid no heed , even when [the other man]862-the other man stood in front of [him]159-will . Then a familiar voice claimed [his]159-will attention .

" Do [you]176-warburton want to cut [me]747-the speaker , [Warburton]176-warburton ? "[747-the speaker]

CHAPTER 16

[Warburton]176-warburton stopped , and looked into [the speaker]747-the speaker 's face , as if [he]159-will hardly recognised [him]747-the speaker .

" [You]176-warburton 're going out , "[160-franks] added [Franks]160-franks , turning round . " [I]160-franks wo n't keep [you]176-warburton . "[160-franks]

And [he]747-the speaker seemed about to descend the stairs quickly . But [Will]159-will at length found voice .

" Come in . [I]159-will was thinking of something , and did n't see [you]176-warburton . "[159-will]

[They]864-they entered , and passed as usual into [the sitting - room]865-the sitting - room , but not with the wonted exchange of friendly words . The interval since [their]864-they last meeting seemed to have alienated [them]864-they more than the events which preceded it . [Warburton]176-warburton was trying to smile , but each glance [he]747-the speaker took at [the other]404-the other 's face made [his]747-the speaker lips less inclined to relax from a certain severity rarely seen in them ; and [Franks]160-franks succeeded but ill in [his]160-franks attempt to lounge familiarly , with careless casting of the eye this way and that . It was [he]160-franks who broke silence .

" [I]160-franks 've found a new drink gin and laudanum . First rate for the nerves . "[160-franks]

" Ah ! "[176-warburton] replied [Warburton]176-warburton gravely . " [My]176-warburton latest tipple is oil of vitriol with a dash of strychnine . Splendid pick - [me]176-warburton - up . "[176-warburton]

[Franks]160-franks laughed loudly , but unmirthfully .

" No , but [I]160-franks 'm quite serious , "[160-franks] [he]160-franks continued . " It 's the only thing that keeps [me]160-franks going . If [I]160-franks had n't found the use of laudanum in small doses , [I]160-franks should have tried a very large one before now . "[160-franks]

[His]160-franks language had a note of bravado , and [his]160-franks attitude betrayed [the self - conscious actor]867-the self - conscious actor , but there was that in [his]160-franks countenance which could only have come of real misery . The thin cheeks , heavy - lidded and bloodshot eyes , ill - coloured lips , made a picture anything but agreeable to look upon ; and quite in keeping with it was the shabbiness of [his]160-franks garb . After an intent and stern gaze at [him]160-franks , [Will]159-will asked bluntly :

" When did [you]160-franks last have a bath ? "[159-will]

" Bath ? Good God how do [I]159-will know ? "[159-will]

And again [Franks]160-franks laughed in the key of stage recklessness .

" [I]159-will should advise [a Turkish]2660-a turkish , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , " followed by rhubarb of [the same country]2661-the same country . [You]160-franks 'd feel vastly better next day . "[159-will]

" The remedies , "[160-franks] answered [Franks]160-franks , smiling disdainfully , " of [one who has never been through moral suffering]2662-one who has never been through moral suffering . "[160-franks]

" Yet efficacious , even morally , [I]159-will can assure [you]160-franks . And , by the bye , [I]159-will want to know when [you]160-franks 're going to finish ' [The Slummer]172-the slummer . ' "[159-will]

" Finish it ? Why , never ! [I]160-franks could as soon turn to and build [a bridge over [the Thames]26-the thames]2663-a bridge over the thames . "[160-franks]

" What do [you]160-franks mean ? [I]159-will suppose [you]160-franks have to earn [your]160-franks living ? "[159-will]

" [I]160-franks see no necessity for it . What do [I]160-franks care , whether [I]160-franks live or not ? "[160-franks]

" Well , then , [I]159-will am obliged to ask whether [you]160-franks feel it incumbent upon [you]160-franks to pay [your]160-franks debts ? "[159-will]

The last words came out with a jerk , after a little pause which proved what it cost [Warburton]176-warburton to speak them . To save [his]868-he countenance , [he]868-he assumed an unnatural grimness of feature , staring [Franks]160-franks resolutely in the face . And the result was [the artist]329-the artist 's utter subjugation ; [he]868-he shuffled , dropped [his]868-he head , made confused efforts to reply .

" Of course [I]868-he shall do so somehow , "[868-he] [he]868-he muttered at length .

" Have [you]160-franks any other way honest way except by working ? "[176-warburton]

" Very well , then , [I]176-warburton 'll find work . Real work . Not that cursed daubing , which it turns [my]176-warburton stomach to think of . "[176-warburton]

[Warburton]176-warburton paused a moment , then said kindly :

" That 's the talk of [a very sore and dazed man]2664-a very sore and dazed man . Before long , [you]160-franks 'll be [yourself]160-franks again , and [you]160-franks 'll go back to [your]160-franks painting with an appetite And the sooner [you]160-franks try the better . [I]176-warburton do n't particularly like dunning [people]2321-people for money , as [I]176-warburton think [you]160-franks know , but , when [you]160-franks can pay that debt of [yours]160-franks , [I]176-warburton shall be glad . [I]176-warburton 've had a bit of bad luck since last [we]2666-we saw [each other]412-each other . "[176-warburton]

[Franks]160-franks gazed in heavy - eyed wonder , uncertain whether to take this as a joke or not .

" Bad luck ? What sort of bad luck ? "[176-warburton]

" Why , neither on [the turf]2668-the turf nor at [Monte Carlo]78-monte carlo . But a speculation has gone wrong , and [I]176-warburton 'm adrift . [I]176-warburton shall have to leave [this flat]817-this flat . How [I]176-warburton 'm going to keep [myself]176-warburton alive , [I]176-warburton do n't know yet . The [Bristol]45-bristol affair is of course off . [I]176-warburton 'm as good as penniless , and a hundred pounds or so will come very conveniently , whenever [you]160-franks can manage it . "[176-warburton]

" Are [you]176-warburton serious , [Warburton]176-warburton ? "[176-warburton]

" Perfectly . "[176-warburton]

" [You]176-warburton 've really lost everything ? [You]176-warburton 've got to leave [this flat]817-this flat because [you]176-warburton ca n't afford it ? "[176-warburton]

" That , [[my]176-warburton boy]2291-my boy , is the state of the case . "[176-warburton]

" By [Jove]181-jove ! No wonder [you]160-franks did n't see [me]176-warburton as [I]176-warburton came [upstairs]642-upstairs . What [the deuce]2599-the deuce ! [You]160-franks in [Queer Street]79-queer street ! [I]176-warburton never dreamt of such a thing as a possibility . [I]176-warburton 've always thought of [you]160-franks as a flourishing capitalist sound as [the Mansion House]2674-the mansion house . Why did n't [you]160-franks begin by telling [me]176-warburton this ? [I]176-warburton 'm about as miserable as [a fellow]2512-a fellow can be , but [I]176-warburton should never have bothered [you]160-franks with [my]176-warburton miseries . [Warburton]176-warburton in want of money ? Why , the idea is grotesque ; [I]176-warburton ca n't get hold of it . [I]176-warburton came to [you]160-franks as [men]2676-men go to [a bank]2677-a bank . Of course , [I]176-warburton meant to pay it all , some day , but [you]160-franks were so generous and so rich , [I]176-warburton never thought there would be any hurry . [I]176-warburton 'm astounded [I]176-warburton 'm floored ! "[176-warburton]

With infinite satisfaction , [Warburton]176-warburton saw [the better man]870-the better man rising again in [[his]870-the better man friend]321-his friend , noted the change of countenance , of bearing , of tone .

" [You]160-franks see , "[870-the better man] [he]870-the better man said , with a nod and a smile , " that [you]160-franks 've no choice but to finish ' [The Slummer]2678-the slummer ! ' "[870-the better man]

[Franks]160-franks looked about [him]160-franks uneasily , fretfully .

" Either that or something else , "[160-franks] [he]160-franks muttered .

" No that ! It 'll bring [you]160-franks two or three hundred pounds without much delay . "[329-the artist]

" [I]329-the artist daresay it would . But if [you]160-franks knew how [I]329-the artist loathe and curse the very sight of the thing Why [I]329-the artist have n't burnt it [I]329-the artist do n't know . "[329-the artist]

" Probably , "[159-will] said [Will]159-will , " because in summer weather [you]160-franks take [your]160-franks gin and laudanum cold . "[159-will]

This time [the artist]329-the artist 's laugh was more genuine .

" The hideous time [I]870-the better man have been going through ! "[870-the better man] [he]870-the better man continued . " It 's no use trying to give [you]160-franks an idea of it . Of course [you]160-franks 'd say it was all damned foolery . Well , [I]870-the better man sha n't go through it again , that 's one satisfaction . [I]870-the better man 've done with [women]2496-women . One reason why [I]870-the better man loathe the thought of going on with that picture is because [I]870-the better man still have [the girl]2296-the girl 's head to put in . But [I]870-the better man 'll do it . [I]870-the better man 'll go back and get to work at once . If [I]870-the better man ca n't find [a model]2462-a model , [I]870-the better man 'll fake the head get it out of [some woman]2682-some woman 's paper where the fashions are illustrated ; that 'll do very well . [I]870-the better man 'll go and see how the beastly thing looks . It 's turned against the wall , and [I]870-the better man wonder [I]870-the better man have n't put [my]870-the better man boot through it . "[870-the better man]

CHAPTER 17

[Warburton]176-warburton waited for a quarter of an hour after [the artist]329-the artist had gone , then set out for [his]329-the artist walk . The result of this unexpected conversation with [Franks]160-franks was excellent ; [the foolish fellow]874-the foolish fellow seemed to have recovered [his]874-the foolish fellow common sense . But [Will]159-will felt ashamed of [himself]159-will . Of course [he]159-will had acted solely with a view to the other 's good , seeing no hope but this of rescuing [Franks]160-franks from the slough in which [he]159-will wallowed ; nevertheless , [he]159-will was stung with shame . For the first time in [his]159-will life [he]159-will had asked repayment of money lent to [a friend]2493-a friend . And [he]159-will had done the thing blunderingly , without tact . For the purpose in view , it would have been enough to speak of [his]159-will own calamity ; just the same effect would have been produced on [Franks]160-franks . [He]159-will saw this now , and writhed under the sense of [his]160-franks grossness . The only excuse [he]159-will could urge for [himself]159-will was that [Franks]160-franks ' behaviour provoked and merited rough handling . Still , [he]159-will might have had perspicacity enough to understand that [the artist]329-the artist was not so sunk in squalor as [he]329-the artist pretended .

" Just like [me]159-will , "[159-will] [he]159-will growled to [himself]159-will , with a nervous twitching of the face . " [I]159-will 've no presence of mind . [I]159-will see the right thing when it 's too late , and when [I]159-will 've made [myself]159-will appear [a bounder]2683-a bounder . How many thousand times have [I]159-will blundered in this way ! [A man like [me]159-will]2684-a man like me ought to live alone as [I]159-will 've a very fair chance of doing in future . "[159-will]

[His]159-will walk did [him]159-will no good , and on [his]159-will return [he]159-will passed a black evening . With [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , who came as usual to get dinner for [him]159-will , [he]159-will held little conversation ; in a few days [he]159-will would have to tell [her]158-mrs. hopper what had befallen [him]159-will , or invent some lie to account for the change in [his]159-will arrangements , and this again tortured [Will]159-will 's nerves . In one sense of the word , [no man]877-no man was less pretentious ; but [his]159-will liberality of thought and behaviour consisted with a personal pride which was very much at the mercy of circumstance . Even as [he]159-will could not endure subjection , so did [he]159-will shrink from the thought of losing dignity in the eyes of [[his]159-will social inferiors]878-his social inferiors . Mere poverty and lack of ease did not frighten [him]159-will at all ; [he]159-will had hardly given a thought as yet to that aspect of misfortune . What most of all distressed [his]159-will imagination putting aside thought of [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister was the sudden fall from a position of genial authority , of beneficent command , with all the respect and gratitude and consideration attaching thereto . [He]159-will could do without personal comforts , if need were , but it pained [him]159-will horribly to think of being no longer [a patron]881-a patron and [a master]882-a master . With a good deal more philosophy than [the average man]883-the average man , and vastly more benevolence , [he]159-will could not attain to the humility which would have seen in this change of fortune a mere surrender of privileges perhaps quite unjustifiable . Social grades were an inseparable part of [his]159-will view of life ; [he]159-will recognised the existence of [[his]159-will superiors]416-his superiors though resolved to have as little to do with [them]416-his superiors as possible , and took it as a matter of course that multitudes of [men]2676-men should stand below [his]159-will level . To imagine [himself]159-will an object of pity for [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper and [Allchin]161-allchin and the rest of [them]886-them wrought upon [his]159-will bile , disordered [his]159-will digestion .

[[He]159-will who had regarded so impatiently the trials of [Norbert Franks]160-franks]887-he who had regarded so impatiently the trials of norbert franks now had to go through an evil time , with worse results upon [his]159-will temper , [his]159-will health , and whole being , than [he]159-will would have thought conceivable . For a whole fortnight [he]159-will lived in a state of suspense and forced idleness , which helped [him]159-will to understand [the artist]329-the artist 's recourse to gin and laudanum . The weather was magnificent , but for [him]159-will no sun rose in the sky . If [he]159-will walked about [London]18-london , [he]159-will saw only ugliness and wretchedness , [his]159-will eyes seeming to have lost the power of perceiving other things . Every two or three days [he]159-will heard from [Sherwood]177-sherwood , who wrote that [he]177-sherwood was doing [his]177-sherwood utmost , and continued to hold out hope that [he]177-sherwood would soon have money : but these letters were not reassuring . The disagreeable interview with [Applegarth]193-applegarth had passed off better than might have been expected . Though greatly astonished , and obviously in some doubt as to the facts of the matter , [Applegarth]193-applegarth behaved as [a gentleman]889-a gentleman , resigned all claims upon [the defaulters]890-the defaulters , and brought the affair to a decent close as quickly as possible . But [Warburton]176-warburton came away with a face so yellow that [he]159-will seemed on the point of an attack of jaundice . For [him]159-will to be the object of [another man]891-another man 's generous forbearance was something new and intolerable . Before parting with [Sherwood]177-sherwood , [he]159-will spoke to [him]177-sherwood bitterly , all but savagely . A few hours later , of course , repentance came upon [him]159-will , and [he]159-will wrote to ask pardon . An evil time .

At length [Sherwood]177-sherwood came to [Chelsea]50-chelsea , having written to ask for a meeting . [Will]159-will 's forebodings were but too well justified . [The disastrous man]892-the disastrous man came only to say that all [his]892-the disastrous man efforts had failed . [[His]892-the disastrous man debtor]893-his debtor for ten thousand pounds was [himself]893-his debtor in such straits that [he]893-his debtor could only live by desperate expedients , and probably would not be able to pay a penny of interest this year .

" Happily , "[177-sherwood] said [Sherwood]177-sherwood , " [[his]892-the disastrous man father]342-his father 's health is breaking . [One]2293-one is obliged to talk in this brutal way , [you]177-sherwood know . At [the father]533-the father 's death it will be all right ; [I]177-sherwood shall then have [my]177-sherwood legal remedy , if there 's need of it . To take any step of that sort now would be ruinous ; [[my]177-sherwood friend]2422-my friend would be cut off with a shilling , if the affair came to [[his]892-the disastrous man father]342-his father 's ears . "[177-sherwood]

" So this is how [we]2690-we stand , "[176-warburton] said [Warburton]176-warburton , grimly . " It 's all over . "[176-warburton]

[Sherwood]177-sherwood laid on the table a number of bank - notes , saying simply :

" There 's two hundred and sixty pounds the result of the sale of [my]177-sherwood furniture and things . Will [you]176-warburton use that and trust [me]177-sherwood a little longer ? "[177-sherwood]

[Warburton]176-warburton writhed in [his]177-sherwood chair .

" What have [you]176-warburton to live upon ? "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood asked with eyes downcast .

" Oh , [I]177-sherwood shall get on all right . [I]177-sherwood 've one or two ideas . "[177-sherwood]

" But this is all the money [you]176-warburton have ? "[177-sherwood]

" [I]404-the other 've kept about fifty pounds , "[404-the other] answered [the other]404-the other , " out of which [I]404-the other can pay [my]404-the other debts they 're small and the rent of [[my]404-the other house]2691-my house for this quarter . "[404-the other]

[Warburton]176-warburton pushed back the notes .

" [I]177-sherwood ca n't take it [you]176-warburton know [I]177-sherwood ca n't . "[177-sherwood]

" [You]176-warburton must . "[177-sherwood]

" How the devil are [you]159-will going to live ? "[159-will] cried [Will]159-will , in exasperation .

" [I]177-sherwood shall find a way , "[177-sherwood] replied [Sherwood]177-sherwood with an echo of [his]177-sherwood old confident tone . " [I]177-sherwood need a little time to look about [me]177-sherwood , that 's all , There 's [a relative of [mine]177-sherwood]2692-a relative of mine , [an old fellow who lives comfortably in [North Wales]80-north wales , and who invites [me]177-sherwood down every two or three years]2693-an old fellow who lives comfortably in north wales , and who invites me down every two or three years . The best thing will be for [me]177-sherwood to go and spend a short time with [him]2692-a relative of mine , and get [my]177-sherwood nerves into order [I]177-sherwood 'm shaky , there 's no disguising it . [I]177-sherwood have n't exhausted all the possibilities of raising money ; there 's hope still in one or two directions ; if [I]177-sherwood get a little quietness and rest [I]177-sherwood shall be able to think things out more clearly Do n't [you]177-sherwood think this justifiable ? "[177-sherwood]

As to the money [he]177-sherwood remained inflexible . Very reluctantly [Warburton]176-warburton consented to keep this sum , giving a receipt in form .

" [You]177-sherwood have n't said anything to [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton yet ? "[177-sherwood] asked [Sherwood]177-sherwood nervously .

" Not yet , "[159-will] muttered [Will]159-will .

" [I]159-will wish [you]177-sherwood could postpone it a little longer . Could [you]177-sherwood do [you]177-sherwood think without too much strain of conscience ? Does n't it seem a pity when any day may enable [me]159-will to put things right ? "[159-will]

[Will]159-will muttered again that [he]159-will would think of it ; that assuredly [he]159-will preferred not to disclose the matter if it could decently be kept secret . And on this [Sherwood]177-sherwood took [his]177-sherwood leave , going away with a brighter face than [he]177-sherwood had brought to the interview ; whilst [Will]159-will remained brooding gloomily , [his]159-will eyes fixed on the bank - notes , in an unconscious stare .

Little of a man of business as [he]177-sherwood was , [Warburton]176-warburton knew very well that things at [the office]524-the office were passing in a flagrantly irregular way : [he]177-sherwood knew that [any one else]896-any one else in [his]177-sherwood position would have put this serious affair into legal hands , if only out of justice to [Sherwood]177-sherwood [himself]177-sherwood . More than once [he]159-will had thought of communicating with [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull , but shame withheld [him]159-will . It seemed improbable , too , that [the solicitor]897-the solicitor would connive at keeping [[his]897-the solicitor friends]898-his friends at [The Haws]59-the haws ignorant of what had befallen [them]898-his friends , and with every day that passed [Will]159-will felt more disposed to hide that catastrophe , if by any means that were possible . Already [he]159-will had half committed [himself]159-will to this deception , having written to [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother without mention of any other detail that [he]159-will might , after all , continue to live in [London]18-london , where [Applegarth]193-applegarth 's were about to establish [a warehouse]900-a warehouse . The question was how ; if [he]159-will put aside all the money [he]159-will had for payment of pretended dividend to [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister , how , in that case , was [he]159-will [himself]159-will to live ? At the thought of going about applying for [clerk]2318-clerk 's work , or anything of that kind , cold water flowed down [his]159-will back ; rather than that , [he]159-will would follow [Allchin]161-allchin 's example , and turn porter an independent position compared with bent - backed slavery on an office - stool . Some means of earning money [he]159-will must find without delay . To live on what [he]159-will had , one day longer than could be helped , would be sheer dishonesty . [Sherwood]177-sherwood might succeed in bringing [him]159-will a few hundreds of the ten thousand [Will]159-will thought not at all , so fantastic did the whole story sound but that would be merely another small instalment of the sum due to [the unsuspecting victims at [St. Neots]49-st. neots]904-the unsuspecting victims at st. neots . Strictly speaking , [he]159-will owned not a penny ; [his]159-will very meals to - day were at the expense of [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [Jane]202-jane . This thought goaded [him]159-will . [His]159-will sleep became a mere nightmare ; [his]159-will waking , a dry - throated misery .

In spite of loathing and dread , [he]159-will began to read the thick - serried columns of newspaper advertisement , Wanted ! Wanted ! Wanted ! Wants by the thousand ; but [many more those of the would - be employed]906-many more those of the would - be employed than those of [the would - be employers]907-the would - be employers , and under the second heading not one in a hundred that offered [him]159-will the slightest hint or hope . Wanted ! Wanted . To glance over these columns is like listening to the clamour of [a hunger - driven multitude]908-a hunger - driven multitude ; the ears sing , the head turns giddy . After a quarter of an hour of such search , [Will]159-will flung the paper aside , and stamped like [a madman]909-a madman about [[his]159-will room]910-his room . A horror of life seized [him]159-will ; [he]159-will understood , with fearful sympathy , the impulse of [those who , rather than be any longer hustled in this howling mob]911-those who , rather than be any longer hustled in this howling mob dash [themselves]911-those who , rather than be any longer hustled in this howling mob to destruction .

[He]159-will thought over the list of [[his]159-will friends]898-his friends . [Friends]737-friends what [man]914-man has more than two or three ? At this moment [he]159-will knew of [no one who wished [him]159-will well who could be of the slightest service]915-no one who wished him well who could be of the slightest service . [[His]159-will acquaintances]916-his acquaintances were of course more numerous . There lay on [his]159-will table two invitations just received the kind of invitation received by [every man who does not live the life of a hermit]917-every man who does not live the life of a hermit . But what human significance had [they]918-they ? Not a name rose in [his]159-will mind which symbolised helpfulness . True , that might be to some extent [his]159-will own fault ; [the people of whom [he]159-will saw most]919-the people of whom he saw most were such as needed , [not such as could offer , aid]920-not such as could offer , aid . [He]159-will thought of [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret . There , certainly , a kindly will would not be lacking , but how could [he]159-will worry with [his]159-will foolish affairs [a man on whom [he]159-will had no shadow of claim]921-a man on whom he had no shadow of claim ? No : [he]159-will stood alone . It was a lesson in social science such as reading could never have afforded [him]159-will . [His]159-will insight into the order of [a man]2336-a man 's world had all at once been marvellously quickened , the scope of [his]159-will reflections incredibly extended . Some vague consciousness of this now and then arrested [him]159-will in [his]159-will long purposeless walks ; [he]159-will began to be aware of seeing common things with new eyes . But the perception was akin to fear ; [he]159-will started and looked nervously about , as if suddenly aware of some peril .

One afternoon [he]159-will was on [his]159-will way [home]354-home from a westward trudge , plodding along [the remoter part of [Fulham Road]38-fulham road]924-the remoter part of fulham road , when words spoken by [a woman whom [he]159-will passed]925-a woman whom he passed caught [his]159-will ears .

" See ' ere ! The shutters is up . [Boxon]186-boxon must be dead . "[925-a woman whom he passed]

[Boxon]186-boxon ? How did [he]159-will come to know that name ? [He]159-will slackened [his]159-will pace , reflecting . Why , [Boxon]186-boxon was the name of [the betting and drinking grocer]926-the betting and drinking grocer , with whom [Allchin]161-allchin used to be . [He]159-will stopped , and saw [a group of three or four women]927-a group of three or four women staring at [the closed shop]928-the closed shop . Did n't [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper say that [Boxon]186-boxon had been nearly killed in a carriage accident ? Doubtless [he]186-boxon was dead .

[He]159-will walked on , but before [he]159-will had gone a dozen yards , stopped abruptly , turned , crossed to the other side of [the road]929-the road , and went back till [he]159-will stood opposite [the closed shop]928-the closed shop . The name of [the tradesman]931-the tradesman in great gilt letters proved that there was no mistake . [He]159-will examined [the building]932-the building ; there were two storys above [the shop]2401-the shop ; the first seemed to be used for storage ; white blinds at the windows of the second showed [it]932-the building to be inhabited . For some five minutes [Will]159-will stood gazing and reflecting ; then , with head bent as before , [he]159-will pursued [his]159-will way .

When [he]159-will reached [home]354-home , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper regarded [him]159-will compassionately ; [the good woman]935-the good woman was much disturbed by the strangeness of [his]159-will demeanour lately , and feared [he]159-will was going to be ill .

" [You]159-will look dre'ful tired , [sir]2259-sir , "[935-the good woman] [she]935-the good woman said . " [I]935-the good woman 'll make [you]159-will a cup of tea at once . It 'll do [you]159-will good . "[935-the good woman]

" Yes , get [me]176-warburton some tea , "[176-warburton] answered [Warburton]176-warburton , absently . Then , as [she]935-the good woman was leaving [the room]305-the room , [he]159-will asked , " Is it true that [the grocer Boxon]186-boxon is dead ? "[159-will]

" [I]158-mrs. hopper was going to speak of it this morning , [sir]2259-sir , "[158-mrs. hopper] replied [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , " but [you]159-will seemed so busy . Yes , [sir]2259-sir , [he]186-boxon 's died died the day before yesterday , [they]2697-they say , and it 'd be surprising to hear as [anybody]2377-anybody 's sorry . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Who 'll take [his]186-boxon business ? "[176-warburton] asked [Warburton]176-warburton .

" [We]2699-we was talking about that last night , [sir]2259-sir , [me]158-mrs. hopper and [[my]158-mrs. hopper sister]2275-my sister [Liza]162-liza , and [the Allchins]221-the allchins . It 's fallen off a great deal lately , what else could [you]159-will expect ? since [Boxon]186-boxon got into [his]186-boxon bad ways . But [anybody as had a little money]2702-anybody as had a little money might do well there . [Allchin]161-allchin was saying [he]186-boxon wished [he]186-boxon had a few ' undreds . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" A few hundred would be enough ? "[746-the listener] interrupted [the listener]746-the listener , without noticing the look of peculiar eagerness on [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper 's face .

" [Allchin]161-allchin thinks the goodwill can be had for about a ' undred , [sir]2259-sir ; and the rent , it 's only eighty pounds "[158-mrs. hopper]

" [Shop]2704-shop and [house]2484-house ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Yes , [sir]2259-sir ; so [Allchin]161-allchin says . It is n't much of a ' ouse , of course . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" What profits could be made , do [you]159-will suppose , by [an energetic man]2707-an energetic man ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" When [Boxon]186-boxon began , [sir]2259-sir , "[158-mrs. hopper] replied [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , with growing animation , " [he]186-boxon used to make so [Allchin]161-allchin says a good five or six ' undred a year . " Yes , yes , of course , [you]2259-sir must have stock . "[159-will] said [Will]159-will carelessly . " Bring [me]159-will some tea at once , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper . "[159-will]

It had suddenly occurred to [him]159-will that [Allchin]161-allchin might think of trying to borrow the capital wherewith to start this business , and that [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper might advise [[her]158-mrs. hopper brother - in - law]490-her brother - in - law to apply to [him]159-will for the loan .

But this was not at all the idea which had prompted [Will]159-will 's inquiries .

CHAPTER 18

Another week went by . [Warburton]176-warburton was still living in the same restless way , but did not wear quite so gloomy a countenance ; now and then [he]939-he looked almost cheerful . That was the case when one morning [he]939-he received a letter from [Sherwood]177-sherwood . [Godfrey]177-sherwood wrote that , no sooner had [he]939-he arrived at [[his]939-he relative]940-his relative 's in [North Wales]80-north wales than [he]939-he was seized with a violent liver - attack , which for some days prostrated [him]939-he ; [he]939-he was now recovering , and better news still , had succeeded in borrowing a couple of hundred pounds . Half of this sum [he]939-he sent to [Warburton]176-warburton ; the other half [he]939-he begged to be allowed to retain , as [he]939-he had what might prove a very fruitful idea for the use of the money details presently . To this letter [Will]159-will immediately replied at some length . The cheque [he]159-will paid into [his]159-will account , which thus reached a total of more than six hundred pounds .

A few days later , after breakfast as usual , [he]159-will let [[his]159-will servant]300-his servant clear the table , then said with a peculiar smile .

" [I]159-will want to have a little talk with [you]300-his servant , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper . Please sit down . "[159-will]

To seat [herself]300-his servant in [[her]300-his servant master]310-her master 's presence went against all [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper 's ideas of propriety . Seeing [her]300-his servant hesitate , [Will]159-will pointed steadily to a chair , and [the good woman]935-the good woman , much flurried , placed [herself]935-the good woman on the edge of it .

" [You]159-will have noticed , "[176-warburton] [Warburton]176-warburton resumed , " that [I]176-warburton have n't been quite [myself]176-warburton lately . There was a good reason for it . [I]176-warburton 've had a misfortune in business ; all [my]176-warburton plans are changed ; [I]176-warburton shall have to begin quite a new life a different life altogether from that [I]176-warburton have led till now . "[176-warburton]

[Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper seemed to have a sudden pain in the side . [She]158-mrs. hopper groaned under [her]158-mrs. hopper breath , staring at [the speaker]747-the speaker pitifully .

" There 's no need to talk about it , [you]158-mrs. hopper know , "[159-will] [Will]159-will went on with a friendly nod . " [I]159-will tell [you]158-mrs. hopper , because [I]159-will 'm thinking of going into a business in which [[your]158-mrs. hopper brother - in - law]2710-your brother - in - law could help [me]159-will , if [he]2710-your brother - in - law cares to . "[159-will]

[He]159-will paused . [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper kept [her]158-mrs. hopper wide eyes on [him]159-will .

" [Allchin'll]188-allchin'll be very glad to hear of that , [sir]2259-sir . What am [I]158-mrs. hopper saying ? Of course [I]158-mrs. hopper do n't mean [he]2710-your brother - in - law 'll be glad [you]2259-sir 've had misfortune , [sir]2259-sir , and [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm that sorry to hear it , [I]158-mrs. hopper ca n't tell [you]2259-sir . But it does just happen as [he]2710-your brother - in - law 's out of work , through that nasty temper of [his]2710-your brother - in - law . Not , "[158-mrs. hopper] [she]158-mrs. hopper corrected [herself]158-mrs. hopper hastily , " as [I]158-mrs. hopper ought to call [him]2710-your brother - in - law nasty - tempered . With [a good employer]2713-a good employer , [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm sure [he]2710-your brother - in - law 'd never get into no trouble at all . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Does [he]2710-your brother - in - law still wish to get back into the grocery business ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" [He]2710-your brother - in - law 'd be only too glad , [sir]2259-sir , But , of course , any place as [you]2259-sir offered [him]2710-your brother - in - law "[158-mrs. hopper]

" Well , it happens , "[176-warburton] said [Warburton]176-warburton , " that it is the grocery business [I]176-warburton 'm thinking about . "[176-warburton]

" [You]2259-sir , [sir]2259-sir ? "[158-mrs. hopper] gasped [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper .

" [I]158-mrs. hopper think [I]158-mrs. hopper shall take [[Boxon]186-boxon 's shop]2716-boxon 's shop . "[158-mrs. hopper]

" [You]2259-sir , [sir]2259-sir ? Take [[a grocer]492-a grocer 's shop]2719-a grocer 's shop ? [You]2259-sir mean , [you]2259-sir 'd put [Allchin]161-allchin in to manage [it]2719-a grocer 's shop ? "[158-mrs. hopper]

" No , [I]159-will do n't , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , "[159-will] replied [Will]159-will , smiling mechanically . " [I]159-will have more than [my]159-will own living to earn ; [other people]2333-other people are dependent upon [me]159-will , so [I]159-will must make as much money as possible . [I]159-will can t afford to pay [a manager]2721-a manager . [I]159-will shall go behind the counter [myself]159-will , and [Allchin]161-allchin , if [he]2721-a manager cares for [the place]2350-the place , shall be [[my]159-will assistant]2723-my assistant . "[159-will]

[The good woman]935-the good woman could find no words to express [her]935-the good woman astonishment .

" Suppose [you]159-will have a word with [Allchin]161-allchin , and send [him]2721-a manager to see [me]935-the good woman this evening ? [I]935-the good woman say again , there 's no need to talk about the thing to [anybody else]2724-anybody else . [We]2725-we 'll just keep it quiet between [us]2725-we . "[935-the good woman]

" [You]159-will can depend upon [me]158-mrs. hopper , [sir]2259-sir , "[158-mrs. hopper] declared [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper . " But did [you]159-will hever ! It 's come upon [me]158-mrs. hopper so sudden like . And what 'll [Allchin]161-allchin say ! Why , [he]159-will 'll think [I]158-mrs. hopper 'm having a game with [him]159-will . "[158-mrs. hopper]

To this point had [Will Warburton]176-warburton brought [himself]176-warburton , urged by conscience and fear . Little by little , since the afternoon when [he]946-he gazed at [[Boxon]186-boxon 's closed shop]947-boxon 's closed shop , had this purpose grown in [his]946-he mind , until [he]946-he saw it as a possibility a desirability a fact . By shopkeeping , [he]946-he might hope to earn sufficient for supply of the guaranteed income to [[his]946-he mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister , and at the same time be [[no man]877-no man 's servant]951-no man 's servant . [His]946-he acquaintance with [Allchin]161-allchin enabled [him]946-he to disregard [his]946-he lack of grocery experience ; with [Allchin]161-allchin for [an assistant]952-an assistant , [he]946-he would soon overcome initial difficulties . Only to [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood had [he]177-sherwood communicated [his]177-sherwood project . " What difference is there , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood wrote , " between selling sugar from [an office in [Whitechapel]16-whitechapel]2727-an office in whitechapel , and selling it from behind a counter in [Fulham Road]38-fulham road ? "[177-sherwood] [And [Sherwood]177-sherwood who was still reposing in [North Wales]80-north wales]953-and sherwood who was still reposing in north wales wrote a long , affectionate , admiring reply . " [You]177-sherwood are splendid ! What energy ! What courage ! [I]177-sherwood could almost say that [I]177-sherwood do n't regret [my]177-sherwood criminal recklessness , seeing that it has given the occasion for such a magnificent display of character . "[177-sherwood] [He]177-sherwood added , " Of course it will be only for a short time . Even if the plans [I]177-sherwood am now working out details shortly come to nothing a very unlikely thing , [I]177-sherwood am sure to recover [my]177-sherwood ten thousand pounds in a year or so . "[177-sherwood] " Of course , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood wrote in a postscript , " [I]177-sherwood breathe no word of it to [any mortal]2728-any mortal . "[177-sherwood]

This letter so are [we]954-we made did [Warburton]176-warburton good . It strengthened [him]177-sherwood in carrying through the deception of [[his]177-sherwood relatives]955-his relatives and of [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull , for [he]177-sherwood saw [himself]177-sherwood as [splendide mendax]956-splendide mendax . In [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's plans and assurances [he]177-sherwood had no shadow of faith , but [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's admiration was worth having , and it threw a gilding upon the name of [grocer]2630-grocer . Should [he]177-sherwood impart the secret to [Norbert Franks]160-franks ? That question [he]177-sherwood could not decide just yet . In any case , [he]177-sherwood should tell [no one else]958-no one else ; [all other acquaintances]959-all other acquaintances must be content if [they]959-all other acquaintances cared to inquire with vague references to an " agency , "[346-his mother] or something of the sort . Neither [[his]177-sherwood mother]346-his mother nor [Jane]202-jane ever came to [London]18-london for [them]959-all other acquaintances , [his]177-sherwood change of address to [a poorer district]961-a poorer district would have no significance . In short , [London]18-london , being [London]18-london , it seemed perfectly feasible to pass [his]177-sherwood life in [[a grocer]492-a grocer 's shop]2719-a grocer 's shop without the fact becoming known to [any one from whom [he]177-sherwood wished to conceal it]964-any one from whom he wished to conceal it .

The rent of [the shop and house]965-the shop and house was eighty - five pounds an increase upon that paid by [Boxon]186-boxon . " Plant "[492-a grocer] was estimated at a hundred and twenty - five ; the stock at one hundred and fifty , and the goodwill at a round hundred . This made a total of four hundred and sixty pounds , leaving [Warburton]176-warburton some couple of hundred for all the expenses of [his]177-sherwood start . [The landlord]966-the landlord had consented to do certain repairs , including a repainting of [the shop]2401-the shop , and this work had already begun . Not a day must be lost . [Will]159-will knew that the first half - year would decide [his]159-will fate as [a tradesman]968-a tradesman . Did [he]159-will come out at the end of six months with sufficient profit to pay a bare three per cent . on the St. Neots money , all would be safe and well . If the balance went against [him]159-will , why then the whole battle of life was lost , and [he]159-will might go hide [his]159-will head in some corner even more obscure .

Of course [he]159-will counted largely on the help of [Allchin]161-allchin . [Allchin]161-allchin , though pig - headed and pugnacious , had a fair knowledge of the business , to which [he]177-sherwood had been bred , and of business matters in general always talked shrewdly . Unable , whatever [his]159-will own straits , to deal penuriously with [my]0-i one , [Will]159-will had thought out a liberal arrangement , whereby all the dwelling part of [the house]450-the house should be given over , rent free , to [Allchin]161-allchin and [[his]177-sherwood wife]569-his wife , with permission to take [one lodger]971-one lodger ; [the assistant]972-the assistant to be paid a small salary , and a percentage on shop takings when [they]973-they reached a certain sum per month . This proposal , then , [he]159-will set before [the muscular man]974-the muscular man on [his]974-the muscular man presenting [himself]974-the muscular man this afternoon . [Allchin]161-allchin 's astonishment at the story [he]159-will had heard from [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper was not less than that of [the woman]296-the woman [herself]296-the woman . With difficulty persuaded to sit down , [he]159-will showed a countenance in which the gloom [he]159-will thought decorous struggled against jubilation on [his]159-will own account : and [Warburton]176-warburton had not talked long before [[his]159-will listener]976-his listener 's features irresistibly expanded in a happy grin .

" How would something of this kind suit [you]161-allchin ? "[159-will] asked [Will]159-will .

" [Me]161-allchin , [sir]2259-sir ? "[161-allchin] [Allchin]161-allchin slapped [his]159-will leg . " [You]2259-sir ask how it suits [me]161-allchin ? "[161-allchin]

[His]159-will feelings were too much for [him]159-will . [He]159-will grew very red , and could say no more .

" Then suppose [we]2730-we settle it so . [I]161-allchin 've written out the terms of [your]161-allchin engagement . Read and sign . "[161-allchin]

[Allchin]161-allchin pretended to read the paper , but obviously paid no attention to it . [He]159-will seemed to be struggling with some mental obstacle .

" Something [you]161-allchin want to alter ? "[176-warburton] asked [Warburton]176-warburton .

" Why , [sir]2259-sir , [you]2259-sir 've altogether forgot as [I]161-allchin 'm in [your]2259-sir debt . It stands to reason as [you]2259-sir must take that money out before [you]2259-sir begin to pay [me]161-allchin anything . "[161-allchin]

" Oh , [we]2730-we wo n't say anything more about that trifle . [We]2730-we 're making a new beginning . But look here , [Allchin]161-allchin , [I]161-allchin do n't want [you]161-allchin to quarrel with [me]161-allchin , as [you]161-allchin do with [every one else]2732-every one else "[161-allchin]

" With [you]2259-sir , [sir]2259-sir ? Ho , [ho]2734-ho ! "[161-allchin]

[Allchin]161-allchin guffawed , and at once looked ashamed of [himself]161-allchin .

" [I]977-i quarrel , "[977-i] [he]977-i added , " with [people]2321-people as are insulting , or as try to best [me]977-i . It goes against [my]977-i nature , [sir]2259-sir , to be insulted and to be bested . "[977-i]

[They]978-they talked about the details of the business , and presently [Allchin]161-allchin asked what name was to be put up over [the shop]2401-the shop .

" [I]159-will 've thought of that , "[159-will] answered [Will]159-will . " What do [you]161-allchin say to [Jollyman]222-bertha ? "[159-will]

[The assistant]972-the assistant was delighted ; [he]972-the assistant repeated the name a dozen times , snorting and choking with appreciation of the joke . Next morning , [they]978-they met again , and went together to look at [the shop]2401-the shop . Here [Allchin]161-allchin made great play with [his]977-i valuable qualities . [He]977-i pointed out the errors and negligencies of [the late Boxon]186-boxon , declared it a scandal that a business such as this should have been allowed to fall off , and was full of ingenious ideas for a brilliant opening . Among other forms of inexpensive advertisement , [he]977-i suggested that , for the first day , [a band]982-a band should be engaged to play in [the front room over [the shop]2401-the shop]983-the front room over the shop , with the windows open ; and [he]977-i undertook to find [amateur bandsmen who would undertake the job on very moderate terms]985-amateur bandsmen who would undertake the job on very moderate terms .

Not many days elapsed before the old name had disappeared from the house front , giving place to that of [Jollyman]222-bertha . Whilst this was being painted up , [Allchin]161-allchin stood on the opposite side of the way , watching delightedly .

" When [I]977-i think as the name used to be [Boxon]186-boxon , "[977-i] [he]977-i exclaimed to [[his]977-i employer]986-his employer , " why , [I]977-i ca n't believe as any money was ever made [here]2261-here . [Boxon]186-boxon ! Why , it was enough to drive [customers]2399-customers away ! If [you]986-his employer ever heard a worse name , [sir]2259-sir , for [a shopkeeper]2740-a shopkeeper , [I]977-i should be glad to be told of it . But [Jollyman]222-bertha ! Why , it 'll bring [[people]2321-people from [Putney]61-putney]2742-people from putney , from [Battersea]28-battersea , from who knows how far . [Jollyman]222-bertha 's Teas , [Jollyman]222-bertha 's sugar ca n't [you]986-his employer hear ['em]2743-'em saying it , already ? It 's a fortune in itself , that name . Why , [sir]2259-sir , if [a grocer called [Boxon]186-boxon]2745-a grocer called boxon came at this moment , and offered to take [me]977-i into partnership on half profits , [I]977-i would n't listen to [him]2745-a grocer called boxon there ! "[977-i]

Naturally , all this did not pass without many a pang in [[Warburton]176-warburton 's sensitive spots]987-warburton 's sensitive spots . [He]988-him had set [his]988-him face like brass , or tried to do so ; but in the night season [he]988-him could all but have shed tears of humiliation , as [he]988-him tossed on [his]988-him comfortless pillow . The day was spent in visits to [wholesale grocery establishments]989-wholesale grocery establishments , in study of trade journals , in calculating innumerable petty questions of profit and loss . When nausea threatened [him]988-him : when an all but horror of what lay before [him]988-him assailed [his]988-him mind ; [he]988-him thought fixedly of [The Haws]59-the haws , and made a picture to [himself]988-him of [that peaceful little home devastated by [his]988-him own fault]990-that peaceful little home devastated by his own fault . And to think that all this sweat and misery arose from the need of gaining less than a couple of hundred pounds a year ! Life at [The Haws]59-the haws , a life of refinement and goodness and tranquillity such as can seldom be found , demanded only that a sum which [the wealthy vulgar]991-the wealthy vulgar throw away upon the foolish amusement of an hour . [Warburton]176-warburton had a tumultuous mind in reflecting on these things ; but the disturbance was salutary , bearing [him]988-him through trials of nerve and patience and self - respect which [he]988-him could not otherwise have endured .

[Warburton]176-warburton had now to find [cheap lodgings for [himself]176-warburton]992-cheap lodgings for himself , [unfurnished rooms in [some poor quarter]994-some poor quarter not too far from [the shop]2401-the shop]993-unfurnished rooms in some poor quarter not too far from the shop .

At length , in [a new little street of very red brick]996-a new little street of very red brick , not far from [Fulham Palace Road]82-fulham palace road at [the Hammersmith end]997-the hammersmith end , [he]988-him came upon [a small house]998-a small house which exhibited in [its]998-a small house parlour window a card inscribed : " [Two unfurnished rooms]2746-two unfurnished rooms to be let to [single gentlemen]2747-single gentlemen only . "[563-the landlady] The precision of this notice made [him]988-him hopeful , and a certain cleanliness of aspect in [the woman who opened to [him]988-him]999-the woman who opened to him was an added encouragement ; but [he]988-him found negotiations not altogether easy . [The landlady]563-the landlady , [a middle - aged widow]1001-a middle - aged widow , seemed to regard [him]988-him with some peculiar suspicion ; before even admitting [him]988-him to [the house]450-the house , [she]563-the landlady questioned [him]988-him closely as to [his]988-him business , [[his]988-him present place of abode]1003-his present place of abode , and so on , and [Warburton]176-warburton was all but turning away in impatience , when at last [she]563-the landlady drew aside , and cautiously invited [him]988-him to enter . Further acquaintance with [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick led [him]988-him to understand that the cold , misgiving in [her]223-mrs. wick eye , the sour rigidity of [her]223-mrs. wick lips , and [her]223-mrs. wick generally repellant manner , were characteristics which meant nothing in particular save as they resulted from a more or less hard life amid [[London]18-london 's crowd]1004-london 's crowd ; at present , [the woman]296-the woman annoyed [him]988-him , and only the clean freshness of [[her]223-mrs. wick vacant rooms]1006-her vacant rooms induced [him]988-him to take the trouble of coming to terms with [her]223-mrs. wick .

" There 's one thing [I]223-mrs. wick must say to [you]176-warburton quite plain , to begin with , "[223-mrs. wick] remarked [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , whose language , though not disrespectful , had a certain bluntness . " [I]223-mrs. wick ca n't admit [female visitors]2748-female visitors not on any excuse . "[223-mrs. wick]

Speaking thus , [she]563-the landlady set [her]563-the landlady face at its rigidest and sourest , and stared past [Warburton]176-warburton at the wall . [He]988-him , unable to repress a smile , declared [his]988-him perfect readiness to accept this condition of tenancy .

" Another thing , "[563-the landlady] pursued [the landlady]563-the landlady , " is that [I]563-the landlady do n't like late hours . "[563-the landlady] And [she]563-the landlady eyed [him]988-him as one might [a person caught in flagrant crapulence]1008-a person caught in flagrant crapulence at one o'clock a.m.

" Why , neither do [I]159-will , "[159-will] [Will]159-will replied . " But for all that , [I]159-will may be obliged to come [home]354-home late now and then . "[159-will]

" From [the theatre]2750-the theatre , [I]563-the landlady suppose ? "[563-the landlady]

" [I]223-mrs. wick very seldom go to [the theatre]2750-the theatre . "[223-mrs. wick] [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick looked sanguine for an instant , but at once relapsed into darker suspicion than ever . " But as to [my]223-mrs. wick hour of returning [home]354-home , [I]223-mrs. wick must have entire liberty . "[223-mrs. wick]

[The woman]296-the woman meditated , profound gloom on [her]296-the woman brows .

" [You]988-him have n't told [me]296-the woman , "[296-the woman] [she]296-the woman resumed , shooting a glance of keen distrust , " exactly what [your]988-him business may be . "[296-the woman]

" [I]159-will am in the sugar line , "[159-will] responded [Will]159-will .

" Sugar ? [You]988-him would n't mind giving [me]296-the woman the name of [[your]988-him employers]2753-your employers ? "[296-the woman]

The word so rasped on [Warburton]176-warburton 's sensitive temper that [he]159-will seemed about to speak angrily . This [the woman]296-the woman observed , and added at once :

" [I]296-the woman do n't doubt but that [you]988-him 're quite respectable , [sir]2259-sir , but [you]988-him can understand as [I]296-the woman have to be careful who [I]296-the woman take into [[my]296-the woman house]2691-my house . "[296-the woman]

" [I]296-the woman understand that , but [I]296-the woman must ask [you]988-him to be satisfied with a reference to [[my]296-the woman present landlord]2756-my present landlord . That , and a month 's payment in advance , ought to suffice . "[296-the woman]

Evidently it did , for [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , after shooting one or two more of [her]223-mrs. wick sharpest looks , declared [herself]223-mrs. wick willing to enter into discussion of details . [He]159-will required attendance , did [he]159-will ? Well it all depended upon what sort of attendance [he]159-will expected ; if [he]159-will wanted cooking at late hours . [Warburton]176-warburton cut short these anticipatory objections , and made known that [his]159-will wants were few and simple : plain breakfast at eight o'clock , cold supper on the table when [he]159-will came [home]354-home , a mid - day meal on Sundays , and the keeping of [[his]159-will rooms]1012-his rooms in order ; that was all . After morose reflection , [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick put [her]223-mrs. wick demand for [rooms]1013-rooms and service at a pound a week , but to this [Warburton]176-warburton demurred . It cost [him]159-will agonies to debate such a matter ; but , as [he]159-will knew very well , the price was excessive for unfurnished lodgings , and need constrained [him]159-will . [He]159-will offered fifteen shillings , and said [he]159-will would call for [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick 's decision on the morrow . [The landlady]563-the landlady allowed [him]159-will to go to the foot of the stairs , then stopped [him]159-will .

" [I]563-the landlady would n't mind taking fifteen shillings , "[563-the landlady] [she]563-the landlady said , " if [I]563-the landlady knew it was for a permanency . "[563-the landlady]

" [I]563-the landlady ca n't bind [myself]563-the landlady more than by the month . "[563-the landlady]

" Would [you]563-the landlady be willing to leave a deposit ? "[563-the landlady]

So the matter was settled , and [Warburton]176-warburton arranged to enter into possession that day week .

Without delay the shop repairs were finished , inside and out ; orders for stock were completed ; in two days as a great bill on the shutters announced " [[Jollyman]2757-jollyman 's Grocery Stores]2758-jollyman 's grocery stores "[563-the landlady] would be open to [the public]1015-the public . [Allchin]161-allchin pleaded strongly for the engagement of the brass band ; it would n't cost much , and the effect would be immense . [Warburton]176-warburton shrugged , hesitated , gave way , and [the band]1016-the band was engaged .

CHAPTER 19

[Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund was what [ladies]1017-ladies call [a good correspondent]1018-a good correspondent . [She]167-rosamund wrote often , [she]167-rosamund wrote at length , and was satisfied with few or brief letters in reply . Scarcely had [she]167-rosamund been a week at [Cairo]71-cairo , when some half dozen sheets of thin paper , covered with [her]167-rosamund small swift writing , were dispatched to [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , and , thence onwards , about once a fortnight such a letter arrived at [Walham Green]60-walham green . Sitting by a fire kept , for economical reasons , as low as possible , with [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother 's voice sounding querulously somewhere in [the house]450-the house , and too often a clammy fog at the window , [Bertha]183-bertha read of Egyptian delights and wonders , set glowingly before [her]183-bertha in [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's fluent style . [She]183-bertha was glad of the letters , for they manifested a true affection , and were in every way more interesting than any others that [she]183-bertha received ; but at times they made [the cheerless little house]1021-the cheerless little house seem more cheerless still , and the pang of contrast between [her]183-bertha life and [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's called at such moments for all [Bertha]183-bertha 's sense of humour to make it endurable .

Not that [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan represented [herself]167-rosamund as happy . In [her]164-miss elvan very first letter [she]164-miss elvan besought [Bertha]183-bertha not to suppose that [her]164-miss elvan appreciation of strange and beautiful things meant forgetfulness of what must be a lifelong sorrow . " [I]164-miss elvan am often worse than depressed . [I]164-miss elvan sleep very badly , and in the night [I]164-miss elvan often shed wretched tears . Though [I]164-miss elvan did only what conscience compelled [me]164-miss elvan to do , [I]164-miss elvan suffer all the miseries of remorse . And how can [I]164-miss elvan wish that it should be otherwise ? It is better , surely , to be capable of such suffering , than to go one 's way in light - hearted egoism . [I]164-miss elvan 'm not sure that [I]164-miss elvan do n't sometimes encourage despondency . [You]183-bertha can understand that ? [I]164-miss elvan know [you]183-bertha can , dear [Bertha]183-bertha , for many a time [I]164-miss elvan have detected the deep feeling which lies beneath [your]183-bertha joking way . "[164-miss elvan] Passages such as this [Bertha]183-bertha was careful to omit when reading from the letters to [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother . [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross took very little interest in [[[her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter 's friend]1024-her daughter 's friend , and regarded the broken engagement with no less disapproval than surprise ; but it would have gravely offended [her]174-mrs. cross if [Bertha]183-bertha had kept this correspondence altogether to [herself]183-bertha .

" [I]174-mrs. cross suppose , "[174-mrs. cross] [she]174-mrs. cross remarked , on one such occasion , " [we]2759-we shall never again see [Mr. Franks]160-franks . "[174-mrs. cross]

" [He]160-franks would find it rather awkward to call , no doubt , "[183-bertha] replied [Bertha]183-bertha .

" [I]174-mrs. cross shall never understand it ! "[174-mrs. cross] [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross exclaimed , in a vexed tone , after thinking awhile . " No doubt there 's something [you]183-bertha keep from [me]174-mrs. cross . "[174-mrs. cross]

" About [Rosamund]167-rosamund ? Nothing whatever , [I]174-mrs. cross assure [you]183-bertha , [mother]2480-mother . "[174-mrs. cross]

" Then [you]183-bertha [yourself]183-bertha do n't know all , that 's quite certain . "[174-mrs. cross]

[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross had made the remark many times , and always with the same satisfaction . [[Her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter was content that the discussion should remain at this point ; for the feeling that [she]477-her daughter had said something at once unpleasant and unanswerable made [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross almost good humoured for at least an hour .

Few were [the distressful lady]1026-the distressful lady 's sources of comfort , but one sure way of soothing [her]477-her daughter mind and temper , was to suggest some method of saving money , no matter how little . One day in the winter , [Bertha]183-bertha passing along [the further part of [Fulham Road]38-fulham road]1027-the further part of fulham road , noticed [a new - looking grocer]1028-a new - looking grocer 's , the window full of price tickets , some of them very attractive to [a housekeeper]1029-a housekeeper 's eye ; on returning [home]354-home [she]183-bertha spoke of this , mentioning figures which moved [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother to a sour effervescence of delight . [The shop]2401-the shop was rather too far away for convenience , but that same evening [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross went to inspect [it]2401-the shop , and came back quite flurried with what [she]174-mrs. cross had seen .

" [I]174-mrs. cross shall most certainly deal at [Jollyman]222-bertha 's , "[174-mrs. cross] [she]174-mrs. cross exclaimed . " What a pity [we]2761-we did n't know of [him]222-bertha before ! [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha is quite willing to send even the smallest orders . Is n't that nice of [him]222-bertha such a distance ! [Billings]224-billings was quite insolent to [me]174-mrs. cross the day before yesterday , when [I]174-mrs. cross asked [him]224-billings to send ; yet it was nearly a two - shilling order . It was not long before [Bertha]222-bertha had an opportunity of seeing [this remarkable shopkeeper]1035-this remarkable shopkeeper , and for once [she]1036-her was able to agree with [[her]1036-her mother]716-her mother . [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha bore very little resemblance to [the typical grocer]1038-the typical grocer , and each visit to [[his]222-bertha shop]1039-his shop strengthened [Bertha]222-bertha 's suspicion that [he]222-bertha had not grown up in this way of life . It cost [her]1036-her some constraint to make a very small purchase of [him]222-bertha , paying a few coppers , and still more when [she]1036-her asked [him]222-bertha if [he]222-bertha had nothing cheaper than this or that ; all the more so that [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha seemed to share [her]1036-her embarrassment , lowering [his]222-bertha voice as if involuntarily , and being careful not to meet [her]1036-her eye . The winter passed , and with the spring came events in which [Bertha]222-bertha was interested . [Mr. Elvan]226-mr. elvan , who for [his]226-mr. elvan health 's sake spent the winter in [the south - west of [France]34-france]1043-the south - west of france , fell so ill early in the year that [Rosamund]167-rosamund was summoned from [Egypt]65-egypt . With all speed [she]167-rosamund travelled to [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz . When [she]167-rosamund arrived , [[her]167-rosamund father]472-her father was no longer in danger ; but there seemed no hope of [his]472-her father being able to return to [England]23-england for some months , so [Rosamund]167-rosamund remained with [him]472-her father and [[her]167-rosamund sister]818-her sister , and was soon writing to [[her]167-rosamund friend]474-her friend at [Walham Green]60-walham green in a strain of revived enthusiasm for [the country of [the Basques]1048-the basques]1047-the country of the basques . A postscript to one of these letters , written in the middle of May , ran as follows : " [I]1049-rosamund 's correspondent hear that N. F. has a picture in [the Academy]2312-the academy called ' [A Ministering Angel]2780-a ministering angel , ' and that it promises to be one of the most popular of the year . Have [you]222-bertha seen it ? "[1049-rosamund 's correspondent] To this , [[Rosamund]167-rosamund 's correspondent]1049-rosamund 's correspondent was able to reply that [she]1049-rosamund 's correspondent had seen " N.F 's "[1049-rosamund 's correspondent] picture , and that it certainly was a good deal talked about ; [she]1049-rosamund 's correspondent added no opinion as to the merits of the painting , and , in [her]1049-rosamund 's correspondent next letter , [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan left the subject untouched . At this point , [the reader]1051-the reader 's smile threatened laughter . But , feeling sure that [[her]167-rosamund friend]474-her friend , if guilty of affectation , was quite unconscious of it , [she]167-rosamund composed [her]167-rosamund face to read gravely on .

" [A soul]2783-a soul 's tragedy , [Bertha]222-bertha , and [I]167-rosamund the cause of it [One]2293-one can see now , but too well , what is before [him]389-the painter . [He]389-the painter will become [a popular painter]2785-a popular painter one of those whose name is familiar to [the crowd]2786-the crowd , like "[167-rosamund] instances were cited . " [I]167-rosamund can say , with all earnestness , that [I]167-rosamund had rather have seen [him]389-the painter starved to death . Poor , poor N. F. ! Could [he]389-the painter so rapidly sink to this , if [he]389-the painter were indeed [the man [I]167-rosamund thought [him]389-the painter]2787-the man i thought him ? Would [he]389-the painter not rather have oh , have done anything ? Yet this may be only a temptation of [my]167-rosamund lower self , a way of giving ease to [my]167-rosamund conscience . When [I]167-rosamund saw ' [Sanctuary]85-sanctuary , ' why had [I]167-rosamund not the courage to tell [him]389-the painter what [I]167-rosamund thought ? The paper rustled in [Bertha]222-bertha 's hand ; [her]1053-i shoulders shook ; [she]1053-i could no longer restrain the merry laugh . When [she]1053-i sat down to answer [Rosamund]167-rosamund , a roguish smile played about [her]1053-i lips .

The newspaper cutting showed an item of news interesting alike to the fashionable and the artistic world . [Mr. Norbert Franks]160-franks , [the young painter whose Academy picture had been so much discussed]1054-the young painter whose academy picture had been so much discussed , was about to paint the portrait of [Lady Rockett]229-lady rockett , recently espoused wife of [Sir Samuel Rockett]200-sam , [the Australian millionaire]1055-the australian millionaire . " Exponent "[160-franks] was the word .

CHAPTER 20

In these summer days , whilst [Norbert Franks]160-franks was achieving popularity , success in humbler guise came to [the humorous and much - enduring artist at [Walham Green]60-walham green]1059-the humorous and much - enduring artist at walham green . For a year or two , [Bertha Cross]183-bertha had spent what time [she]183-bertha could spare upon the illustration of a quaint old story - book , a book which had amused [her]183-bertha own childhood , and still held its place in [her]183-bertha affection . The work was now finished ; [she]183-bertha showed it to [a publisher of [her]183-bertha acquaintance]1060-a publisher of her acquaintance , who at once offered to purchase it on what seemed to [Bertha]183-bertha excellent terms . Of [her]183-bertha own abilities [she]183-bertha thought very modestly in deed , and had always been surprised when [any one]2536-any one consented to pay oftener in shillings than in pounds for work which had cost [her]183-bertha an infinity of conscientious trouble ; now , however , [she]183-bertha suspected that [she]183-bertha had done something not altogether bad , and [she]183-bertha spoke of it in a letter to [Rosamund Elvan]167-rosamund , still in [the country of [the Basques]1048-the basques]1047-the country of the basques .

" As [you]167-rosamund know , "[167-rosamund] [Rosamund]167-rosamund replied , " [I]167-rosamund have never doubted that [you]167-rosamund would make a success one day , for [you]167-rosamund are wonderfully clever , and only need a little more self - confidence in making [yourself]167-rosamund known . [I]167-rosamund wish [I]167-rosamund could feel anything like so sure of earning money . For [I]167-rosamund shall have to , that is now certain . [Poor father]2796-poor father , who gets weaker and weaker , talked to [us]2797-us the other day about what [we]2797-us could expect after [his]2796-poor father death ; and it will be only just a little sum for each of [us]2797-us , nothing like enough to invest and live upon . [I]167-rosamund am working at [my]167-rosamund water - colours , and [I]167-rosamund have been trying pastel there 's no end of good material here . When the end comes and it ca n't be long [I]167-rosamund must go to [London]18-london , and see whether [my]167-rosamund things have any market value . [I]167-rosamund do n't like the prospect of life in a garret on bread and water by [myself]167-rosamund , that is . [You]167-rosamund know how joyfully , gladly , proudly , [I]167-rosamund would have accepted it , under other circumstances . If [I]167-rosamund had real talent [myself]167-rosamund but [I]167-rosamund feel more than doubtful about that . [I]167-rosamund pray that [I]167-rosamund may not fall too low . Can [I]167-rosamund trust [you]167-rosamund to overwhelm [me]167-rosamund with scorn , if [I]167-rosamund seem in danger of doing vulgar work ? "[167-rosamund]

[Bertha]183-bertha yielded to the temptations of a later summer rich in warmth and hue , and made little excursions by [herself]183-bertha into [the country]2354-the country , leaving [home]354-home before [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother was up in the morning , and coming back after sunset . [Her]183-bertha sketching materials and a packet of sandwiches were but a light burden ; [she]183-bertha was [a good walker]1067-a good walker ; and the shilling or two spent on the railway , which formerly [she]183-bertha could not have spared , no longer frightened [her]183-bertha .

In this way , one morning of September , [she]183-bertha went by [early train]1068-early train as far as [Epsom]40-epsom , walked through [the streets]398-the streets , and came into [that high - banked lane which leads up to [the downs]1071-the downs]1070-that high - banked lane which leads up to the downs . Blackberries shone thick upon the brambles , and above , even to the very tops of the hedge - row trees , climbed [the hoary clematis]1072-the hoary clematis . Glad in this leafy solitude , [Bertha]183-bertha rambled slowly on . [She]183-bertha made no unpleasing figure against [the rural background]1073-the rural background , for [she]183-bertha was straight and slim , graceful in [her]183-bertha movements , and had a face from which [no one]1074-no one would have turned indifferently , so bright was it with youthful enjoyment and with older thought .

Whilst thus [she]183-bertha lingered , a footstep approached , that of [a man who was walking in the same direction]1075-a man who was walking in the same direction . When close to [her]183-bertha , [this pedestrian]1076-this pedestrian stopped , and [his]1076-this pedestrian voice startled [Bertha]183-bertha with unexpected greeting . [The speaker]747-the speaker was [Norbert Franks]160-franks .

" How glad [I]160-franks am to see [you]183-bertha ! "[160-franks] [he]160-franks exclaimed , in a tone and with a look which vouched for [his]160-franks sincerity . " [I]160-franks ought to have been to [Walham Green]60-walham green long ago . Again and again [I]160-franks meant to come . But this is jolly ; [I]160-franks like chance meetings . Are [you]183-bertha often down here in [Surrey]33-surrey ? "[160-franks]

With amusement [Bertha]183-bertha remarked the evidence of prosperity in [Franks]160-franks ' dress and bearing ; [he]160-franks had changed notably since the days when [he]160-franks used to come to [[their]1078-their little house]1079-their little house to talk of [Rosamund]167-rosamund , and was glad of an indifferent cup of tea . [He]160-franks seemed to be in very fair health , [his]160-franks countenance giving no hint of sentimental sorrows .

[Franks]160-franks noticed a bunch of tinted leafage which [she]183-bertha was carrying , and spoke of its beauty .

" Going to make use of them , no doubt . What are [you]160-franks working at just now ? "[160-franks]

[Bertha]183-bertha told of [her]183-bertha recent success with the illustrated story - book , and [Franks]160-franks declared [himself]160-franks delighted . Clearly , [he]160-franks was in the mood to be delighted with everything . Between [his]160-franks remarks , which were uttered in the sprightliest tone , [he]160-franks hummed phrases of melody .

" [Your]160-franks Academy picture was a great success , "[183-bertha] said [Bertha]183-bertha , discreetly watching [him]160-franks as [she]183-bertha spoke .

CHAPTER 21

It was a week or two after the day in [Surrey]33-surrey , that [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , needing a small wooden box in which to pack a present for [[her]183-bertha brothers]692-her brothers in [British Columbia]62-british columbia , bethought [herself]183-bertha of [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha .
