CHAPTER 22

Just a year since the day when [Allchin]161-allchin 's band played at the first floor windows above [[Jollyman]222-bertha 's new grocery stores]1100-jollyman 's new grocery stores .

From the very beginning , business promised well . [He]222-bertha and [[his]222-bertha assistant]1101-his assistant had plenty of work ; there was little time for meditation ; when not serving [customers]2399-customers , [he]222-bertha was busy with practical details of grocerdom , often such as [he]222-bertha had not foreseen , matters which called for all [his]222-bertha energy and ingenuity . A gratifying aspect of the life was that , day by day , [he]222-bertha handled [his]222-bertha returns in solid cash . [Jollyman]2757-jollyman 's gave no credit ; all goods had to be paid for on purchase or delivery ; and to turn out the till when [the shop]2401-the shop had closed to make piles of silver and mountains of copper , with a few pieces of gold beside them put a cheering end to the day 's labour . [Warburton]176-warburton found [himself]176-warburton clinking handfuls of coin , pleased with the sound . Only at the end of the first three months , the close of the year , did [he]222-bertha perceive that much less than [he]222-bertha had hoped of the cash taken could be reckoned as clear profit . [He]222-bertha had much to learn in the cunning of retail trade , and it was a kind of study that went sorely against the grain with [him]222-bertha . Happily , at Christmas time came [Norbert]160-franks Franks whom [Will]159-will had decided not to take into [his]159-will confidence and paid [his]159-will debt of a hundred and twenty pounds . This set things right for the moment . [Will]159-will was able to pay a three - and - a - half per cent . dividend to [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister , and to fare ahead hopefully .

[He]159-will would rather not have gone down to The Haws that Christmastide , but feared that [his]159-will failure to do so might seem strange . The needful prevarication cost [him]222-bertha so many pangs that [he]222-bertha came very near to confessing the truth ; [he]222-bertha probably would have done so , had not [[his]222-bertha mother]346-his mother been ailing , and , it seemed to [him]222-bertha , little able to bear the shock of such a disclosure . So the honest deception went on . [Will]159-will was supposed to be managing [a [London]18-london branch of [the Applegarth business]1109-the applegarth business]1108-a london branch of the applegarth business . Great expenditure on advertising had to account for the smallness of the dividend at first . [No one less likely than [the ladies at [The Haws]597-the haws]1111-the ladies at the haws]1110-no one less likely than the ladies at the haws to make trouble in such a matter . [They]1111-the ladies at the haws had what sufficed to [them]1111-the ladies at the haws , and were content with it . Thinking over this in shame - faced solitude , [Warburton]176-warburton felt a glow of proud thankfulness that [[his]222-bertha mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister were so unlike the vulgar average of [mankind that rapacious multitude , whom nothing animates but a chance of gain , with whom nothing weighs but a commercial argument]1115-mankind that rapacious multitude , whom nothing animates but a chance of gain , with whom nothing weighs but a commercial argument . A new tenderness stirred within [him]222-bertha , and resolutely [he]222-bertha stamped under foot the impulses of self - esteem , of self - indulgence , which made [his]222-bertha life hard to bear .

It was with a hard satisfaction that [he]222-bertha returned to [the shop]2401-the shop , and found all going on in the usual way , [Allchin]161-allchin grinning a hearty welcome as [he]222-bertha weighed out sugar . [[Will]159-will 's sister]1117-will 's sister talked of the scents of [[her]1117-will 's sister garden]1118-her garden , how [they]1119-they refreshed and inspirited [her]1117-will 's sister to [him]159-will , the odour of [the shop]2401-the shop new - roasted coffee predominated to - day had its invigorating effect ; it meant money , and money meant life , the peaceful , fruitful life of [those dear to [him]159-will]1121-those dear to him . [He]159-will scarcely gave [himself]159-will time to eat dinner , laid for [him]159-will , as usual , by [Mrs. Allchin]161-allchin , in [the sitting - room behind [the shop]2401-the shop]1122-the sitting - room behind the shop ; so eager was [he]159-will to get on [his]159-will apron , and return to profitable labour .

At first , [he]159-will had endured a good deal of physical fatigue . Standing for so many hours a day wearied [him]159-will much more than walking would have done , and with bodily exhaustion came at times a lowness of spirits such as [he]159-will had never felt . [His]159-will resource against this misery was conversation with [Allchin]161-allchin . In [Allchin]161-allchin [he]159-will had [a henchman whose sturdy optimism and gross common sense were of the utmost value]1124-a henchman whose sturdy optimism and gross common sense were of the utmost value . [The brawny assistant]1125-the brawny assistant , having speedily found [a lodger]699-a lodger according to the agreement , saw [himself]159-will in clover , and determined that , if [he]159-will could help it , [his]159-will fortunes should never again suffer eclipse . [He]159-will and [[his]159-will wife]569-his wife felt a reasonable gratitude to [the founder of [their]1129-their prosperity whom , by the bye , [they]1129-their invariably spoke of as " [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha "[1129-their] and did [their]1129-their best to smooth for [him]159-will the unfamiliar path [he]159-will was treading]1128-the founder of their prosperity whom , by the bye , they invariably spoke of as " mr. jollyman " and did their best to smooth for him the unfamiliar path he was treading .

The success with which [Warburton]176-warburton kept [his]159-will secret , merely proved how solitary [most men]1130-most men are amid [the crowds of [London]18-london]1131-the crowds of london , and how easy it is for [a Londoner]393-a londoner to disappear from among [[his]393-a londoner acquaintances]916-his acquaintances whilst continuing to live openly amid [the city]395-the city 's roar . [No one of those who cared enough about [him]159-will]1135-no one of those who cared enough about him to learn that [he]159-will had fallen on ill - luck harboured the slightest suspicion of what [he]159-will was doing ; [he]159-will simply dropped out of sight , except for [the two or three who , in a real sense of the word]1136-the two or three who , in a real sense of the word , could be called [[his]159-will friends]898-his friends . [They]1140-they were not quite on the old terms , for each had gone through a crisis of life , and was not altogether the same as before ; but [their]1140-they mutual liking subsisted . Obliged to retrench [his]159-will hospitality , [Warburton]176-warburton never seemed altogether at [his]159-will ease when [Franks]160-franks was in [[his]160-franks room]910-his room ; nor could [he]159-will overcome what seemed to [him]159-will the shame of having asked payment of a debt from [a needy friend]1142-a needy friend , notwithstanding the fact , loudly declared by [Franks]160-franks [himself]160-franks , that nothing could have been more beneficial to [the debtor]1143-the debtor 's moral health . So [Will]159-will listened rather than talked , and was sometimes too obviously in no mood for any sort of converse .

Sherwood [he]159-will had not seen since [the disastrous optimist]1144-the disastrous optimist 's flight into [Wales]90-wales ; nor had there come any remittance from [him]159-will since the cheque for a hundred pounds . Two or three times , however , [Godfrey]177-sherwood had written thoroughly characteristic letters warm , sanguine , self - reproachful . From [Wales]90-wales [he]177-sherwood had crossed over to [Ireland]91-ireland , where [he]177-sherwood was working at a scheme for making a fortune out of Irish eggs and poultry . In what the " work "[177-sherwood] consisted , was not clear , for [he]177-sherwood had no money , beyond a small loan from [[his]177-sherwood relative]940-his relative which enabled [him]177-sherwood to live ; but [he]177-sherwood sent a sheet of foolscap covered with computations whereby [his]177-sherwood project was proved to be thoroughly practical and vastly lucrative .

Meanwhile , [he]177-sherwood had made one new acquaintance , which was at first merely a source of amusement to [him]177-sherwood , but little by little became something more . In the winter days , when [his]177-sherwood business was new , there one day came into [the shop]2401-the shop [a rather sour - lipped and querulous - voiced lady , who after much discussion of prices]1147-a rather sour - lipped and querulous - voiced lady , who after much discussion of prices , made a modest purchase and asked that the goods might be sent for [her]1147-a rather sour - lipped and querulous - voiced lady , who after much discussion of prices . Facial resemblance there was none discoverable ; in bearing , in look , in tone , [the two]682-the two were different as [women]2496-women could be ; but at [the younger lady]1157-the younger lady 's second visit , [his]159-will surmise was confirmed , for [she]1157-the younger lady begged [him]159-will to change a five - pound note , and , as the custom is in [London shops]1158-london shops , endorsed it with [her]1157-the younger lady name " [Bertha Cross]183-bertha . "[1157-the younger lady] [Franks]160-franks had never spoken much of [Miss Cross]183-bertha ; " rather [a nice sort of girl]2822-a nice sort of girl , "[160-franks] was as far as [his]160-franks appreciation went . Then , [her]1157-the younger lady way of speaking , which was altogether [her]1157-the younger lady own . It infused with a humorous possibility the driest , most matter - of - fact remarks , and [Will]159-will had to guard [himself]159-will against the temptation to reply in a corresponding note .

" [I]159-will suppose [you]160-franks see no more of [those people]2823-those people what 's [their]2823-those people name [the Crosses]2824-the crosses ? "[159-will] [he]159-will let fall , as if casually , one evening when [Franks]160-franks had come to see [him]159-will .

CHAPTER 23

Was [he]159-will to be [a grocer]492-a grocer for the rest of [his]159-will life ? This question , which at first scarcely occurred to [him]159-will , absorbed as [he]159-will was in the problem of money - earning for immediate needs , at length began to press and worry . Of course [he]159-will had meant nothing of the kind ; [his]159-will imagination had seen in [the shop]2401-the shop a temporary expedient ; [he]159-will had not troubled to pursue the ultimate probabilities of the life that lay before [him]159-will , but contented [himself]159-will with the vague assurance of [his]159-will hopeful temper . Yet where was the way out ? To save money , to accumulate sufficient capital for [his]159-will release , was an impossibility , at all events within any reasonable time . And for what windfall could [he]159-will look ? [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's ten thousand pounds hovered in [his]159-will memory , but no more substantial than any fairy - tale . [No man]877-no man living , it seemed to [him]159-will , had less chance of being signally favoured by fortune . [He]159-will had donned [his]159-will apron and aproned [he]159-will must remain .

Suppose , then , [he]159-will so far succeeded in [his]159-will business as to make a little more than [the household at [St. Neots]49-st. neots]1166-the household at st. neots required ; suppose it became practicable to well , say , to think of marriage , of course on the most modest basis ; could [he]159-will quite see [himself]159-will offering to [the girl [he]159-will chose the hand and heart of [a grocer]492-a grocer]1167-the girl he chose the hand and heart of a grocer ? [He]159-will laughed . It was well to laugh ; merriment is the great digestive , and an unspeakable boon to [the man capable of it in all but every situation]1169-the man capable of it in all but every situation ; but what if [she]1167-the girl he chose the hand and heart of a grocer also laughed , and not in the sympathetic way ? Worse still , what if [she]1167-the girl he chose the hand and heart of a grocer could not laugh , but looked wretchedly embarrassed , confused , shamed ? That would be a crisis it needed some philosophy to contemplate .

For the present , common sense made it rigorously plain to [him]159-will that the less [he]159-will thought of these things , the better . [He]159-will had not a penny to spare . Only by exercising an economy which in the old days would have appalled [him]159-will , could [he]159-will send [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister an annual sum just sufficient to [their]1172-their needs . [He]159-will [who scorned and loathed all kinds of parsimony]1173-who scorned and loathed all kinds of parsimony had learnt to cut down [his]159-will expenditure at every possible point . [He]159-will still smoked [his]159-will pipe ; [he]159-will bought newspapers ; [he]159-will granted [himself]159-will an excursion , of the cheapest , on fine Sundays ; but these surely were necessities of life . In food and clothing and the common expenses of [a civilised man]2654-a civilised man , [he]159-will pinched remorselessly ; there was no choice . [[His]159-will lodgings]1175-his lodgings cost [him]159-will very little ; but [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , whose profound suspiciousness was allied with unperfect honesty , now and then made paltry overcharges in [her]223-mrs. wick bill , and [he]159-will was angry with [himself]159-will for [his]159-will want of courage to resist [them]1176-them . It meant only a shilling or two , but retail trade had taught [him]159-will the importance of shillings . [He]159-will had to remind [himself]159-will that , if [he]159-will was poor , [[his]159-will landlady]2607-his landlady was poorer still , and that in cheating [him]159-will [she]2607-his landlady did but follow the traditions of [[her]2607-his landlady class]1178-her class . To debate an excess of sixpence for paraffin , of ninepence for bacon , would have made [him]159-will flush and grind [his]159-will teeth for hours afterwards ; but [he]159-will noticed the effect upon [himself]159-will of the new habit of niggardliness how it disposed [him]159-will to acerbity of temper . No matter how pure the motive , [a man]2336-a man can not devote [his]2336-a man days to squeezing out pecuniary profits without some moral detriment . Formerly [this woman]1180-this woman , [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , with [her]1180-this woman gimlet eyes , and [her]1180-this woman leech lips , with [her]1180-this woman spyings and eavesdroppings , with [her]1180-this woman sour civility , [her]1180-this woman stinted discharge of obligations , [her]1180-this woman pilferings and mendacities , would have rather amused than annoyed [him]159-will . " [Poor creature]2825-poor creature , is n't it a miserable as well as a sordid life . Let [her]1180-this woman have [her]1180-this woman pickings , however illegitimate , and much good may [they]2826-they do [her]1180-this woman . "[296-the woman] Now [he]159-will too often found [himself]159-will regarding [her]1180-this woman with something like animosity , whereby , to be sure , [he]159-will brought [himself]159-will to [the woman]296-the woman 's level . Was it not a struggle between [him]159-will and [her]1180-this woman for a share of life 's poorest comforts ? When [he]159-will looked at it in that light , [his]159-will cheeks were hot .

[A tradesman]968-a tradesman must harden [himself]159-will . Why , in the early months , it cost [him]159-will a wrench somewhere to take coppers at the counter from [very poor folk who perhaps made up the odd halfpenny in farthings]1183-very poor folk who perhaps made up the odd halfpenny in farthings , and looked at the coins reluctantly as [they]1183-very poor folk who perhaps made up the odd halfpenny in farthings laid them down . More than once , [he]159-will said , " Oh never mind the ha'penny , "[159-will] and was met with a look not of gratitude but of blank amazement . [Allchin]161-allchin happened to be [a witness of one such incident]1184-a witness of one such incident , and , in the first moment of privacy , ventured a respectful yet a most energetic , protest . " It 's the kindness of [your]159-will ' eart , [sir]2259-sir , and if [anybody]2377-anybody knows how much of that [you]159-will have , [I]159-will 'm sure it 's [me]159-will , and [I]159-will ought to be the last to find fault with it . But that 'll never do behind the counter , [sir]2259-sir , never ! Why , just think . The profit on what [that woman]2830-that woman bought was just three farthings . "[159-will] [He]159-will detailed the computation . " And there [you]159-will 've been and given [her]2830-that woman a whole ha'penny , so that [you]159-will 've only one blessed farthing over on the whole transaction ! That ai n't business , [sir]2259-sir ; that 's charity ; and [Jollyman]2757-jollyman 's ai n't a charitable institution . [You]159-will really must not , [sir]2259-sir . It 's unjust to [yourself]159-will . "[159-will] And [Will]159-will , with an uneasy shrug , admitted [his]159-will folly . But [he]159-will was ashamed to the core . Only in the second half - year did [he]159-will really accustom [himself]159-will to disregard [a customer]2380-a customer 's poverty . [He]159-will had thought the thing out , faced all its most sordid aspects . Yes , [he]159-will was fighting with [these people]1186-these people for daily bread ; [he]159-will and [his]159-will could live only if [his]159-will three farthings of profit were plucked out of that toil worn hand of [charwoman]1187-charwoman or [sempstress]1188-sempstress . Accept the necessity , and think no more of it . [He]159-will was [a man behind the counter]1189-a man behind the counter ; [he]159-will saw face to face [the people who supported [him]159-will]1190-the people who supported him . With this exception had not things been just the same when [he]159-will sat in [the counting - house]1191-the counting - house at [the sugar refinery]1192-the sugar refinery ? It was an unpleasant truth , which appearances had formerly veiled from [him]159-will .

With the beginning of [his]159-will second winter came a new anxiety , a new source of bitter and degrading reflections . At not more than five minutes ' walk away , [another grocer]1193-another grocer started business ; happily [no great capitalist]1194-no great capitalist , but to all appearances [a man of enterprise who knew what [he]1193-another grocer was about]1195-a man of enterprise who knew what he was about . Morning and evening , [Warburton]176-warburton passed [the new shop]1196-the new shop and felt [his]159-will very soul turn sour in the thought that [he]159-will must do what in [him]159-will lay to prevent [that man]2776-that man from gaining custom ; if [he]159-will could make [his]159-will business a failure , destroy all [his]159-will hopes , so much the better . With [Allchin]161-allchin , [he]159-will held long and eager conferences . [The robust assistant]1198-the robust assistant was of course troubled by no scruples ; [he]1198-the robust assistant warmed to the combat , chuckled over each good idea for [the enemy]1199-the enemy 's defeat ; every nerve must be strained for the great Christmas engagement ; as much money as possible must be spent in making a brave show . And it was only by pausing every now and then to remember why [he]1198-the robust assistant stood here , in what cause [he]1198-the robust assistant was so debasing the manner of [his]1198-the robust assistant life , that [Warburton]176-warburton could find strength to go through such a trial of body and of spirit . When , the Christmas fight well over , with manifest triumph on [his]1198-the robust assistant side [he]1198-the robust assistant went down for a couple of days to [St. Neots]49-st. neots , once more [he]1198-the robust assistant had [his]1198-the robust assistant reward . But the struggle was telling upon [his]1198-the robust assistant health ; it showed in [his]1198-the robust assistant face , in [his]1198-the robust assistant bearing . [Mother]230-mother and [sister]2444-sister spoke uneasily of a change [they]1201-they noticed ; surely [he]1198-the robust assistant was working too hard ; what did [he]1198-the robust assistant mean by taking no summer holiday ? [Will]159-will laughed .

" Business , business ! A good deal to do at first , [you]160-franks know . Things'll be smoother next year . "[159-will]

And the comfort , the quiet , the simple contentment of [that little house]1202-that little house by [the Ouse]58-the ouse , sent [him]159-will back to [Fulham Road]38-fulham road , once more resigned , courageous .

Naturally , [he]159-will sometimes contrasted [his]159-will own sordid existence with the unforeseen success which had made such changes in the life of [Norbert Franks]160-franks . It was more than three months since [he]159-will and [Franks]160-franks had met , when , one day early in January , [he]159-will received a note from [the artist]329-the artist . " What has become of [you]160-franks ? [I]329-the artist have n't had a chance of getting [your]160-franks way work and social foolery . "[329-the artist] So on Sunday , [Warburton]176-warburton went to [[[his]159-will friend]321-his friend 's new studio , which was in [the [Holland Park]92-holland park region]1206-the holland park region]1205-his friend 's new studio , which was in the holland park region . Formerly it was always [he]321-his friend who played [the host]1207-the host , and [he]321-his friend did not like this change of positions ; but [Franks]160-franks , however sensible of [his]160-franks good luck , and inclined at times to take [himself]160-franks rather seriously , had no touch of the snob in [his]160-franks temper ; when with [him]160-franks , [Will]159-will generally lost sight of unpleasant things in good - natured amusement . To - day , however , grocerdom lay heavily on [his]159-will soul . On the return journey from [St. Neots]49-st. neots [he]159-will had caught a cold , and a week of sore throat behind the counter a week too , of quarrel with [a wholesale house which had been cheating [him]159-will]1208-a wholesale house which had been cheating him left [his]159-will nerves in a bad state . For reply to [the artist]329-the artist 's cordial greeting [he]159-will could only growl inarticulately .

The soft humming of a gong summoned [them]1217-them to [another room]1218-another room , where lunch was ready . When [they]1217-them returned to [the studio]2461-the studio , to smoke by the fireside , only a casual word broke the cheerless silence .

And [Will]159-will went out into the frosty gloom .

CHAPTER 24

By way of [Allchin]161-allchin , who knew all the gossip of [the neighbourhood]1223-the neighbourhood , [Warburton]176-warburton learnt that [[his]1224-his new competitor in trade]1225-his new competitor in trade was [a man with [five children]1227-five children]1226-a man with five children and [a wife given to drink]1228-a wife given to drink ; [he]1226-a man with five children had been in business in [another part of [London]18-london]1229-another part of london , and was suspected to have removed with the hope that new surroundings might help [[his]1226-a man with five children wife]569-his wife to overcome [her]569-his wife disastrous failing . [A very respectable man]1231-a very respectable man , [people]2321-people said ; [kind husband]1233-kind husband , [good father]1234-good father , [honest dealer]1235-honest dealer . But [Allchin]161-allchin reported , with a twinkle of the eye , that all [his]1226-a man with five children capital had gone in the new start , and it was already clear that [his]1226-a man with five children business did not thrive .

" [We]2855-we shall starve [him]1226-a man with five children out ! "[972-the assistant] cried [the assistant]972-the assistant , snapping [his]972-the assistant thumb and finger .

" And what 'll become of [him]1226-a man with five children then ? "[159-will] asked [Will]159-will .

" Oh , that 's for [him]1226-a man with five children to think about , "[161-allchin] replied [Allchin]161-allchin . " Would n't [he]1226-a man with five children starve [us]2855-we , if [he]1226-a man with five children could , [sir]2259-sir ? "[161-allchin]

And [Warburton]176-warburton , brooding on this matter , stood appalled at the ferocity of the struggle amid which [he]1226-a man with five children lived , in which [he]1226-a man with five children had [his]1226-a man with five children part . Gone was all [his]1226-a man with five children old enjoyment of [the streets of [London]18-london]1237-the streets of london . In looking back upon [his]1226-a man with five children mood of that earlier day , [he]1226-a man with five children saw [himself]1226-a man with five children as [an incredibly ignorant and careless man]1238-an incredibly ignorant and careless man ; marvelled at the lightness of heart which had enabled [him]1226-a man with five children to find amusement in rambling over this vast slaughter - strewn field of battle . Picturesque , forsooth ! Where was its picturesqueness for [that struggling , soon - to - be - defeated tradesman]1239-that struggling , soon - to - be - defeated tradesman , with [[his]1239-that struggling , soon - to - be - defeated tradesman tipsy wife]1240-his tipsy wife , and [band of [children]2532-children who looked to [him]1239-that struggling , soon - to - be - defeated tradesman for bread]1241-band of children who looked to him for bread ? " And [I]159-will [myself]159-will am crushing [the man]2363-the man as surely as if [I]159-will had [my]159-will hand on [his]2363-the man gullet and [my]159-will knee on [his]2363-the man chest ! Crush [him]2363-the man [I]159-will must ; otherwise , what becomes of [that little home down at [St. Neots]49-st. neots dear to [me]159-will]2858-that little home down at st. neots dear to me as [[his]2363-the man children]2859-his children are to [him]2363-the man . There 's [no room for both of [us]2861-us]2860-no room for both of us ; [he]2363-the man has come too near ; [he]2363-the man must pay the penalty of [his]2363-the man miscalculation . Is there not [the workhouse]2862-the workhouse for [such people]2863-such people ? "[159-will] And [Will]159-will went about repeating to [himself]159-will . " There 's [the workhouse]2862-the workhouse do n't [I]159-will pay poor - rates ? [the workhouse]2862-the workhouse is [an admirable institution]2866-an admirable institution . "[159-will]

[He]159-will lay awake many an hour of these winter nights , seeing in vision [his]159-will own life and the life of [man]914-man . [He]159-will remembered [the office in [Little Ailie Street]21-little ailie street]1244-the office in little ailie street ; saw [himself]159-will and [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood sitting together , talking , laughing , making a jest of [their]1245-they effort to support [a doomed house]1246-a doomed house . [Godfrey]177-sherwood used to repeat legends , sagas , stories of travel , as though existence had not a care , or the possibility of one ; and [he]177-sherwood , in turn , talked about [some bit of [London]18-london [he]177-sherwood had been exploring]1247-some bit of london he had been exploring , showed an old map [he]177-sherwood had picked up , an old volume of [London]18-london topography . The while , world - wide forces , the hunger - struggle of [nations]1248-nations , were shaking the roof above [their]1245-they heads . Theoretically [they]1245-they knew it . But [they]1245-they could escape in time ; [they]1245-they had a cosy little corner preserved for [themselves]1245-they , safe from these pestilent worries . [Fate]232-fate has a grudge against the foolishly secure . If [he]159-will laughed now , it was in self - mockery .

The night of [London]18-london , always rife with mysterious sounds , spoke dreadfully to [his]159-will straining ear . [He]159-will heard voices near and far , cries of pain or of misery , shouts savage or bestial ; over and through all , that low , far - off rumble or roar , which never for a moment ceases , the groan , as it seemed , of suffering multitudes . There tripped before [his]159-will dreaming eyes a procession from the world of wealth and pleasure , and the amazement with which [he]159-will viewed it changed of a sudden to fiery wrath ; [he]159-will tossed upon the bed , uttered [his]159-will rage in a loud exclamation , felt [his]159-will heart pierced with misery which brought [him]159-will all but to tears . Close upon astonishment and indignation followed dread . Given health and strength , [he]159-will might perhaps continue to hold [his]159-will own in this merciless conflict ; perhaps , only ; but what if some accident , such as befalls [this man]1249-this man or that in every moment of time , threw [him]159-will among [the weaklings]1250-the weaklings ? [He]159-will saw [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother , in [her]346-his mother age and ill - health , reduced to the pittance of [the poorest]1252-the poorest ; [[his]159-will sister]663-his sister going forth to earn [her]663-his sister living ; [himself]159-will , a helpless burden upon both . Nay , was there not rat - poison to be purchased ?

How [he]159-will cried within [himself]159-will how , in the name of sense and mercy , is [mankind]1254-mankind content to live on in such a world as this ? By what devil are [they]1255-they hunted , that , not only do [they]1255-they neglect the means of solace suggested to every humane and rational mind , but , the vast majority of [them]1255-they spend all [their]1255-they strength and ingenuity in embittering [the common lot]1256-the common lot ? Overwhelmed by the hateful unreason of it all , [he]159-will felt as though [his]159-will brain reeled on the verge of madness .

Every day , and all the day long , [the shop]2401-the shop , the counter . Had [he]159-will chosen , [he]159-will might have taken a half - holiday , now and then ; on certain days [Allchin]161-allchin was quite able , and abundantly willing , to manage alone ; but what was the use ? To go to a distance was merely to see with more distinctness the squalor of [his]159-will position . Never for a moment was [he]159-will tempted to abandon this work ; [he]159-will saw no hope whatever of earning money in any other way , and money [he]159-will must needs earn , as long as [he]159-will lived . But the life weighed upon [him]159-will with a burden such as [he]159-will had never imagined . Never had [he]159-will understood before what was meant by the sickening weariness of routine ; [his]159-will fretfulness as [a youth in [the West Indies]53-the west indies]1258-a youth in the west indies seemed to [him]159-will now inconceivable . [[His]159-will own master]1259-his own master ? Why , [he]159-will was [the slave of [every kitchen wench who came into [the shop]2401-the shop to spend a penny]1261-every kitchen wench who came into the shop to spend a penny]1260-the slave of every kitchen wench who came into the shop to spend a penny ; [he]159-will trembled at the thought of failing to please [her]1261-every kitchen wench who came into the shop to spend a penny , and so losing [her]1261-every kitchen wench who came into the shop to spend a penny custom . The grocery odours , once pleasant to [him]159-will , had grown nauseating . And the ever repeated tasks , the weighing , parcel making , string cutting ; the parrot phrases a thousand times repeated ; [the idiot]1263-the idiot bowing and smiling how these things gnawed at [his]159-will nerves , till [he]159-will quivered like a beaten horse . [He]159-will tried to console [himself]159-will by thinking that things were now at the worst ; that [he]159-will was subduing [himself]159-will , and would soon reach a happy , dull indifference ; but in truth it was with fear that [he]159-will looked forward fear of unknown possibilities in [himself]159-will ; fear that [he]159-will might sink yet more wretchedly in [his]159-will own esteem .

For the worst part of [his]159-will suffering was self - scorn . When [he]159-will embarked upon this strange enterprise , [he]159-will knew , or thought [he]159-will knew , all the trials to which [he]159-will would be exposed , and not slight would have been [his]159-will indignation had [any one]2536-any one ventured to hint that [his]159-will character might prove unequal to the test . [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's letter had pleased [him]159-will so much , precisely because it praised [his]159-will resolve as courageous , manly . On manliness of spirit , [Will]159-will had always piqued [himself]159-will ; it was [his]159-will pride that [he]159-will carried a heart equal to any lot imposed upon [him]159-will by duty . Yet little more than a twelvemonth of shopkeeping had so undermined [his]159-will pluck , enfeebled [his]159-will temper , that [he]159-will could not regard [himself]159-will in the glass without shame . [He]159-will tried to explain it by failure of health . Assuredly [his]159-will physical state had for months been declining and the bad cold from which [he]159-will had recently suffered seemed to complete [his]159-will moral downfall . In this piercing and gloom - wrapped month of February , coward thoughts continually beset [him]159-will . In [[his]159-will cold lodgings]1265-his cold lodgings , in [the cold streets]1266-the cold streets , in the draughts of [the shop]2401-the shop , [he]159-will felt soul and body shrink together , till [he]159-will became as [the meanest of starveling hucksters]1268-the meanest of starveling hucksters .

Then something happened , which rescued [him]159-will for awhile from this haunting self . One night , just at closing time a night of wild wind and driven rain [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper came rushing into [the shop]2401-the shop , [her]158-mrs. hopper face a tale of woe . [Warburton]176-warburton learnt that [[her]158-mrs. hopper sister]818-her sister " [Liza]162-liza , "[176-warburton] [the ailing girl whom [he]159-will had befriended in [his]159-will comfortable days]1271-the ailing girl whom he had befriended in his comfortable days , had been seized with lung hemorrhage , and lay in a lamentable state ; the help of [Mrs. Allchin]161-allchin was called for , and any other that might be forthcoming . Two years ago [Will]159-will would have responded to such an appeal as this with lavish generosity ; now , though the impulse of compassion blinded [him]159-will for a moment to [his]159-will changed circumstances , [he]159-will soon remembered that [his]159-will charity must be that of [a poor man]1272-a poor man , of [a debtor]1273-a debtor . [He]159-will paid for [a cab]1274-a cab , that [the two women]1275-the two women might speed to [[their]1275-the two women sister]1276-their sister through the stormy night as quickly as possible , and [he]159-will promised to think of what could be done for [the invalid]1277-the invalid with the result that [he]159-will lost a night 's sleep in calculating what sum [he]159-will might spare . On the morrow came the news [he]159-will had expected ; [the doctor]1278-the doctor suggested [Brompton Hospital]95-brompton hospital , if admission could be obtained ; [home]354-home treatment at this time of the year , and in [the patient]1280-the patient 's circumstances , was not likely to be of any good . [Warburton]176-warburton took the matter in hand , went about making inquiries , found that there must necessarily be delay . Right or wrong , [he]159-will put [his]159-will hand in [his]159-will pocket , and [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper was enabled to nurse [[her]158-mrs. hopper sister]818-her sister in a way otherwise impossible . [He]159-will visited [the sick - room]1282-the sick - room , and for half an hour managed to talk as of old , in the note of gallant sympathy and encouragement . Let there be no stint of fire , of food , of anything [the doctor]1278-the doctor might advise . Meanwhile , [he]159-will would ask about [other hospitals]1284-other hospitals do everything in [his]159-will power . As indeed [he]159-will did , with the result that in a fortnight 's time , [the sufferer]1285-the sufferer was admitted to [an institution to which , for the nonce , [Warburton]176-warburton had become [a subscriber]1287-a subscriber]1286-an institution to which , for the nonce , warburton had become a subscriber .

[He]159-will saw [[her]158-mrs. hopper doctor]1288-her doctor . " Not much chance , [I]159-will 'm afraid . Of course , if [she]158-mrs. hopper were able to change climate that kind of thing . But , under the circumstances "[159-will]

And through a whole Sunday morning [Will]159-will paced about [[his]159-will little sitting - room]1289-his little sitting - room , not caring to go forth , nor caring to read , caring for nothing at all in a world so full of needless misery . " Of course , if [she]158-mrs. hopper were able to change climate "[159-will] Yes , the accident of possessing money ; a life to depend upon that ! In [another station]1290-another station though , as likely as not , with no moral superiority to justify the privilege [the sick woman]1291-the sick woman would be guarded , soothed , fortified by every expedient of science , every resource of humanity . Chance to be poor , and not only must [you]1292-you die when [you]1292-you need not , but must die with the minimum of comfort , the extreme of bodily and mental distress . This commonplace struck so forcibly upon [Will]159-will 's imagination , that it was as a new discovery to [him]159-will . [He]159-will stood amazed , bewildered as [men of any thinking power]1293-men of any thinking power are wo nt to do when experience makes real to [them]1293-men of any thinking power the truisms of life . A few coins , or pieces of printed paper to signify all that ! An explosion of angry laughter broke the mood .

Pacing , pacing , back and fro in [the little room]323-the little room , for hour after hour , till [his]159-will head whirled , and [his]159-will legs ached . Out of doors there was fitfully glinting sunshine upon the wet roofs ; a pale blue now and then revealed amid the grey rack . Two years ago [he]159-will would have walked twenty miles on a day like this , with eyes for nothing but the beauty and joy of [earth]2494-earth . Was [he]159-will not [he]159-will suddenly asked [himself]159-will [a wiser man]1296-a wiser man now than then ? Did [he]159-will not see into the truth of things ; whereas , formerly , [he]159-will had seen only the deceptive surface ? There should be some solace in this reflection , if [he]159-will took it well to heart .

Then [his]159-will mind wandered away to [Norbert Franks]160-franks , who at this moment was somewhere enjoying [himself]160-franks . This afternoon [he]160-franks might be calling upon [the Crosses]184-the crosses . Why should that thought be disagreeable ? It was , as [he]159-will perceived , not for the first time . If [he]159-will pictured [the artist]329-the artist chatting side by side with [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , something turned cold within [him]159-will . By the bye , it was rather a long time since [he]159-will had seen [Miss Cross]183-bertha ; [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother had been doing the shopping lately . [She]183-bertha might come , perhaps , one day this week ; the chance gave [him]159-will something to look forward to .

How often had [he]159-will called [himself]159-will [a fool]2516-a fool for paying heed to [Bertha Cross]183-bertha 's visits ?

CHAPTER 25

Again came springtime , and , as [he]159-will stood behind the counter , [Warburton]176-warburton thought of all that was going on in [the world]364-the world [he]159-will had forsaken . Amusements for which [he]159-will had never much cared haunted [his]159-will fancy ; feeling [himself]159-will shut out from the life of grace and intellect , [he]159-will suffered a sense of dishonour , as though [his]159-will position resulted from some personal baseness , some crime . [He]159-will numbered [the acquaintances [he]159-will had dropped]1301-the acquaintances he had dropped , and pictured [them]1301-the acquaintances he had dropped as mentioning [his]159-will name if ever [they]1301-the acquaintances he had dropped did so with cold disapproval . [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood had ceased to write ; it was six months since [his]177-sherwood last letter , in which [he]177-sherwood hinted a fear that [the Irish enterprise]1302-the irish enterprise would have to be abandoned for lack of capital . Even [Franks]160-franks , [good fellow as [he]160-franks was]1303-good fellow as he was , seemed to grow lukewarm in friendship . [The painter]389-the painter had an appointment for a Sunday in May at [[Will]159-will 's lodgings]1305-will 's lodgings , to smoke and talk , but on the evening before [he]389-the painter sent a telegram excusing [himself]389-the painter . Vexed , humiliated , [Warburton]176-warburton wasted the Sunday morning , and only after [his]159-will midday meal yielded to the temptation of a brilliant sky , which called [him]159-will forth . Walking westward , with little heed to distance or direction , [he]159-will presently found [himself]159-will at [Kew]96-kew ; on [the bridge]1306-the bridge [he]159-will lingered awhile , idly gazing at boats , and ; as [he]159-will thus leaned over the parapet , the sound of a voice behind [him]159-will fell startlingly upon [his]159-will ear . [He]159-will turned , just in time to catch a glimpse of the features which that voice had brought before [his]159-will mind 's eye , [Bertha Cross]183-bertha was passing , with [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother . Probably [they]1308-they had not seen [him]159-will . And even if [they]1308-they had , if [they]1308-they had recognised [him]159-will did [he]159-will flatter [himself]159-will that [the Crosses]2824-the crosses would give any sign in public of knowing [[their]1308-they grocer]1310-their grocer ?

With [his]159-will eyes on the graceful figure of [Bertha]183-bertha , [he]159-will slowly followed . [The ladies]1311-the ladies were crossing [Kew Green]97-kew green ; doubtless [they]1311-the ladies would enter [the Gardens]1312-the gardens to spend the afternoon [there]2302-there . Would it not be pleasant to join [them]1311-the ladies , to walk by [Bertha]183-bertha 's side , to talk freely with [her]183-bertha , forgetting the counter , which always restrained [their]1314-their conversation ? [Bertha]183-bertha was nicely dressed , though [one]2293-one saw that [her]183-bertha clothes cost nothing . In the old days , if [he]159-will had noticed [her]183-bertha at all [she]183-bertha would have seemed to [him]159-will rather [a pretty girl of the lower middle class]1316-a pretty girl of the lower middle class , perhaps a little less insignificant than [her]183-bertha like ; now [she]183-bertha shone for [him]159-will against a background of " [customers]2399-customers , "[183-bertha] [the one in whom [he]159-will saw [a human being of [his]159-will own kind]1318-a human being of his own kind , and who , within the imposed limits , had given proof of admitting [his]159-will humanity]1317-the one in whom he saw a human being of his own kind , and who , within the imposed limits , had given proof of admitting his humanity . [He]159-will saw [her]183-bertha turn to look at [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother , and smile ; a smile of infinite kindness and good - humour . Involuntarily [his]159-will own lips responded ; [he]159-will walked on smiling smiling .

[They]1320-they passed through the gates ; [he]159-will , at a distance of a dozen yards , still followed . There was no risk of detection ; indeed [he]159-will was doing no harm ; even [a grocer]492-a grocer might observe , from afar off , [a girl walking with [[her]1322-a girl walking with her mother mother]716-her mother]1322-a girl walking with her mother . But , after strolling for a quarter of an hour , [they]1320-they paused beside a bench , and there seated [themselves]1320-they . [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross seemed to be complaining of something ; [Bertha]183-bertha seemed to soothe [her]174-mrs. cross . When [he]159-will was near enough to be aware of this [Will]159-will saw that [he]159-will was too near . [He]159-will turned abruptly on [his]159-will heels , and stood face to face with [Norbert Franks]160-franks .

" Hallo ! "[389-the painter] exclaimed [the painter]389-the painter , with an air of embarrassment . " [I]389-the painter thought that was [your]159-will back ! "[389-the painter]

Very punctually did [the visitor]317-the visitor arrive that evening . [She]183-bertha 's the kind of girl [any man]2466-any man might marry . Nothing brilliant about [her]183-bertha but well , [I]160-franks ca n't describe it . As different as could be from the other . [She]183-bertha behaves to one well , in the most natural way possible . Now and then [I]160-franks rather think [she]183-bertha makes fun of [me]160-franks . "[160-franks]

[Warburton]176-warburton allowed a low chuckle to escape [him]1334-you .

" Why do [you]1334-you laugh ? [I]176-warburton do n't mean that [she]183-bertha does it disagreeably . It 's [her]183-bertha way to look at things on the humorous side and [I]176-warburton rather like that . Do n't [you]1334-you think it a good sign in [a girl]2315-a girl ? "[176-warburton]

" That depends , "[159-will] muttered [Will]159-will .

" Well , that 's how things are . [I]176-warburton wanted to tell [you]1334-you . There 's nobody else [I]176-warburton should think of talking to about it . "[176-warburton]

" [You]1334-you 'll have to make up [your]1334-you mind pretty soon , [I]176-warburton suppose , "[176-warburton] said [Warburton]176-warburton at length , in a not unpleasant voice .

" That 's the worst of it . [I]159-will do n't want to be in a hurry it 's just what [I]159-will do n't want . "[159-will]

" Do n't , "[176-warburton] said [Warburton]176-warburton , in an impressive undertone , " do n't persuade [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross to change [[her]174-mrs. cross grocer]2882-her grocer . "[176-warburton]

CHAPTER 26

This conversation brought [Warburton]176-warburton a short relief . Laughter , even though it come from the throat rather than the midriff , tends to dispel morbid humours , and when [he]159-will woke next morning , after unusually sound sleep , [Will]159-will had a pleasure in the sunlight such as [he]159-will had not known for a long time . [He]159-will thought of [Norbert Franks]160-franks , and chuckled ; of [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , and smiled . For a day or two the toil of [the shop]2401-the shop was less irksome . Then came sordid troubles which again overcast the sky . Acting against [[his]159-will trusty henchman]1338-his trusty henchman 's advice , [Will]159-will had made a considerable purchase of goods from a bankrupt stock ; and what seemed to be a great bargain was beginning to prove a serious loss . [Customers]2399-customers grumbled about the quality of articles supplied to [them]2399-customers out of this unlucky venture , and among [the dissatisfied]1340-the dissatisfied was [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , who came and talked for twenty minutes about some tapioca that had been sent to [her]174-mrs. cross , obliging [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha to make repeated apologies and promises that such a thing should never occur again . When [the querulous - voiced lady]1341-the querulous - voiced lady at length withdrew , [Will]159-will was boiling over with rage .

" [Idiot]2904-idiot ! "[159-will] [he]159-will exclaimed , regardless of the fact that [Allchin]161-allchin overheard [him]159-will .

" [You]159-will see , [sir]2259-sir , "[972-the assistant] remarked [the assistant]972-the assistant . " It 's just as [I]972-the assistant said ; but [I]972-the assistant could n't persuade [you]2259-sir . "[972-the assistant]

[Will]159-will held [his]159-will lips tight and stared before [him]972-the assistant .

" That 'll do , [Allchin]161-allchin , that 'll do ! "[1343-the master] broke in [the master]1343-the master , quivering with the restraint [he]1343-the master imposed upon [himself]1343-the master . " Ca n't [you]2259-sir see [I]1343-the master 'm not in a mood for that sort of thing ? "[1343-the master]

This same day , there was a leakage of gas on [the premises]1344-the premises , due to bad workmanship in some new fittings which had cost [Will]159-will more than [he]159-will liked . Then [the shop awning]1345-the shop awning gave way , and fell upon the head of [a passer - by]1346-a passer - by , who came into [the shop]2401-the shop swearing at large and demanding compensation for [his]1346-a passer - by damaged hat . Sundry other things went wrong in the course of the week , and by closing - time on Saturday night [Warburton]176-warburton 's nerves were in a state of tension which threatened catastrophe . [He]159-will went to bed at one o'clock ; at six in the morning , not having closed [his]159-will eves for a moment , [he]159-will tumbled out again , dressed with fury , and rushed out of [the house]450-the house .

It was a morning of sunny showers ; one moment the stones were covered with shining moisture , and the next were steaming themselves dry under unclouded rays . Heedless whither [he]159-will went , so [he]159-will did but move quickly enough , [Will]159-will crossed [the river]304-the river , and struck southward , till [he]159-will found [himself]159-will by [Clapham Junction]99-clapham junction . The sun had now triumphed ; the day would be brilliant . Feeling already better for [his]159-will exercise , [he]159-will stood awhile reflecting , and decided at length to go by rail into [the country]2354-the country . [He]159-will might perhaps call on [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets at [Ashtead]32-ashtead ; that would depend upon [his]159-will mood . At all events [he]159-will would journey in that direction .

It was some three months since [he]159-will had seen [the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets . [He]159-will had a standing invitation to [the pleasant little house]1351-the pleasant little house , where [he]159-will was always received with simple , cordial hospitality . CHAPTER 27

Toward ten o'clock that evening , [Warburton]156-warburton alighted from [a train]2816-a train at [Notting Hill Gate]103-notting hill gate , and walked through heavy rain to [the abode of [Norbert Franks]160-franks]1395-the abode of norbert franks . With satisfaction , [he]156-warburton saw the light at the great window of [[his]156-warburton studio]1396-his studio , and learnt from [the servant who admitted [him]156-warburton that [Franks]160-franks had [no company]1398-no company]1397-the servant who admitted him that franks had no company . [[His]156-warburton friend]321-his friend received [him]156-warburton with surprise , so long was it since [Warburton]156-warburton had looked in unexpectedly .

" Nothing amiss ? "[160-franks] said [Franks]160-franks , examining the hard - set face , with its heavy eyes , and cheeks sunken .

" All right . Came to ask for news , that 's all . "[156-warburton]

" News ? Ah , [I]156-warburton understand . There 's no news . "[156-warburton]

" Still reflecting ? "[156-warburton]

" Yes . Keeping away , just to see how [I]156-warburton like it . Sensible that , do n't [you]156-warburton think ? "[156-warburton]

[Warburton]156-warburton nodded . The conversation did not promise much vivacity , for [Franks]160-franks looked tired , and [the visitor]317-the visitor seemed much occupied with [his]317-the visitor own thoughts . After a few words about a canvas which stood on the easel [another woman]1401-another woman [the artist]329-the artist was boldly transforming into loveliness [Will]159-will remarked carelessly that [he]159-will had spent the day at [Ashtead]32-ashtead .

" By [Jove]181-jove , [I]160-franks ought to go and see [those people]2823-those people , "[160-franks] said [Franks]160-franks .

" Better wait a little , perhaps , "[404-the other] returned [the other]404-the other with a smile . " [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan is with [them]2823-those people . "[404-the other]

" Ah ! Lucky [you]159-will told [me]160-franks not that it matters much , "[160-franks] added [Franks]160-franks , after a moment 's reflection , " at all events as far as [I]160-franks 'm concerned . But it might be a little awkward for [her]164-miss elvan . How long is [she]164-miss elvan staying ? "[160-franks]

[Will]159-will told all [he]159-will knew of [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan 's projects . [He]159-will went on to say that [she]164-miss elvan seemed to [him]159-will more thoughtful , more serious , than in the old time ; to be sure , [she]164-miss elvan had but recently lost [[her]164-miss elvan father]472-her father , and the subduing influence of that event might have done [her]164-miss elvan good .

" [You]159-will had a lot of talk ? "[160-franks] said [Franks]160-franks .

[He]159-will paused , as if musing on a thought .

" Nothing except that [I]160-franks like [her]164-miss elvan better than [I]160-franks used to . "[160-franks]

As [he]159-will spoke , [he]159-will stood up .

" Well , [I]159-will ca n't stay . It 's raining like the devil . [I]159-will wanted to know whether [you]160-franks 'd done anything decisive , that 's all . "[159-will]

" [I]160-franks 'll let [you]160-franks know when [I]160-franks do , "[160-franks] answered [Franks]160-franks , suppressing a yawn . " Good - night , [old man]2310-old man . "[160-franks]

For a fortnight , [Warburton]156-warburton led [his]156-warburton wonted life , shut off as usual from [the outer world]1405-the outer world . About this time , [Allchin]161-allchin began to observe with anxiety the change in [[his]156-warburton master]1406-his master 's aspect and general behaviour .

" [I]156-warburton 'm afraid [you]160-franks 're not feeling quite [yourself]160-franks , [sir]2259-sir , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton said at closing time one night . " [I]156-warburton 've noticed lately [you]160-franks do n't seem quite well . "[156-warburton]

"[972-the assistant]

[Warburton]156-warburton set [his]156-warburton teeth and said nothing .

" [You]161-allchin would n't like to take just a little ' oliday , [sir]2259-sir ? "[161-allchin] returned [Allchin]161-allchin . " This next week , [I]161-allchin could manage well enough . It might do [you]2259-sir good , [sir]2259-sir , to have a mouthful of sea air "[161-allchin]

" [I]156-warburton 'll think about it , "[156-warburton] broke in the other abruptly .

[He]156-warburton was going away without another word , but , in crossing [the shop]2401-the shop , [he]156-warburton caught [[his]156-warburton henchman]1409-his henchman 's eye fixed on [him]156-warburton with a troublous gaze . [Self]236-self - reproach checked [his]156-warburton steps .

" [You]1409-his henchman 're quite right , [Allchin]161-allchin , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton said in a confidential tone . " [I]156-warburton 'm not quite up to the mark , and perhaps [I]156-warburton should do well to take a holiday . Thank [you]1409-his henchman for speaking about it . "[156-warburton]

[He]156-warburton walked [home]354-home , and there , on [his]156-warburton table , [he]156-warburton found a letter from [Franks]160-franks , which [he]156-warburton eagerly tore open . " [I]329-the artist have as good as decided , "[329-the artist] wrote [the artist]329-the artist . " Yesterday , [I]329-the artist went to [Ashtead]32-ashtead , and saw [R.]237-r. [We]2959-we met like [old friends]2960-old friends just as [I]329-the artist wished . Talked as naturally as [you]1409-his henchman and [I.]329-the artist [I]329-the artist suspect only suspect of course that [she]329-the artist knows of [my]329-the artist visits to [Walham Green]60-walham green , and smiles at [them]60-walham green ! Yes , as [you]1409-his henchman say , [I]329-the artist think [she]329-the artist has improved decidedly . The upshot of it all is that [I]329-the artist shall call on [the Crosses]2824-the crosses again , and , when an opportunity offers , try [my]329-the artist chance . [I]329-the artist think [I]329-the artist am acting sensibly , do n't [you]1409-his henchman ? "[329-the artist]

After reading this , [Will]159-will paced about [[his]159-will room]910-his room for an hour or two . Then [he]159-will flung [himself]159-will into bed , but got no sleep until past dawn . Rising at the usual hour , [he]159-will told [himself]159-will that this would not do ; to live on in this way was mere moral suicide ; [he]159-will resolved to run down to [St. Neots]49-st. neots , whence , if [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother were capable of the journey , [she]346-his mother and [Jane]202-jane might go for a week or two to [the seaside]1414-the seaside . So , having packed [his]159-will travelling bag , [he]159-will walked to [the shop]2401-the shop , and arranged with [Allchin]161-allchin for a week 's absence , greatly to [the assistant]972-the assistant 's satisfaction . Before noon [he]159-will was at [The Haws]59-the haws . But the idea of a family expedition to [the seaside]1414-the seaside could not be carried out : [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton was not strong enough to leave [home]354-home , and [Jane]202-jane had just invited [a friend]2493-a friend to come and spend a week with [them]1420-them . Disguising as best [he]159-will could [his]159-will miserable state of mind and body , [Will]159-will stayed for a couple of days . The necessity for detailed lying about [his]159-will affairs in [London]18-london lying which would long ago have been detected , but for the absolute confidence of [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister , and the retired habits of [their]1420-them life added another cause of unrest to those already tormenting [him]159-will , and [he]159-will was glad to escape into solitude . Though with little faith in the remedy , [he]159-will betook [himself]159-will to [a quiet spot on [the coast of [Norfolk]104-norfolk]1424-the coast of norfolk]1423-a quiet spot on the coast of norfolk , associated with memories of holiday in childhood , and there for the rest of the time [he]159-will had allowed [himself]159-will did what [a man]2336-a man could do to get benefit from [sea and sky]1426-sea and sky .

And in these endless hours of solitude there grew upon [him]159-will a perception of the veritable cause of [his]159-will illness . Not loss of station , not overwork , not love ; but simply the lie to which [he]159-will was committed . There was the root of the matter . Slowly , dimly , [he]159-will groped toward the fact that what rendered [his]159-will life intolerable was its radical dishonesty . Lived openly , avowedly , it would have involved hardships indeed , but nothing of this dull wretchedness which made [the world]364-the world a desert . [He]159-will began to see how much better , how much easier , it would have been to tell the truth two years ago . [[His]159-will mother]346-his mother was not so weak - minded [a woman]2514-a woman as to be stricken down by loss of money ; and as for [Sherwood]177-sherwood , [his]177-sherwood folly merited more than the unpleasantness that might have resulted to [him]177-sherwood from disclosure . Grocerdom with a clear conscience would have been a totally different thing from grocerdom surreptitiously embraced . Instead of slinking into a corner for the performance of an honourable act , [he]159-will should have declared it , frankly , unaffectedly , to all who had any claim upon [him]159-will . At once , the enterprise became amusing , interesting . If it disgraced [him]159-will with [any of [[his]159-will acquaintances]916-his acquaintances , so much the worse for [them]916-his acquaintances]1430-any of his acquaintances , so much the worse for them ; all whose friendship was worth having would have shown only the more [[his]159-will friends]898-his friends ; as things stood , [he]159-will was ashamed , degraded , not by circumstances , but by [himself]159-will .

To undo it all ? To proclaim the truth ? Was it not easy enough ? [He]159-will had proved now that [his]159-will business would yield income sufficient for [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother and [sister]2444-sister , as well as for [his]159-will own needs ; the crisis was surmounted ; why not cast off this load of mean falsehood , which was crushing [him]159-will to the ground ? By Heaven ! [he]159-will would do so .

Not immediately . Better wait till [he]159-will had heard from [Jane]202-jane that [[their]1435-their mother]1436-their mother was a little stronger , which would probably be the case in a week or two . But [he]159-will declared ill [his]159-will mind the resolve was taken . At the first favourable moment [he]159-will would undo [his]159-will folly . Before taking this step , [he]159-will must of course announce it to [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood ; an unpleasant necessity ; but no matter .

[He]159-will walked about [the beach]1437-the beach in a piping wind , waved [his]159-will arms , talked to [himself]159-will , now and then raised a great shout . And that night [he]159-will slept soundly .

CHAPTER 28

[He]159-will got back to [Fulham Road]38-fulham road in time for the press of Saturday night . [Allchin]161-allchin declared that [he]159-will looked much better , and [customers]2399-customers were once more gratified by [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha 's studious civility . On Sunday morning [he]159-will wrote a long letter to [Sherwood]177-sherwood , which , for lack of other address , [he]159-will sent to the care of [[Godfrey]177-sherwood 's relative]1439-godfrey 's relative in [Wales]90-wales . This was something done . In the afternoon [he]159-will took a long walk , which led [him]159-will through [the [Holland Park]92-holland park region]1206-the holland park region . [He]159-will called to see [Franks]160-franks , but [the artist]329-the artist was not at [home]354-home ; so [he]159-will left a card asking for news . And the next day brought [Franks]160-franks ' telegraphic reply . " Nothing definite yet . Shall come to see [you]176-warburton late one of these evenings . [I]160-franks have not been to [Walham Green]60-walham green . "[160-franks] Though [he]159-will had all but persuaded [himself]159-will that [he]159-will cared not at all , one way or the other , this message did [Warburton]176-warburton good . Midway in the week , business being slack , [he]159-will granted [himself]159-will a half holiday , and went to [Ashtead]32-ashtead , merely in friendliness to [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret so [he]159-will said to [himself]159-will .

From [[Ashtead]32-ashtead station]1443-ashtead station to [[the Pomfrets]165-the pomfrets ' house]1444-the pomfrets ' house was a good twenty minutes ' walk . As [he]159-will strode along , eyes upon the ground , [Will]159-will all at once saw [the path]1445-the path darkened by a shadow ; [he]159-will then became conscious of [a female figure just in front of [him]159-will]1446-a female figure just in front of him , and heedlessly glancing at the face , was arrested by a familiar smile .

" [You]164-miss elvan were coming to see [us]2962-us ? "[164-miss elvan] asked [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan , offering [her]164-miss elvan hand . " What a pity that [I]164-miss elvan have to go to [town]2424-town ! Only just time to catch [the train]579-the train . "[164-miss elvan]

" Then [I]1446-a female figure just in front of him 'll walk back to [the station]580-the station with [you]164-miss elvan may [I]1446-a female figure just in front of him ? "[1446-a female figure just in front of him]

" [I]164-miss elvan shall be delighted , if [you]164-miss elvan do n't mind the trouble . [I]164-miss elvan have an appointment with [Miss Cross]183-bertha . " So [you]164-miss elvan have decided for [London]18-london ? "[1446-a female figure just in front of him]

" [I]164-miss elvan think so . [The rooms]2966-the rooms are at [Chelsea]50-chelsea , in [Oakley Crescent]105-oakley crescent . "[164-miss elvan]

For an instant , [Will]159-will was surprised , confused , but [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's entire simplicity and directness of manner rebuked this sensation . [He]159-will replied in a corresponding tone that nothing would please [him]159-will more . [They]1447-they were now at [the railway station]1448-the railway station , and [the train]579-the train approached . [Rosamund]167-rosamund having sprung into [a carriage]1450-a carriage , gave [her]167-rosamund hand through the window , saying :

" [I]167-rosamund may be settled in a day or two . [You]159-will will hear "[167-rosamund]

With the sentence unfinished , [she]167-rosamund drew back , and [the train]579-the train rolled away . For a minute or two , [Warburton]156-warburton stood on [the platform]584-the platform , [his]156-warburton lips mechanically prolonging the smile which had answered [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan 's , and [his]156-warburton thoughts echoing [her]164-miss elvan last words . When [he]156-warburton turned , [he]156-warburton at first walked slowly ; then [his]156-warburton pace quickened , and [he]156-warburton arrived at [[the Pomfrets]1453-the pomfrets ' house]1444-the pomfrets ' house , as though on urgent business . In [the garden]603-the garden [he]156-warburton caught sight of [Ralph]170-ralph pomfret , recovered from [his]170-ralph pomfret attack of gout , sitting at [his]170-ralph pomfret ease , pipe in mouth . [Will]159-will told of [his]159-will meeting with [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan .

" Yes , yes ; [she]164-miss elvan 's off to [[London]18-london [town]2424-town]2969-london town wants to live [there]2302-there , like [all the rest of [the young people]2973-the young people]2972-all the rest of the young people . [[My]159-will wife]2389-my wife 's in [the house]450-the house , teaching [[our]2977-our new maid]2978-our new maid to make tea - cakes [you]159-will shall have some at five o'clock . [I]159-will wonder whether [any girl]461-any girl could be found nowadays who knows how to make tea - cakes ? " That 's to [your]159-will credit . By the bye , [you]159-will know that [Norbert]160-franks has been [here]2261-here . "[159-will]

" Yes , [I]159-will heard of it . [He]160-franks wrote to tell [me]159-will . "[159-will]

" Indeed ? "[159-will]

[Ralph]170-ralph pomfret looked at [the other]404-the other with an odd smile .

" [One]2293-one might have expected a little awkwardness between [them]2984-they , "[170-ralph pomfret] [he]170-ralph pomfret continued . " Not a bit of it . " [I]156-warburton 'm glad to hear it , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton .

[Will]159-will had purposed getting back to [the shop]2401-the shop about seven o'clock . [He]159-will was , indeed , back in [London]18-london at that hour , but [his]159-will state of mind tempted [him]159-will to shirk squalid duty ; instead of turning toward [Fulham Road]38-fulham road , [he]159-will took [his]159-will way into [the Strand]1458-the strand , and there loitered in the evening sunshine , self - reproachful , yet enjoying the unwonted liberty . It was dinner - time ; [restaurants]1459-restaurants exhaled their pungent odours , and [Will]159-will felt sharpening appetite . For the first time since [his]159-will catastrophe , [he]159-will granted [himself]159-will the dinner of [a well - to - do man]1460-a well - to - do man , and , as would naturally befall in such a case , made [his]159-will indulgence large .

Several days passed and brought no letter from [any one]2536-any one . But at midnight on Saturday , there lay awaiting [him]159-will a letter addressed in [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's well - known hand . [Godfrey]177-sherwood began by excusing [himself]177-sherwood for [his]177-sherwood delay in replying ; [he]177-sherwood had had rather a nasty attack of illness , and was only now able to hold [his]177-sherwood pen . But it was lucky [he]177-sherwood had not written before ; this very morning there had reached [him]177-sherwood the very best news . " [The father of [the man who owes [me]159-will ten thousand pounds]2988-the man who owes me ten thousand pounds]2987-the father of the man who owes me ten thousand pounds is dying . Off and on [he]2987-the father of the man who owes me ten thousand pounds has been ill for a long time , but [I]159-will hear at length that there can be no doubt whatever that the end is near . [I]159-will ca n't pretend to any human feeling in this matter ; [the man]2363-the man 's death means life for [us]2990-we so [the world]364-the world goes . Any day now , [you]2992-you may have a telegram from [me]159-will announcing the event . Of the prompt payment of the debt as soon as [[my]159-will friend]2422-my friend inherits , there is no shadow of doubt . [I]159-will therefore urge [you]2992-you very strongly not to make a disclosure . It will be needless . Wait till [we]2990-we see [each other]412-each other . [I]159-will am still in [Ireland]91-ireland for a reason which [I]159-will will explain when [we]2990-we meet . "[159-will]

[Will]159-will drew a long breath . If ever news came opportunely , it was this . [He]159-will threw up the window of [[his]159-will stuffy little sitting - room]1462-his stuffy little sitting - room , and looked out into the summer night . The murmur of [London]18-london once more made music to [his]159-will ears .

CHAPTER 29

[Rosamund]167-rosamund took [the [Chelsea]50-chelsea lodgings]1463-the chelsea lodgings proposed to [her]167-rosamund by [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , and in a few days went to live [there]2302-there . The luggage which [she]167-rosamund brought from [Ashtead]32-ashtead enabled [her]167-rosamund to add a personal touch to [the characterless rooms]1465-the characterless rooms : in the place of [the landlady]563-the landlady 's ornaments , which were not things of beauty , [she]167-rosamund scattered [her]167-rosamund own bibelots , and about the walls [she]167-rosamund hung a number of [her]167-rosamund own drawings , framed for the purpose , as well as several which bore the signature , " [Norbert Franks]160-franks . "[167-rosamund] Something less than a year ago , when [[her]167-rosamund father]472-her father went abroad , [[their]1468-their house at [Bath]35-bath]1469-their house at bath had been given up , and the furniture warehoused ; for the present , [Rosamund]167-rosamund and [[her]167-rosamund sister]818-her sister were content to leave things thus . The inheritance of each amounted only to a few hundred pounds .

" It 's enough to save one from worry for a year or two , "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund to [[her]167-rosamund friend]474-her friend [Bertha]183-bertha . " [I]167-rosamund 'm not extravagant ; [I]167-rosamund can live [here]2261-here very comfortably . And there 's a pleasure in the thought that one 's work not only may succeed but must . "[167-rosamund]

" [I]183-bertha 'm sure [I]183-bertha hope so , "[183-bertha] replied [Bertha]183-bertha , " but where 's the must ? "[183-bertha]

" What am [I]164-miss elvan to do if it does n't ? "[164-miss elvan] asked [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan , with [her]164-miss elvan sweet smile , and in a tone of irresistible argument .

" True , "[1472-her humorous friend] conceded [[her]164-miss elvan humorous friend]1472-her humorous friend . " There 's no other way out of the difficulty . "[1472-her humorous friend]

This was on the day of [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's coming to [Chelsea]50-chelsea . A week later , [Bertha]183-bertha found [the sitting - room]865-the sitting - room brightened with the hanging water - colours , with curtains of some delicate fabric at the windows , with a new rug before the fire place .

" These things have cost so little , "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund , half apologetically . " And yes , [I]167-rosamund was obliged to buy this little tea service ; [I]167-rosamund really could n't use [Mrs. Darby]238-mrs. darby 's ; it spoilt the taste of the tea . Trifles , but they really have their importance ; they help to keep one in the right mind . Oh , [I]167-rosamund must show [you]183-bertha an amusing letter [I]167-rosamund 've had from [Winnie]214-winifred . [Winifred]214-winifred is prudence itself . [She]214-winifred would n't spend a sixpence unnecessarily . ' Suppose one fell ill , ' [she]164-miss elvan writes , ' what a blessing it would be to feel that one was n't helpless and dependent . Oh , do be careful with [your]183-bertha money , and consider very , very seriously what is the best course to take in [your]183-bertha position . ' Poor , [dear old Winnie]214-winifred ! [I]167-rosamund know [she]214-winifred frets and worries about [me]167-rosamund , and pictures [me]167-rosamund throwing gold away by the handful . Yet , as [you]183-bertha know , that is n't [my]167-rosamund character at all . If [I]167-rosamund lay out a few sovereigns to make [myself]167-rosamund comfortable [here]2261-here , [I]167-rosamund know what [I]167-rosamund 'm doing ; it 'll all come back again in work . As [you]183-bertha know , [Bertha]183-bertha , [I]167-rosamund 'm not afraid of poverty not a bit ! [I]167-rosamund had very much rather be shockingly poor , living in a garret and half starved , than just keep [myself]167-rosamund tidily going in lodgings such as these were before [I]167-rosamund made the little changes . [Winnie]214-winifred has a terror of finding [herself]214-winifred destitute . [She]214-winifred jumped for joy when [she]214-winifred was offered that work , and [I]167-rosamund 'm sure [she]214-winifred 'd be content to live [there]2302-there in the same way for years . [She]214-winifred feels safe as long as [she]214-winifred need n't touch [her]214-winifred money . "[167-rosamund]

[Winifred Elvan]214-winifred , since [[her]214-winifred father]472-her father 's death , had found an engagement as governess in [an English family]1475-an english family at [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz . This , in [the younger sister]1476-the younger sister 's eyes , involved a social decline , more disagreeable to [her]214-winifred than [she]214-winifred chose to confess .

" The one thing , "[167-rosamund] pursued [Rosamund]167-rosamund , " that [I]167-rosamund really dread , is the commonplace . [I]167-rosamund ca n't imagine [myself]167-rosamund marrying [a prosperous shopkeeper]2998-a prosperous shopkeeper ; but if [I]167-rosamund cared for [a clerk who had nothing but a pound a week]2999-a clerk who had nothing but a pound a week , [I]167-rosamund would marry [him]2999-a clerk who had nothing but a pound a week to - morrow . "[167-rosamund]

" The result , "[183-bertha] said [Bertha]183-bertha , " might be lamentably commonplace . "[183-bertha]

" Not if it was [the right sort of man]3000-the right sort of man . Tell [me]183-bertha what [you]167-rosamund think of that bit . "[183-bertha] [She]183-bertha pointed to a framed drawing . " It 's in [the valley of [Bidassoa]107-bidassoa]3001-the valley of bidassoa . "[183-bertha]

[They]1477-they talked art for a little , then [Rosamund]167-rosamund fell into musing , and presently said :
