CHAPTER 30

It was on Saturday night that [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood came at length to [[Warburton]156-warburton 's lodgings]1491-warburton 's lodgings . Reaching [home]354-home between twelve and one o'clock [Will]159-will saw [a man who paced [the pavement near [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick 's door]1494-the pavement near mrs. wick 's door]1493-a man who paced the pavement near mrs. wick 's door ; [the man]2363-the man , at sight of [him]2363-the man , hastened forward ; there were exclamations of surprise and of pleasure .

" [I]177-sherwood came first of all at nine o'clock , "[177-sherwood] said [Sherwood]177-sherwood . " [The landlady]563-the landlady said [you]159-will would n't be back before midnight , so [I]177-sherwood came again . Been to [the theatre]2750-the theatre , [I]177-sherwood suppose ? "[177-sherwood]

" Yes , "[159-will] answered [Will]159-will , " taking part in a play called ' [The Grocer]2628-the grocer 's Saturday Night . '[159-will]

" [I]177-sherwood 'd forgotten . [Poor old fellow]3026-poor old fellow ! [You]159-will wo n't have much more of that thank [Heaven]241-heaven ! Are [you]159-will too tired to talk to - night ? "[177-sherwood]

" No , no ; come in . "[159-will]

[The house]450-the house was silent and dark . [Will]159-will struck a match to light the candle placed for [him]177-sherwood at the foot of the stairs , and led the way up to [[his]159-will sitting - room]1497-his sitting - room on the first floor . [Here]2261-here [he]159-will lit a lamp , and [the two friends]1499-the two friends looked at [each other]412-each other . [Each]1501-each saw a change . If [Warburton]156-warburton was thin and heavy - eyed , [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's visage showed an even more noticeable falling - off in health .

" What 's been the matter with [you]159-will ? "[159-will] asked [Will]159-will . " [Your]159-will letter said [you]159-will had had an illness , and [you]159-will look as if [you]159-will had n't got over it yet . "[159-will]

" Oh , [I]404-the other 'm all right now , "[404-the other] cried [the other]404-the other . " [Liver]242-liver got out of order or the spleen , or something [I]404-the other forget . The best medicine was the news [I]404-the other got about [old Strangwyn]243-strangwyn . There , by [Jove]181-jove ! [I]404-the other 've let the name out . The wonder is [I]404-the other never did it before , when [we]1499-the two friends were talking . It does n't matter now . Yes , it 's [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn , [the whisky man]3027-the whisky man . [He]243-strangwyn 'll die worth a million or two , and [Ted]243-strangwyn is [[his]243-strangwyn only son]384-his only son . [I]404-the other was [a fool]2516-a fool to lend that money to [Ted]243-strangwyn , but [we]1499-the two friends saw a great deal of [each other]412-each other at one time , and when [he]243-strangwyn came asking for ten thousand a mere nothing for [a fellow of [his]243-strangwyn expectations]3031-a fellow of his expectations [nobody]2504-nobody thought [[his]243-strangwyn father]342-his father could live a year , but [the old man]3034-the old man has held out all this time , and [Ted]243-strangwyn , [the rascal]3035-the rascal , kept swearing [he]243-strangwyn could n't pay the interest on [his]243-strangwyn debt . Of course [I]404-the other could have made [him]243-strangwyn ; but [he]243-strangwyn knew [I]404-the other should n't dare to risk the thing coming to [[his]243-strangwyn father]342-his father 's ears . [I]404-the other 've had altogether about three hundred pounds , instead of the four hundred a year [he]243-strangwyn owed [me]404-the other it was at four per cent . Now , of course , [I]404-the other shall get all the arrears but that wo n't pay for all the mischief that 's been done . "[404-the other]

" Is it certain , "[159-will] asked [Will]159-will , " that [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn will pay ? "[159-will]

" Certain ? If [he]243-strangwyn does n't [I]404-the other sue [him]243-strangwyn . The case is plain as daylight . "[404-the other]

" There 's no doubt that [he]243-strangwyn 'll have [[his]243-strangwyn father]342-his father 's money ? "[159-will]

" None whatever . For more than a year now , [he]243-strangwyn 's been on good terms with [the old man]3034-the old man . [Ted]243-strangwyn is [a very decent fellow]3039-a very decent fellow , of [his]3034-the old man sort . [I]404-the other do n't say that [I]404-the other care as much for [him]243-strangwyn now as [I]404-the other used to ; [we]3040-we 've both of [us]3040-we altered ; but [his]243-strangwyn worst fault is extravagance . [The old man]3034-the old man , it must be confessed , is n't very good form ; [he]3034-the old man smells rather of the distillery ; but [Ted Strangwyn]243-strangwyn might come of [the best family in [the land]3043-the land]3042-the best family in the land . Oh , [you]3044-you need n't have the least anxiety . [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn will pay , principal and interest , as soon as [the old man]3034-the old man has retired ; and that may happen any day , any hour . How glad [I]404-the other am to see [you]3044-you again , [Will]159-will ! [I]404-the other 've known [one or two plucky men]3046-one or two plucky men , but [no one like [you]3044-you]3047-no one like you . [I]404-the other could n't have gone through it ; [I]404-the other should have turned coward after a month of that . Well , it 's over , and it 'll be something to look back upon . Some day , perhaps , [you]3044-you 'll amuse [[your]3044-you sister]2643-your sister by telling [her]2643-your sister the story . And [not a soul]3049-not a soul has found [you]3044-you out , all this time ? "[404-the other]

" [No one that [I]159-will know of]3050-no one that i know of . "[159-will]

" [You]3044-you must have suffered horribly from loneliness . But [I]1503-i have things to tell [you]3044-you , important things . "[1503-i] [He]1503-i waved [his]1503-i arm . " Not to - night ; it 's too late , and [you]3044-you look tired to death . "[1503-i]

" Tell on , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton . " If [I]156-warburton went to bed [I]156-warburton should n't sleep where are [you]156-warburton staying ? "[156-warburton]

" [[Morley]244-morley 's Hotel]3051-morley 's hotel . Not at [my]177-sherwood own expense , "[177-sherwood] [Sherwood]177-sherwood added hastily . " [I]177-sherwood 'm acting as secretary to [a man a man [I]177-sherwood got to know in [Ireland]91-ireland]3052-a man a man i got to know in ireland . [A fine fellow]3053-a fine fellow ! [You]3044-you 'll know [him]3052-a man a man i got to know in ireland very soon . It 's about [him]3052-a man a man i got to know in ireland that [I]177-sherwood want to tell [you]3044-you . But first of all , that idea of [mine]177-sherwood about Irish eggs . The trouble was [I]177-sherwood could n't get capital enough . [[My]177-sherwood cousin]3054-my cousin Hackett risked a couple of hundred pounds ; it was all lost before the thing could really be set going . [I]177-sherwood had a bad time after that , [Will]159-will , a bad time , [I]177-sherwood tell [you]3044-you . Yet good results came of it . For two or three months [I]177-sherwood lived on next to nothing a few pence a day , all told . Of course , if [I]177-sherwood had let [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn know how badly off [I]177-sherwood was , [he]243-strangwyn 'd have sent a cheque ; but [I]177-sherwood did n't feel [I]177-sherwood had any right to [his]243-strangwyn money , it was [yours]3044-you , not [mine]177-sherwood . Besides , [I]177-sherwood said to [myself]177-sherwood that , if [I]177-sherwood suffered , it was only what [I]177-sherwood deserved ; [I]177-sherwood took it as a sort of expiation of the harm [I]177-sherwood 'd done . All that time [I]177-sherwood was in [Dublin]109-dublin , [I]177-sherwood tried to get employment but [nobody]2504-nobody had any use for [me]177-sherwood until at last , when [I]177-sherwood was all but dying of hunger , [somebody]2334-somebody spoke to [me]177-sherwood of [a certain Milligan]245-milligan , [a young and very rich man living in [Dublin]109-dublin]3057-a young and very rich man living in dublin . [I]177-sherwood resolved to go and see [him]245-milligan , and a lucky day it was . [You]3058-you remember [[Conolly Bates]246-conolly bates 's traveller]3059-conolly bates 's traveller ? Well , [Milligan]245-milligan is [just that man]3060-just that man , in appearance ; [a thorough Irishman]3061-a thorough irishman , and [one of the best hearted fellows that ever lived]3062-one of the best hearted fellows that ever lived . Though [he]245-milligan 's rich [I]177-sherwood found [him]245-milligan living in a very plain way , in [a room which looked like [a museum]3064-a museum , full of fossils , stuffed birds and animals , queer old pictures , no end of such things]3063-a room which looked like a museum , full of fossils , stuffed birds and animals , queer old pictures , no end of such things . Well , [I]177-sherwood told [him]245-milligan plainly who [I]177-sherwood was , and where [I]177-sherwood was ; and almost without thinking , [he]245-milligan cried out ' What could be simpler ? Come and be [[my]177-sherwood secretary]3065-my secretary . ' ' [You]177-sherwood want [a secretary]3066-a secretary ? ' ' [I]177-sherwood had n't thought of it , ' said [Milligan]245-milligan , ' but now it strikes [me]177-sherwood it 's just what [I]177-sherwood do want . [I]177-sherwood knew there was something . Yes , yes , come and be [[my]177-sherwood secretary]3065-my secretary ; [you]245-milligan 're just [the man]2363-the man . ' [He]245-milligan went on to tell [me]177-sherwood [he]245-milligan had a lot of correspondence with [sellers of curiosities]3069-sellers of curiosities , and it bored [him]245-milligan to write the letters . Would [I]177-sherwood come for a couple of hours a day ? [He]245-milligan 'd pay [me]177-sherwood twenty pounds a month . [You]3070-you may suppose [I]177-sherwood was n't long in accepting . [We]3071-we began the next day , and in a week 's time [we]3071-we were [good friends]3072-good friends . [Milligan]245-milligan told [me]177-sherwood that [he]245-milligan 'd always had weak health , and [he]245-milligan was convinced [his]245-milligan life had been saved by vegetarianism . [I]177-sherwood [myself]177-sherwood was n't feeling at all fit just then ; [he]245-milligan persuaded [me]177-sherwood to drop meat , and taught [me]177-sherwood all about the vegetarian way of living . [I]177-sherwood had n't tried it for a month before [I]177-sherwood found the most wonderful results . Never in [my]177-sherwood life had [I]177-sherwood such a clear mind , and such good spirits . It remade [me]177-sherwood . "[177-sherwood]

" So [you]177-sherwood 've come to [London]18-london to hunt for curios ? "[159-will] interposed [Will]159-will .

" No , no ; let [me]1504-i go on . When [I]1504-i got to know [Milligan]245-milligan well , [I]1504-i found that [he]245-milligan had [a large estate somewhere in [Connaught]110-connaught]3073-a large estate somewhere in connaught . And , as [we]3074-we talked , an idea came to [me]1504-i . "[1504-i] Again [he]1504-i sprang up from [his]1504-i chair . " ' If [I]1504-i were [a landowner on that scale]3075-a landowner on that scale , ' [I]1504-i said , ' do [you]1504-i know what [I]1504-i should do [I]1504-i should make [a vegetarian colony]3076-a vegetarian colony ; [a self - supporting settlement of [people who ate no meat , drank no alcohol , smoked no tobacco]3078-people who ate no meat , drank no alcohol , smoked no tobacco]3077-a self - supporting settlement of people who ate no meat , drank no alcohol , smoked no tobacco ; [a community which , as years went on , might prove to [the world]364-the world]3079-a community which , as years went on , might prove to the world that there was the true ideal of civilised life health of mind and of body , true culture , true humanity ! ' "[1504-i] The eyes glowed in [his]1504-i fleshless , colourless face ; [he]1504-i spoke with arm raised , head thrown back the attitude of [an enthusiastic preacher]1505-an enthusiastic preacher . " [Milligan]245-milligan caught at the idea caught at it eagerly . ' There 's something fine in that ! ' [he]245-milligan said . ' Why should n't it be done ? ' ' [You]1504-i 're [the man that could do it]3081-the man that could do it , ' [I]1504-i told [him]245-milligan . ' [You]1504-i 'd be [a benefactor to [the human race]3083-the human race]3082-a benefactor to the human race . Isolated examples are all very well , but what [we]3084-we want is an experiment on a large scale , going on through more than one generation . Let [children]2532-children be born of [vegetarian parents]3086-vegetarian parents , brought up as [vegetarians]3087-vegetarians , and this in conditions of life every way simple , natural , healthy . This is the way to convert [the world]364-the world . ' So that 's what [we]3084-we 're working at now , [Milligan]245-milligan and [I.]177-sherwood Of course there are endless difficulties ; the thing ca n't be begun in a hurry ; [we]3084-we have to see no end of [people]2321-people , and correspond with [the leaders of vegetarianism]3090-the leaders of vegetarianism everywhere . But is n't it a grand idea ? Is n't it worth working for ? "[1504-i]

[Warburton]156-warburton mused , smiling .

" [I]177-sherwood want [you]177-sherwood to join [us]3084-we , "[177-sherwood] said [Sherwood]177-sherwood abruptly .

" Ho , ho ! That 's another matter . "[156-warburton]

" [I]156-warburton 've no time . [I]156-warburton 'm [a grocer]492-a grocer . "[156-warburton]

[He]177-sherwood walked round and round the table , waving [his]177-sherwood arms , and [Warburton]156-warburton , after regarding [him]177-sherwood curiously , mused again , but without a smile .

CHAPTER 31

Behind [his]1506-his counter next morning , [Will]159-will thought over [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's story , and laughed to [himself]1506-his wonderingly . Not that [any freak of [[his]1506-his old partner]1508-his old partner 's of [the man whom [he]1506-his had once regarded as , above all , practical and energetic]1509-the man whom he had once regarded as , above all , practical and energetic]1507-any freak of his old partner 's of the man whom he had once regarded as , above all , practical and energetic could now surprise [him]1506-his ; but it seemed astonishing that [Godfrey]177-sherwood should have persuaded [a man of solid means]1510-a man of solid means , even [a Celt]1511-a celt , to pledge [himself]177-sherwood to such an enterprise Was the story true ? Did [Milligan]245-milligan really exist ? If any doubt were possible on this point , did it not also throw suspicion on the story of [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn , and the ten thousand pounds ? [Will]159-will grew serious at the reflection . [He]159-will had never conceived a moment 's distrust of [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's honesty , nor did [his]159-will misgiving now take that form ; the question which troubled [him]159-will throughout to - day was whether [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood might be a victim of delusions . Certainly [he]177-sherwood had a very strange look ; that haggard face , those brilliant eyes

So disquieting was the suspicion that , at dosing time , [Will]159-will could no longer resist an impulse to betake [himself]159-will to [Morley 's Hotel]111-morley 's hotel . [Sherwood]177-sherwood had said that [Milligan]245-milligan was [there]2302-there only for a few days , until [the wealthy Irishman]1513-the wealthy irishman could find [a furnished house suitable to [his]245-milligan needs whilst [he]245-milligan remained in [London]18-london]1514-a furnished house suitable to his needs whilst he remained in london . Arrived at [the hotel]2304-the hotel , [he]159-will inquired for [[his]159-will friend]321-his friend ; [Sherwood]177-sherwood had dined and gone out . [Will]159-will hesitated a moment , then asked whether [Mr. Milligan]245-milligan was to be seen . [Mr. Milligan]245-milligan , [he]159-will learnt , had gone out with [Mr. Sherwood]190-mr. sherwood . So [Milligan]245-milligan did exist . [Will]159-will 's relief at settling this point banished [his]159-will doubts on all the others . [He]159-will turned westward again , and through a night of soft , warm rain walked all the way to [[his]159-will lodgings]1175-his lodgings .

On the third day after , late in the evening , [Sherwood]177-sherwood paid [him]159-will a second visit . [Godfrey]177-sherwood was in high spirits . [He]177-sherwood announced that [Milligan]245-milligan had taken [a house near [the Marble Arch]112-the marble arch , where [he]177-sherwood also , as [secretary]1519-secretary]1518-a house near the marble arch , where he also , as secretary , would have [[his]177-sherwood quarters]1520-his quarters , and that already a meeting had been convened of [the leading [London]18-london vegetarians]1521-the leading london vegetarians . Things were splendidly in train . Then [he]177-sherwood produced an evening newspaper , with a paragraph , which spoke of the serious illness of [Mr. Strangwyn]247-mr. strangwyn ; recovery , it was said , could hardly be hoped for .

" What 's more , "[177-sherwood] cried [Sherwood]177-sherwood . " [I]177-sherwood 've seen [Ted Strangwyn]243-strangwyn [himself]243-strangwyn . [Nobody]2504-nobody could behave better . " Thought yes . "[156-warburton]

" With not much result , [I]177-sherwood see . Never mind ; [you]177-sherwood must have time . [I]177-sherwood want [you]177-sherwood to meet [Milligan]245-milligan . Could [you]177-sherwood come to lunch next Sunday ? [He]245-milligan invites [you]177-sherwood . "[177-sherwood]

[Warburton]156-warburton shook [his]156-warburton head . [He]156-warburton had never cared for the acquaintance of [rich men]1522-rich men , and was less than ever disposed to sit at [their]1522-rich men tables . All [his]156-warburton anxieties regarding [Sherwood]177-sherwood 's mental condition having been set at rest , [he]156-warburton would go on with [his]156-warburton grocer 's life as long as need be , strengthened with the hope that shone before [him]156-warburton .

The end of July had come . After a week of rain , the weather had turned bright , with a coolness at morning and evening very pleasant at this time of year in [London streets]1523-london streets . [Warburton]156-warburton had business in [the City]395-the city which [he]156-warburton must needs see to personally ; [he]156-warburton was on the point of leaving [the shop]2401-the shop , dressed as became [a respectable citizen]1526-a respectable citizen , silk hat and all , when in the doorway appeared [Miss Bertha Cross]183-bertha . A certain surprise marked [her]183-bertha smile of recognition ; it meant , no doubt , that , never before having seen [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha save bareheaded and aproned , [she]183-bertha was struck with the change in [his]222-bertha aspect when thus equipped for going abroad . Immediately [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha doffed [his]222-bertha hat and stepped behind the counter .

" Please do n't let [me]222-bertha keep [you]222-bertha , "[222-bertha] said [Bertha]222-bertha , with a glance towards [Allchin]161-allchin , who was making parcels at the back of [the shop]2401-the shop . " [I]161-allchin only want some some matches , and one or two trifling things . "[161-allchin]

Never had [she]183-bertha seemed so embarrassed in making a purchase . [Her]183-bertha eyes fell , and [she]183-bertha half turned away . [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha appeared to hesitate , [he]222-bertha also glancing towards [Allchin]161-allchin ; but [the young lady]458-the young lady quickly recovered [herself]458-the young lady , and , taking up a packet of something exhibited on the counter , asked its price . The awkwardness was at an end ; [Bertha]222-bertha made [her]183-bertha purchases , paid for them , and then left [the shop]2401-the shop as usual .

It was by the last post on the evening after this day that [Warburton]156-warburton received a letter of which the exterior puzzled [him]156-warburton . Whose could be [this graceful , delicate hand]1530-this graceful , delicate hand ? "[156-warburton] H'm !

" [Dear Mr. Warburton]156-warburton , [I]156-warburton am settled in [[my]156-warburton lodgings]3100-my lodgings [here]2261-here , and getting seriously to work . "[156-warburton]

That was all . And what exactly did it mean ? [Warburton]156-warburton 's practical knowledge of [women]2496-women did not carry [him]156-warburton very far , but [he]156-warburton was wo nt to theorise at large on the subject , and in this instance it seemed to [him]156-warburton that one of [his]156-warburton favourite generalities found neat application . [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan had in a high degree the feminine characteristic of not knowing [her]164-miss elvan own mind . Finding [herself]164-miss elvan without substantial means , [she]164-miss elvan of course meant to marry , and it was natural that [she]164-miss elvan should think of marrying [Norbert Franks]160-franks ; yet [she]164-miss elvan could not feel at all sure that [she]164-miss elvan wished to do so ; neither was [she]164-miss elvan perfectly certain that [Franks]160-franks would again offer [her]164-miss elvan the choice . In this state of doubt [she]164-miss elvan inclined to cultivate the acquaintance of [[Franks]160-franks ' intimate friend]1535-franks ' intimate friend , knowing that [she]164-miss elvan might thus , very probably , gather hints as to [the artist]329-the artist 's state of mind , and , if it seemed good to [her]164-miss elvan , could indirectly convey to [him]156-warburton a suggestion of [her]164-miss elvan own . [Warburton]156-warburton concluded , then , that [he]156-warburton was simply being made use of by [this typical young lady]1537-this typical young lady . And thus it came to pass . Through the morning there were showers , but about noon a breeze swept the sky fair , and softly glowing summer reigned over the rest of the day . In [his]156-warburton mood of hopefulness , [Warburton]156-warburton had no scruple about abandoning [the shop]2401-the shop at tea - time ; [he]156-warburton did not even trouble [himself]156-warburton to invent a decorous excuse , but told [Allchin]161-allchin plainly that [he]156-warburton thought [he]156-warburton would have a walk . [She]167-rosamund had not in the least the air of a coquette . Impossible to associate any such trivial idea with [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's habitual seriousness of bearing , and with the stamp of [her]167-rosamund features , which added some subtle charm to regularity and refinement . By temper critical , and especially disposed to mistrustful scrutiny by the present circumstances , [Warburton]156-warburton was yet unable to resist the softening influence of this quintessential womanhood . " [We]3120-we must try , "[167-rosamund] [she]167-rosamund said , with quiet earnestness .

" That is exaggerating , [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton , "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund . " Even in the old days [my]167-rosamund influence did n't go for much . " To tell [you]167-rosamund the truth , "[156-warburton] returned [Warburton]156-warburton , meeting [her]167-rosamund eyes steadily , with [his]156-warburton pleasantest look , " [I]156-warburton saw no harm in ' Sanctuary . ' [I]156-warburton think [he]156-warburton was quite right to do what [he]156-warburton could to earn money . [He]156-warburton wanted to be married ; [he]156-warburton had waited quite long enough ; if [he]156-warburton had n't done something of the kind , [I]156-warburton should have doubted whether [he]156-warburton was very much in earnest . No , no ; what [I]156-warburton call the revolution began when [he]156-warburton had lost all hope . At the time [he]156-warburton would have given up painting altogether , [I]156-warburton believe ; if it had n't been that [he]156-warburton owed [me]156-warburton money , and knew [I]156-warburton wanted it . "[156-warburton]

[Rosamund]167-rosamund made a quick movement of interest .

" [I]167-rosamund never heard about that . "[167-rosamund]

" [Franks]160-franks would n't talk about it , be sure . " How exquisite [London]18-london is at this time of the year ! "[156-warburton]

[He]156-warburton took up the letter again , and was about to re - read it , but suddenly altered [his]156-warburton mind , and thrust the folded paper into [his]156-warburton pocket .

Eight days went by . [Will]159-will had a visit from [Sherwood]177-sherwood , who brought news that [the whisky distiller]1578-the whisky distiller had seemed a little better , but could not possibly live more than a week or two . As regards [the vegetarian colony]1579-the vegetarian colony all went well ; [practical men]1580-practical men were at work on the details of the scheme ; [Sherwood]177-sherwood toiled for ten hours a day at secretarial correspondence . Next day , there came a postcard from [Rosamund]167-rosamund .

" Work ready to show [you]159-will . Could [you]159-will come and have a cup of tea to - morrow afternoon ? "[167-rosamund]

At the conventional hour [Will]159-will went to [Oakley Crescent]105-oakley crescent . Not , however , as [he]159-will had expected , to find [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan alone ; with [her]164-miss elvan sat [Mrs. Pomfret]168-mrs. pomfret , in [London]18-london for the afternoon . [The simple and kindly lady]1581-the simple and kindly lady talked as usual , but [Will]159-will , nervously observant , felt sure that [she]1581-the simple and kindly lady was not quite at [her]1581-the simple and kindly lady ease . On the other hand , nothing could have been more naturally graceful than [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's demeanour ; whether pouring out tea , or exhibiting [her]1581-the simple and kindly lady water - colours , or leading the talk to subjects of common interest , [she]1581-the simple and kindly lady was charming in [her]1581-the simple and kindly lady own way , a way which borrowed nothing from the every - day graces of [the drawing - room]741-the drawing - room . [Her]1581-the simple and kindly lady voice , always subdued , had a range of melodious expression which caressed the ear , no matter how trifling the words [she]1581-the simple and kindly lady uttered , and at moments its slightly tremulous murmur on rich notes suggested depths of sentiment lying beneath this familiar calm . To [[her]1581-the simple and kindly lady aunt]795-her aunt [she]1581-the simple and kindly lady spoke with a touch of playful affection ; when [her]1581-the simple and kindly lady eyes turned to [Warburton]156-warburton , [their]1584-their look almost suggested the frankness of simple friendship , and [her]1581-the simple and kindly lady tone was that of the largest confidence .

Never had [Will]159-will felt [himself]159-will so lulled to oblivion of things external ; [he]159-will forgot the progress of time , and only when [Mrs. Pomfret]168-mrs. pomfret spoke of [the train]579-the train [she]168-mrs. pomfret had to catch , made an effort to break the lazy spell and take [his]159-will leave .

On the morrow , and on the day after that , [he]159-will shirked business during the afternoon , excusing [himself]159-will with the plea that the heat of [the shop]2401-the shop was insufferable . [He]159-will knew that neglect of work was growing upon [him]159-will , and again [he]159-will observed that [Allchin]161-allchin seemed rather pleased than vexed by these needless absences . The third day saw [him]159-will behind the counter until five o'clock , when [he]159-will was summoned as usual to [the back parlour]1587-the back parlour to tea . Laying before [him]159-will a plate of watercress and slices of brown bread and butter , [Mrs. Allchin]161-allchin , [a discreetly conversational young woman]1588-a discreetly conversational young woman , remarked on the continued beauty of the weather , and added a hope that [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha would not feel obliged to remain in [the shop]2401-the shop this evening .

" No , no , it 's [[your]161-allchin husband]3173-your husband 's turn , "[159-will] [Will]159-will replied good - naturedly . " [He]3173-your husband wants a holiday more than [I]159-will do . "[159-will]

" [Allchin]161-allchin want a ' oliday , [sir]2259-sir ! "[296-the woman] exclaimed [the woman]296-the woman . " Why [he]3173-your husband never knows what to do with [himself]3173-your husband when [he]3173-your husband 's away from business . [He]3173-your husband enjoys business , does [Allchin]161-allchin . Do n't [you]2259-sir think of [him]3173-your husband , [sir]2259-sir . [I]296-the woman never knew [a man]2336-a man so altered since [he]3173-your husband 's been kept to regular work all the year round . [I]296-the woman used to dread the Sundays , and still more the Bank holidays when [we]3177-we were [here]2261-here first ; [you]2259-sir never knew who [he]3173-your husband 'd get quarrelling with as soon as [he]3173-your husband 'd nothing to do But now , [sir]2259-sir , why [I]296-the woman do n't believe [you]2259-sir 'll find [a less quarrelsome man]3180-a less quarrelsome man anywhere , and [he]3173-your husband was saying for a joke only yesterday , that [he]3173-your husband did n't think [he]3173-your husband could knock down even [a coster]3181-a coster , [he]3173-your husband 's so lost the habit . "[296-the woman]

[Will]159-will yielded and stole away into the mellowing sunshine . [He]159-will walked westward , till [he]159-will found [himself]159-will on the Embankment by [Albert Bridge]114-albert bridge ; here , after hesitating awhile , [he]159-will took the turn into [Oakley Street]122-oakley street . [He]159-will had no thought of calling to see [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan ; upon that [he]159-will could not venture ; but [he]159-will thought it barely possible that [he]159-will might meet with [her]164-miss elvan in [this neighbourhood]1384-this neighbourhood , and such a meeting would have been pleasant . Disappointed , [he]159-will crossed [the river]304-the river , lingered a little in [Battersea Park]5-battersea park , came back again over [the bridge]1306-the bridge , and , with a sudden leap of the heart , which all but made [his]159-will whole body spring forward , saw [a slim figure in grey moving by the parapet in front of [Cheyne Walk]108-cheyne walk]1594-a slim figure in grey moving by the parapet in front of cheyne walk .

[They]1595-they shook hands without speaking , very much as though [they]1595-they had met by appointment .

" Oh , these sunsets ! "[167-rosamund] were [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's first words , when [they]1595-they had moved a few steps together .

" [They]3182-they used to be [my]159-will delight when [I]159-will lived [there]2302-there , "[159-will] [Will]159-will replied , pointing eastward .

" Show [me]159-will just where it was , will [you]167-rosamund ? "[159-will]

[They]1595-they turned , and went as far as [Chelsea Bridge]1-chelsea bridge , where [Warburton]156-warburton pointed out the windows of [[his]156-warburton old flat]1596-his old flat .

" [You]159-will were very happy there ? "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund .

" Happy ? Not unhappy , at all events . Yes , in a way [I]156-warburton enjoyed [my]156-warburton life ; chiefly because [I]156-warburton did n't think much about it . "[156-warburton]

" Look at the sky , now . "[156-warburton]

The sun had gone down in the duskily golden haze that hung above [[the river]304-the river 's vague horizon]1598-the river 's vague horizon . Above , on the violet sky , stood range over range of pleated clouds , their hue the deepest rose , shading to purple in the folds .

" In [other countries]3184-other countries , "[156-warburton] continued the soft , murmuring voice , " [I]156-warburton have never seen a sky like that . [I]156-warburton love this [London]18-london ! "[156-warburton]

" As [I]156-warburton used to , "[156-warburton] said [Warburton]156-warburton , " and shall again . "[156-warburton]

[They]1595-they loitered back past [Chelsea Hospital]3-chelsea hospital , exchanging brief , insignificant sentences . Then for many minutes neither spoke , and in this silence [they]1595-they came to [the foot of [Oakley Street]122-oakley street]1599-the foot of oakley street , where again [they]1595-they stood gazing at the sky . Scarcely changed in form , the western clouds had shed their splendour , and were now so coldly pale that one would have imagined [them]1600-them stricken with moonlight ; but no moon had risen , only in a clear space of yet blue sky glistened the evening star .

" [I]167-rosamund must go in , "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund abruptly , as though starting from a dream .

CHAPTER 34

[She]167-rosamund was gone , and [Warburton]156-warburton stood biting [his]156-warburton lips . Had [he]156-warburton shaken hands with [her]167-rosamund ? Had [he]156-warburton said good - night ? [He]156-warburton could not be sure . Nothing was present to [him]156-warburton but a sense of gawkish confusion , following on a wild impulse which both ashamed and alarmed [him]156-warburton , [he]156-warburton stood in a bumpkin attitude , biting [his]156-warburton lips .

A hansom came crawling by , and [the driver]292-the driver called [his]156-warburton attention " [Keb]250-keb , [sir]2259-sir ? "[292-the driver] At once [he]156-warburton stepped forward , sprang on to the footboard , and stood there looking foolish .

" Good idea . "[156-warburton]

[The cab]291-the cab keeping alongside with [him]156-warburton , [he]156-warburton walked to [the public - house]485-the public - house , and there , midway in whisky - and - soda , looked up in the great red volume the name of [Strangwyn]243-strangwyn . There it was , [a house in [Kensington Gore]124-kensington gore]1604-a house in kensington gore . [He]156-warburton jumped into the hansom , and , as [he]156-warburton was driven down [Park Lane]125-park lane , [he]156-warburton felt that [he]156-warburton had enjoyed nothing so much for a long time ; it was [the child]1605-the child 's delight in " having a ride "[1605-the child] ; the air blew deliciously on [his]156-warburton cheeks , and the trotting clap of the horse 's hoofs , the jingle of the bells , aided [his]156-warburton exhilaration . And when [the driver]292-the driver pulled up , it was with an extraordinary gaiety that [Will]159-will paid [him]292-the driver and shouted good - night .

[He]156-warburton approached the door of [[Mr. Strangwyn]247-mr. strangwyn 's dwelling]1607-mr. strangwyn 's dwelling . " Coming to make inquiry ? "[177-sherwood] asked [Sherwood]177-sherwood . " [I]177-sherwood 've just been doing the same thing . "[177-sherwood]

" [I]177-sherwood can quite understand [your]177-sherwood impatience . It seems an extraordinary case ; [the poor old man]3192-the poor old man , by every rule , ought to have died weeks ago . Which way are [you]177-sherwood walking ? "[177-sherwood]

" [I]1614-i want to speak to [you]156-warburton , [sir]2259-sir , "[1614-i] [he]1614-i said , " about this golden syrup [we]1612-i 've had from [Rowbottom]251-rowbottom 's "[1614-i]

[Will]159-will listened , or seemed to listen , smiling at vacancy . To whatever [Allchin]161-allchin proposed , [he]159-will gave [his]159-will assent , and in the afternoon , without daring to say a word [he]159-will stole into freedom .

[He]159-will was once more within sight of [Albert Bridge]114-albert bridge . [He]159-will walked or prowled for half an hour close about [Oakley Crescent]105-oakley crescent . [They]1623-they stood with face turned toward [the lurid south]1624-the lurid south . The air was very still . From away down [the river]304-the river sounded the bells of [Lambeth Church]127-lambeth church , their volleying clang softened by distance to a monotonous refrain , drearily at one with the sadness of the falling night . [Warburton]156-warburton heard [them]1626-them , yet heard [them]1626-them not ; all external sounds blended with that within [him]156-warburton , which was the furious beating of [his]156-warburton heart . " Why did [you]167-rosamund run away ? "[222-bertha]

" Who was that behind the counter ? "[167-rosamund] [she]167-rosamund asked , under [her]167-rosamund breath .

" [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha . Why ? "[167-rosamund]

" What 's the matter ? "[222-bertha]

" [Bertha Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha is [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton . "[222-bertha]

" Nonsense ! "[222-bertha]

" But [he]222-bertha is ! Here 's the explanation here 's the mystery . [A grocer in an apron]3221-a grocer in an apron ! "[222-bertha]

[Bertha]222-bertha was standing still . [She]167-rosamund , too , looked astonished , perplexed .

" Is n't it a case of extraordinary likeness ? "[167-rosamund] [she]167-rosamund asked , with a grave smile .

" Oh , dear , no ! [I]222-bertha met [his]222-bertha eye [he]222-bertha showed that [he]222-bertha knew [me]222-bertha and then [his]222-bertha voice . [A grocer in an apron]3221-a grocer in an apron ? "[222-bertha]

" This is very shocking , "[222-bertha] said [Bertha]222-bertha , with a recovery of [her]167-rosamund natural humour . " Let [us]3223-us walk . Let [us]3223-us shake off the nightmare . "[222-bertha]

The word applied very well to [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's condition ; [her]167-rosamund fixed eyes were like those of [a somnambulist]1643-a somnambulist .

" But , [Bertha]222-bertha ! "[167-rosamund] [she]167-rosamund suddenly exclaimed , in a voice of almost petulant protest . " [He]222-bertha knew [you]222-bertha all the time oh , but perhaps [he]222-bertha did not know [your]222-bertha name ? "[167-rosamund]

" Indeed [he]222-bertha did . [He]222-bertha 's constantly sending things to [the house]450-the house . "[222-bertha]

" How extraordinary ! Did [you]222-bertha ever hear such an astonishing thing in [your]222-bertha life ? "[167-rosamund]

" [You]222-bertha said more than once , "[222-bertha] remarked [Bertha]222-bertha , " that [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton was [a man of mystery]3225-a man of mystery . "[222-bertha]

" Oh , but how could [I]167-rosamund have imagined ! [grocer]2630-grocer ! "[167-rosamund]

" In an apron ! "[167-rosamund] added the other , with awed voice .

" But , [Bertha]222-bertha , does [Norbert]160-franks know ? [He]160-franks declared [he]160-franks had never found out what [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton did . Was that true , or not ? "[167-rosamund]

" Ah , that 's the question . If [poor Mr. Franks]160-franks has had this secret upon [his]160-franks soul ! [I]167-rosamund can hardly believe it . And yet [they]3227-they are such [intimate friends]3228-intimate friends . "[167-rosamund]

" [He]160-franks must have known it , "[167-rosamund] declared [Rosamund]167-rosamund .

Thereupon [she]167-rosamund became mute , and only a syllable of dismay escaped [her]167-rosamund now and then during the rest of the walk to [[the Crosses]2824-the crosses ' house]1645-the crosses ' house . [[Her]167-rosamund companion]750-her companion , too , was absorbed in thought . At the door [Rosamund]167-rosamund offered [her]167-rosamund hand . No , [she]167-rosamund would not come in ; [she]167-rosamund had work which must positively be finished this afternoon whilst daylight lasted .

Out of [the by - street]1647-the by - street , [Rosamund]167-rosamund turned into [Fulham Road]38-fulham road , and there found [a cab]1274-a cab to convey [[her]167-rosamund [home]354-home]1649-her home . On entering [the house]450-the house , [she]167-rosamund gave instructions that [she]167-rosamund was at [home]354-home to [nobody]2504-nobody this afternoon ; then [she]167-rosamund sat down at the table , as though to work on a drawing , but at the end of an hour [her]167-rosamund brush had not yet been dipped in colour . [She]167-rosamund rose , stood in the attitude of [one who knows not what to do , and at length moved to the window]1654-one who knows not what to do , and at length moved to the window . On the opposite side of [the little square]1655-the little square stood [a man]2336-a man , looking toward [[her]167-rosamund house]1657-her house ; and [that man]2776-that man was [Warburton]156-warburton .

From safe retirement , [she]167-rosamund watched [him]2336-a man . [He]2336-a man walked this way ; [he]2336-a man walked that ; again [he]2336-a man stood still , [his]2336-a man eyes upon [the house]450-the house . Would [he]2336-a man cross over ? Would [he]2336-a man venture to knock at the door ? No , [he]2336-a man withdrew ; [he]2336-a man disappeared .

Presently it was the hour of dusk . Every few minutes [Rosamund]167-rosamund reconnoitred at the window , and at length , just perceptible to [her]167-rosamund straining eyes , there again stood [Warburton]156-warburton . [He]156-warburton came forward . Standing with hand pressed against [her]167-rosamund side , [she]167-rosamund waited in nervous anguish for a knock at the front door ; but it did not sound . [She]167-rosamund stood motionless for a long , long time , then drew a deep , deep breath , and trembled as [she]167-rosamund let [herself]167-rosamund sink into a chair .

Earlier than usual , [she]167-rosamund went up to [[her]167-rosamund bedroom]1660-her bedroom . In a corner of [the room]305-the room stood [her]167-rosamund trunk ; this [she]167-rosamund opened , and from the chest of drawers [she]167-rosamund took forth articles of apparel , which [she]167-rosamund began to pack , as though for a journey . When the trunk was half full , [she]167-rosamund ceased in weariness , rested for a little , and then went to bed .

And in the darkness there came a sound of subdued sobbing . It lasted for some minutes ceased for some minutes was again audible . Then silence fell upon [the chamber]1662-the chamber .

Lying awake between seven and eight next morning , [Rosamund]167-rosamund heard [the postman]1663-the postman 's knock . At once [she]167-rosamund sprang out of bed , slipped on [her]167-rosamund dressing - gown , and rang the bell . Two letters were brought up to [her]167-rosamund ; [she]167-rosamund received them with tremulous hand . Both were addressed in writing , unmistakably masculine ; the one was thick , the other was thin and this [she]167-rosamund opened first .

" [Dear Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan "[156-warburton] it was [Warburton]156-warburton who wrote " [I]156-warburton hoped to see [you]167-rosamund this evening , as [we]3229-we had appointed . [She]167-rosamund laid it aside , and broke the other envelope .

" [Dear]635-dear , dearest [Rosamund]167-rosamund "[160-franks] thus began [Norbert Franks]160-franks " [our]3229-we talk this morning has left [me]160-franks in a state of mind which threatens frenzy . And so on , over two sheets of the very best notepaper , with [Norbert]160-franks 's respectable address handsomely stamped in red at the top . "[167-rosamund] And therewith [she]167-rosamund remained [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton 's sincerely .

" Please let this be posted at once , "[167-rosamund] said [Rosamund]167-rosamund when [the landlady]563-the landlady came to clear away .

CHAPTER 36

[His]1668-his hands upon the counter , [Warburton]156-warburton stared at the door by which first [Rosamund]167-rosamund , then [Bertha Cross]183-bertha , had disappeared . [His]156-warburton nerves were a - tremble ; [his]156-warburton eyes were hot . Of a sudden [he]156-warburton felt [himself]156-warburton shaken with irresistible mirth ; from the diaphragm it mounted to [his]156-warburton throat , and only by a great effort did [he]156-warburton save [himself]156-warburton from exploding in laughter . The orgasm possessed [him]156-warburton for several minutes . It was followed by a sense of light - heartedness , which set [him]156-warburton walking about , rubbing [his]156-warburton hands together , and humming tunes .

At last the burden had fallen from [him]156-warburton ; the foolish secret was blown abroad ; once more [he]156-warburton could look [the world]364-the world in the face , bidding [it]364-the world think of [him]156-warburton what it would .

[They]1670-they were talking now [the two girls]1671-the two girls , discussing [their]1670-they strange discovery . When [he]156-warburton saw [Rosamund]167-rosamund this evening of course [he]156-warburton would see [her]167-rosamund , as [she]167-rosamund had promised [her]167-rosamund surprise would already have lost its poignancy ; [he]156-warburton had but to tell the story of [his]156-warburton disaster , of [his]156-warburton struggles , and then to announce the coming moment of rescue . No chance could have been happier than this which betrayed [him]156-warburton to [these two]1672-these two at the same time ; for [Bertha Cross]183-bertha 's good sense would be the best possible corrective of any shock [[her]183-bertha more sensitive companion]1673-her more sensitive companion might have received . [Bertha Cross]183-bertha 's good sense that was how [he]156-warburton thought of [her]167-rosamund , without touch of emotion ; whilst on [Rosamund]167-rosamund [his]156-warburton imagination dwelt with exultant fervour . [He]156-warburton saw [himself]156-warburton as [he]156-warburton would appear in [her]167-rosamund eyes when [she]167-rosamund knew all noble , heroic . What [he]156-warburton had done was a fine thing , beyond the reach of [ordinary self - regarding mortals]1674-ordinary self - regarding mortals , and who more capable than [Rosamund]167-rosamund of appreciating such courage ? After all , fate was kind . In [the byways of [London]18-london]1675-the byways of london it had wrought for [him]156-warburton a structure of romance , and amid mean pursuits it exalted [him]156-warburton to an ideal of love .

And as [he]156-warburton thus dreamt , and smiled and gloried very much like [an aproned Malvolio]1676-an aproned malvolio the hours went quickly by . [He]156-warburton found [himself]156-warburton near [Albert Bridge]114-albert bridge , pacing this way and that , expecting at every moment the appearance of [the slim figure clad in grey]1677-the slim figure clad in grey . [He]156-warburton went [home]354-home , and wrote to [her]167-rosamund .

In a score of ways [he]156-warburton explained to [himself]156-warburton [her]167-rosamund holding aloof . It was vexation at [his]156-warburton not having confided in [her]167-rosamund ; it was a desire to reflect before seeing [him]156-warburton again ; it was and so on , all through the night , which brought [him]156-warburton never a wink of sleep . Next morning , [he]156-warburton did not go to [the shop]2401-the shop ; it would have been impossible to stand at the counter for ten minutes , [he]156-warburton sent a note to [Allchin]161-allchin , saying that [he]156-warburton was detained by private affairs , then set off for a day - long walk in [the country]2354-the country , to kill time until the coming of [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's reply . [He]156-warburton was in [Paris]29-paris ; yet how could that be ? Now [he]156-warburton had taken another ticket . [His]156-warburton bag was being registered for [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz . A long journey lay before [him]156-warburton . [He]156-warburton yawned violently , half remembering that [he]156-warburton had passed two nights without sleep . Now for the first time did [he]156-warburton seem to be really aware of what [he]156-warburton was doing . [Rosamund]167-rosamund had taken flight to [the Pyrenees]102-the pyrenees , and [he]156-warburton was in hot pursuit . [He]156-warburton grew exhilarated in the thought of [his]156-warburton virile energy . " Yes , [I]156-warburton am [a grocer]492-a grocer ; [I]156-warburton have lived for a couple of years by selling tea and sugar not to speak of treacle ; but none the less [I]156-warburton am [the man [you]167-rosamund drew on to love [you]167-rosamund]3238-the man you drew on to love you . [She]167-rosamund should take [him]156-warburton as [he]156-warburton was , [[grocer]2630-grocer 's shop]1701-grocer 's shop and all ; not until [her]167-rosamund troth was pledged would [he]156-warburton make known to [her]167-rosamund the prospect of better things . CHAPTER 37

Amid struggle and gloom the scene changed . [He]156-warburton was in [Kew Gardens]98-kew gardens , rushing hither and thither , in search of some one . The sun still beat upon [him]156-warburton , and [he]156-warburton streamed at every pore . [He]156-warburton bounded forward . In a moment [he]156-warburton would see the face , and would know

This was [the hotel at [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz]1721-the hotel at st. jean de luz . What could be the time ? [He]156-warburton had no matches at hand , and did not know where the bell was . Looking around , [he]156-warburton perceived at length a thread of light , of daylight undoubtedly , which must come from the window . [He]156-warburton got out of bed , cautiously crossed the floor , found the window , and the means of opening it , then unlatched the shutters which had kept [the room]305-the room in darkness . At once a flood of sunshine poured in . Looking forth , [he]156-warburton saw [a quiet little street of houses and gardens]1723-a quiet little street of houses and gardens , and beyond , some miles away , [a mountain peak]1724-a mountain peak rising against the cloudless blue .

[His]156-warburton watch had run down . [He]156-warburton rang the bell , and learnt that the hour was nearly eleven .

" [I]156-warburton have slept well , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton said in [his]156-warburton Anglo - French . " [I]156-warburton am hungry . Bring [me]156-warburton hot water . Good , [he]156-warburton would go [there]2302-there after lunch . And until that meal was ready , [he]156-warburton strolled out to have a look at [the sea]1729-the sea . At noon , [he]156-warburton ate and drank heroically , then , having had [his]156-warburton way pointed out to [him]156-warburton , set forth on the quest . [He]156-warburton passed through [the length of [the town]592-the town]1735-the length of the town , crossed [the little river Nivelle]1737-the little river nivelle , where [he]156-warburton paused for a moment on [the bridge]1306-the bridge , to gaze at [the panorama of mountains]1739-the panorama of mountains , all but to [the summit clad in soft verdure]1740-the summit clad in soft verdure , and presently turned into [an inland road]1741-an inland road , which led [him]156-warburton between [pastures]1742-pastures and [fields of maize]1743-fields of maize , gently upwards . On a height before [him]156-warburton stood [a house]725-a house , which [he]156-warburton believed to be that [he]156-warburton sought ; [he]156-warburton had written down [its]725-a house unrememberable Basque name , and inquiry of [a peasant]1745-a peasant assured [him]156-warburton that [he]156-warburton was not mistaken . Having [his]156-warburton goal in view , [he]156-warburton stood to reflect . Could [he]156-warburton march up to the front door , and ask boldly for [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan ? But the doubt suddenly struck [him]156-warburton what if [Rosamund]167-rosamund were not living [here]2261-here ? At [Mrs. Coppinger]252-mrs. coppinger 's [[her]252-mrs. coppinger sister]818-her sister was [governess]1748-governess ; [she]818-her sister had bidden [him]156-warburton address letters [there]2302-there , but that might be merely for convenience ; perhaps [she]818-her sister was not [[Mrs. Coppinger]252-mrs. coppinger 's guest]1750-mrs. coppinger 's guest at all , but had an abode somewhere in [the town]592-the town . In that case , [he]156-warburton must see [[her]252-mrs. coppinger sister who perhaps , nay , all but certainly , had never heard [his]156-warburton name]1752-her sister who perhaps , nay , all but certainly , had never heard his name .

[He]156-warburton walked on . [The road]929-the road became [a hollow lane]1754-a hollow lane , with fern and heather and gorse intermingled below the thickets on the bank . Another five minutes would bring [him]156-warburton to [the top of [the hill]1756-the hill]1755-the top of the hill , to [the avenue of trees by which [the house]450-the house was approached]1757-the avenue of trees by which the house was approached . And the nearer [he]156-warburton came , the more awkward seemed [his]156-warburton enterprise . It might have been better to write a note to [Rosamund]167-rosamund , announcing [his]156-warburton arrival , and asking for an interview . On the other hand that was a timid proceeding ; boldly to present [himself]156-warburton before [her]167-rosamund would be much more effective . If [he]156-warburton could only be sure of seeing [her]167-rosamund , and seeing [her]167-rosamund alone .

For a couple of hours did [he]156-warburton loiter irresolutely , ever hoping that chance might help [him]156-warburton . Perhaps , as the afternoon grew cooler , [people]2321-people might come forth from [the house]450-the house . [His]156-warburton patience at length worn out , [he]156-warburton again entered [the avenue]1761-the avenue , half resolved to go up to the door .

All at once [he]156-warburton heard voices the voices of [children]2532-children , and toward [him]156-warburton came [two little girls]1763-two little girls , followed by [a young lady]1764-a young lady . [They]1763-two little girls drew near . Standing [his]156-warburton ground , with muscles tense , [Warburton]156-warburton glanced at [the young lady]458-the young lady 's face , and could not doubt that this was [[Rosamund]167-rosamund 's sister]1766-rosamund 's sister ; the features were much less notable than [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's , but [their]1763-two little girls gentle prettiness made claim of kindred with [her]458-the young lady . Forthwith [he]156-warburton doffed [his]156-warburton hat , and advanced respectfully .

" [I]156-warburton think [I]156-warburton am speaking to [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan ? "[156-warburton]

A nervous smile , a timidly surprised affirmative , put [him]156-warburton a little more at [his]156-warburton ease .

" [My]156-warburton name is [Warburton]156-warburton , "[156-warburton] [he]156-warburton pursued , with the half humorous air of one who takes a liberty which [he]156-warburton feels sure will be pardoned . " [[Your]156-warburton sister]2643-your sister is here , [I]156-warburton think , "[156-warburton] fell from [Warburton]156-warburton , as [he]156-warburton threw a glance at [the two little girls]1767-the two little girls , who had drawn apart .

" Here ? Oh , no . Not long ago [she]2643-your sister thought of coming , but "[156-warburton]

[Will]159-will stood confounded . All manner of conjectures flashed through [his]159-will mind . [Rosamund]167-rosamund must have broken [her]167-rosamund journey somewhere . That [she]167-rosamund had not left [England]23-england at all seemed impossible .

" [I]159-will was mistaken , "[159-will] [he]159-will forced [himself]159-will to remark carelessly . Then , with a friendly smile , " Forgive [me]159-will for intruding [myself]159-will . [I]159-will came up here for the view "[159-will]

" Yes , is n't it beautiful ! "[214-winifred] exclaimed [Winifred]214-winifred , evidently glad of this diversion from personal topics . And [they]1768-they talked of [the landscape]570-the landscape , until [Warburton]156-warburton felt that [he]156-warburton must take [his]156-warburton leave . [He]156-warburton mentioned where [he]156-warburton was staying , said that [he]156-warburton hoped to spend a week or so at [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz and so got away , with an uneasy feeling that [his]156-warburton behaviour had not exactly been such as to recommend [him]156-warburton to [the timid young lady]1770-the timid young lady .

[Rosamund]167-rosamund had broken [her]167-rosamund journey somewhere , that was evident ; perhaps in [Paris]29-paris , where [he]156-warburton knew [she]167-rosamund had [friends]737-friends . If [she]167-rosamund did not arrive this evening , or to - morrow , [[her]167-rosamund sister]818-her sister would at all events hear that [she]167-rosamund was coming . But how was [he]156-warburton to be informed of [her]167-rosamund arrival ? How could [he]156-warburton keep an espial on [the house]450-the house ? [His]156-warburton situation was wretchedly unlike that [he]156-warburton had pictured to [himself]156-warburton ; instead of [the romantic lover]1774-the romantic lover , carrying all before [him]156-warburton by the energy of passion , [he]156-warburton had to play a plotting , almost sneaking part , in constant fear of being taken for [a presumptuous interloper]1775-a presumptuous interloper . Lucky that [Rosamund]167-rosamund had spoken of [him]156-warburton to [[her]167-rosamund sister]818-her sister . Well , [he]156-warburton must wait ; though waiting was the worst torture for [a man in [his]156-warburton mood]1777-a man in his mood .

[He]156-warburton idled through the day on [the seashore]1778-the seashore . "[889-a gentleman] Ho , ho ! [Winifred Elvan]214-winifred had mentioned [their]1784-their meeting , and [the people]1785-the people wished to be friendly . Excellent ! The weather was very hot unusually hot , said [people at [the hotel]2304-the hotel]1786-people at the hotel . [He]156-warburton passed along [the shady avenue]1790-the shady avenue , and [the house]450-the house door was opened to [him]156-warburton by [a Basque maid - servant]1792-a basque maid - servant , who led [him]156-warburton to [the drawing - room]741-the drawing - room . [Here]2261-here , in a dim light which filtered through the interstices of shutters , sat [the lady of [the house]450-the house]1795-the lady of the house alone .

" Is it [Mr. Warburton]156-warburton ? "[1795-the lady of the house] [she]1795-the lady of the house asked , rising feebly , and speaking in a thin , fatigued , but kindly voice . Oh , the terrible heat ! "[1795-the lady of the house]

[Will]159-will stayed for a couple of hours , amused with [Mr. Coppinger]254-mr. coppinger 's talk , and pleased with [the gentle society of [the ladies]1311-the ladies]1799-the gentle society of the ladies . The invitation to breakfast being seriously repeated , [he]159-will rejoiced to accept it . See how [Providence]257-providence favours the daring . When [Rosamund]167-rosamund arrived , [she]167-rosamund would find [him]159-will established as [a friend of [the Coppingers]258-the coppingers]1801-a friend of the coppingers . [He]159-will went [his]159-will way exultingly .

But neither on the morrow , nor the day after , did [Winifred]214-winifred receive any news from [[her]214-winifred sister]818-her sister . Will of course kept to [himself]159-will the events of [his]159-will last two days in [London]18-london ; [he]159-will did not venture to hint at any knowledge of [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's movements . A suspicion was growing in [his]159-will mind that [she]167-rosamund might not have left [England]23-england ; in which case , was ever [man]914-man 's plight more ridiculous than [his]159-will ? It would mean that [Rosamund]167-rosamund had deliberately misled [him]159-will ; but could [he]159-will think [her]167-rosamund capable of that ? If it were so , and if [her]167-rosamund feelings toward [him]159-will had undergone so abruptly violent a change simply because of the discovery [she]167-rosamund had made why , then [Rosamund]167-rosamund was not [Rosamund]167-rosamund at all , and [he]159-will might write [himself]159-will down a most egregious ass .

Had not an inkling of some such thing whispered softly to [him]159-will before now ? Had there not been moments , during the last fortnight , when [he]159-will stood , as it were , face to face with [himself]159-will , and felt oddly abashed by a look in [his]159-will own eyes ?

Before leaving [[his]159-will lodgings]1175-his lodgings [he]159-will had written on a piece of paper " Poste Restante , [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz , [France]34-france , "[159-will] and had given it to [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , with the charge to forward immediately any letter or telegram that might arrive for [him]159-will . But [his]159-will inquiries at [the post - office]1805-the post - office were vain . To be sure , weeks had often gone by without bringing [him]159-will a letter ; there was nothing strange in this silence yet it vexed and disquieted [him]159-will . On the fourth day of [his]159-will waiting , the weather suddenly broke , rain fell in torrents , and continued for forty - eight hours . Had not [[the Coppingers]258-the coppingers ' house]1780-the coppingers ' house been open to [him]159-will [he]159-will must have spent a wretched time . Returning to [the hotel]2304-the hotel on the second evening of deluge , [he]159-will looked in at [the post - office]1805-the post - office , and this time a letter was put into [his]159-will hand . [He]159-will opened and read it at once .

" [Dear old boy]3251-dear old boy , why [the deuce]2599-the deuce have [you]3251-dear old boy gone away to [the end of [the earth]3254-the earth]3253-the end of the earth without letting [me]159-will know ? [I]159-will called at [[your]3251-dear old boy place]3255-your place this evening , and was amazed at the sight of the address which [[your]3251-dear old boy evil - eyed woman]3256-your evil - eyed woman showed [me]159-will looking as if [she]3256-your evil - eyed woman feared [I]159-will should steal it . [I]159-will wanted particularly to see [you]3251-dear old boy . How long are [you]3251-dear old boy going to stay down yonder ? [Rosamund]167-rosamund and [I]159-will start for [our]3257-our honeymoon on Thursday next , and [we]3257-our shall probably be away for a couple of months , in [Tyrol]134-tyrol . Does this astonish [you]3251-dear old boy ? It ought n't to , seeing that [you]3251-dear old boy 've done [your]3251-dear old boy best to bring it about . [I]159-will 'll tell [you]3251-dear old boy all the details some day though there 's very little to tell that [you]3251-dear old boy do n't know . Congratulate [me]159-will on having come to [my]159-will senses . How precious near [I]159-will was to making a tremendous fool of [myself]159-will . It 's [you]3251-dear old boy [I]159-will have to thank , [old man]2310-old man . Write to [my]159-will [London]18-london address , and it will be forwarded . "[159-will]

[Will]159-will thrust the letter into [his]159-will pocket , went out into [the street]655-the street , and walked to [the hotel]2304-the hotel through heavy rain , without thinking to open [his]159-will umbrella .

Next morning , the sky was clear again , the sunny air fresh as that of spring . [Will]159-will rose earlier than usual , and set out on an excursion . [He]159-will took train to [Hendaye]135-hendaye , [the little frontier town]1811-the little frontier town , at [the mouth of [the Bidassoa]107-bidassoa]1812-the mouth of the bidassoa , crossed [the river]304-the river in [a boat]1814-a boat , stepped on to [Spanish soil]1815-spanish soil , and climbed [the hill on which [stands Fuenterabbia]137-stands fuenterabbia]1816-the hill on which stands fuenterabbia .

Later [he]159-will passed again to [the French shore]1817-the french shore , and lunched at [the hotel]2304-the hotel . Then [he]159-will took [a carriage]1450-a carriage , and drove up [the gorge of [Bidassoa]107-bidassoa]1820-the gorge of bidassoa , enjoying [the wild mountain scenery]1821-the wild mountain scenery as much as [he]159-will had enjoyed anything in [his]159-will life . [The road]929-the road bridged [the river]304-the river ; it brought [him]159-will into [Spain]132-spain once more , and on as far as to [the Spanish village of Vera]1824-the spanish village of vera , where [he]159-will lingered in the mellowing afternoon . All round [him]159-will were [green slopes of [the Pyrenees]102-the pyrenees]1825-green slopes of the pyrenees , green with [pasture and with turf , with bracken , with woods of oak]1826-pasture and with turf , with bracken , with woods of oak . There came by a yoke of white oxen , [their]1827-their heads covered with the wonted sheepskin , and on [their]1827-their foreheads the fringe of red wool tassels ; [he]159-will touched a warm flank with [his]159-will palm , and looked into the mild , lustrous eyes of the beast that passed near [him]159-will .

" [Vera]259-vera , [Vera]259-vera , "[159-will] [he]159-will repeated to [himself]159-will , with pleasure in the name . [He]159-will should remember [Vera]259-vera when [he]159-will was back again behind the counter in [Fulham Road]38-fulham road . [He]159-will had never thought to see [the Pyrenees]102-the pyrenees , never dreamt of looking at [Spain]132-spain . It was a good holiday .

" [Vera]259-vera , [Vera]259-vera , "[159-will] [he]159-will again murmured . How came [the place to be so called]1828-the place to be so called ? The word seemed to mean true . [He]159-will mused upon it .

[He]159-will dined at [the village inn]1829-the village inn , then drove at dusk back to [Hendaye]135-hendaye , down [the great gorge]1830-the great gorge ; [crags and precipices]1831-crags and precipices , wooded ravines and [barren heights]1832-barren heights glooming magnificently under a sky warm with afterglow ; beside [him]159-will the torrent leapt and roared , and foamed into whiteness .

And from [Hendaye]135-hendaye [the train]579-the train brought [him]159-will back to [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz . Before going to bed , [he]159-will penned a note to [Mr. Coppinger]254-mr. coppinger , saying that [he]159-will was Unexpectedly obliged to leave for [England]23-england , at an early hour next day , and regretted that [he]159-will could not come to say good - bye . [He]159-will added a postscript . " [Miss Elvan]164-miss elvan will , of course , know of [[her]164-miss elvan sister]818-her sister 's marriage to [Norbert Franks]160-franks . [I]159-will hear it takes place to - morrow . Very good news . "[159-will]

This written , [he]159-will smoked a meditative pipe , and went [upstairs]642-upstairs humming a tune .

CHAPTER 38

Touching [the shore of [England]23-england]1835-the shore of england , [Will]159-will stamped like [a man who returns from exile]1836-a man who returns from exile . It was a blustering afternoon , more like November than August ; livid clouds pelted [him]159-will with rain , and the wind chilled [his]159-will face ; but this suited very well with the mood which possessed [him]159-will . [He]159-will had been away on a holiday a more expensive holiday than [he]159-will ought to have allowed [himself]159-will , and was back full of vigour . Instead of making [him]159-will qualmish , [the green roarers of [the Channel]138-the channel]1837-the green roarers of the channel had braced [his]159-will nerves , and put [him]159-will in good heart ; [the boat]1838-the boat could not roll and pitch half enough for [his]159-will spirits . A holiday a run to [the Pyrenees]2927-the pyrenees and back ; who durst say that it had been anything else ? [The only person who could see the matter in another light]1840-the only person who could see the matter in another light was little likely to disclose [her]1840-the only person who could see the matter in another light thoughts .

At [Dover]139-dover [he]159-will telegraphed to [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood : " Come and see [me]159-will to - night . "[159-will] True , [he]159-will had been absent only a week , but the time seemed to [him]159-will so long that [he]159-will felt it must have teemed with events . In [the railway carriage]1698-the railway carriage [he]159-will glowed with good fellowship toward [the other passengers]1842-the other passengers ; the rain - beaten hop - lands rejoiced [his]159-will eyes , and [the first houses of [London]18-london]1843-the first houses of london were so many friendly faces greeting [his]159-will return . From [the station]580-the station [he]159-will drove to [[his]159-will shop]1039-his shop . [Allchin]161-allchin , engaged in serving [a lady]1846-a lady , forgot [himself]161-allchin at the sight of [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha , and gave a shout of welcome . All was right , nothing troublesome had happened ; trade better than usual at this time of year .

" [He]159-will 'll have to put up the shutters , "[161-allchin] said [Allchin]161-allchin confidentially , with a nod in the direction of [the rival grocer]1847-the rival grocer . " [[His]159-will wife]569-his wife 's been making a row in [the shop]2401-the shop again disgraceful scene talk of [the ' ole neighbourhood]3264-the ' ole neighbourhood . Here [[his]156-warburton landlady]2607-his landlady met [him]156-warburton with the announcement that only a few hours ago [she]2607-his landlady had forwarded a letter delivered by the post this morning . " Confound it ! [I]177-sherwood hoped [you]914-man knew the worst . [Strangwyn]247-mr. strangwyn is dead . "[177-sherwood]

" [He]247-mr. strangwyn 's dead ? Well , is n't that what [we]3274-we 've been waiting for ? "[159-will]

" Not [the old man]3034-the old man , "[177-sherwood] groaned [Sherwood]177-sherwood , " not [the old man]3034-the old man . It 's [Ted Strangwyn]243-strangwyn that 's dead . Never was such an extraordinary case of bad luck . And [his]247-mr. strangwyn death the most astounding [you]914-man ever heard of . [He]247-mr. strangwyn was down in [Yorkshire]140-yorkshire for the grouse . The dogcart came round in the morning , and as [he]247-mr. strangwyn stood beside it , stowing away a gun or something , the horse made a movement forward , and the wheel went over [his]247-mr. strangwyn toe . [He]247-mr. strangwyn thought nothing of it . The next day [he]247-mr. strangwyn was ill ; it turned to [tetanus]260-tetanus ; and in a few hours [he]247-mr. strangwyn died . Did [you]914-man ever in [your]914-man life hear anything like that ? "[177-sherwood]

[Warburton]156-warburton had listened gravely . Towards the end , [his]177-sherwood features began to twitch , and , a moment after [Godfrey]177-sherwood had ceased , a spasm of laughter overcame [him]177-sherwood .

" [I]177-sherwood ca n't help it , [Sherwood]177-sherwood , "[177-sherwood] [he]177-sherwood gasped . " It 's brutal , [I]177-sherwood know , but [I]177-sherwood ca n't help it . "[177-sherwood]

Days went by , and at length the desired letter came back from [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz . Seeing at a glance that it was from [[his]227-st. jean de luz sister]663-his sister , [Will]159-will reproached [himself]227-st. jean de luz for having let more than a month elapse without writing to [St. Neots]49-st. neots . Of [his]227-st. jean de luz recent " holiday "[227-st. jean de luz] [he]227-st. jean de luz had no intention of saying a word . [Jane]202-jane wrote a longer letter than usual , and its tenor was disquieting . [[Their]1858-their mother]1436-their mother had not been at all well lately ; [Jane]202-jane noticed that [she]1436-their mother was becoming very weak . " [You]3292-you know how [she]1436-their mother dreads to give trouble , and can not bear to have any one worry about [her]1436-their mother . [She]1436-their mother has seen [Dr. Edge]265-dr. edge twice in the last few days , but not in [my]1436-their mother presence , and [I]1436-their mother feel sure that [she]1436-their mother has forbidden [him]227-st. jean de luz to tell [me]1436-their mother the truth about [her]1436-their mother . "[1436-their mother] After reading this [Will]159-will 's self - reproaches were doubled . At once [he]159-will set off for [St. Neots]49-st. neots .

[They]1863-they stood among the garden scents , amid the flowers , which told of parting summer , and conversed with voices softened by tender solicitude . [Jane]202-jane was above all anxious that [[her]202-jane brother]611-her brother 's visit should seem spontaneous , and [Will]159-will promised not to hint at the news [she]202-jane had sent [him]159-will . [They]1863-they entered [the house]450-the house together . [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton , after [her]176-warburton usual morning occupations , had lain down on the couch in [the parlour]1866-the parlour , and fallen asleep ; as soon as [he]159-will beheld [her]202-jane face , [Will]159-will understood [[his]159-will sister]663-his sister 's fears , White , motionless , beautiful in its absolute calm , the visage might have been that of the dead ; after gazing for a moment , both , on the same impulse , put forth a hand to touch the unconscious form . The eyelids rose a look of confused trouble darkened the features then the lips relaxed in a happy smile .

" [Will]159-will and [you]159-will find [me]159-will asleep ? [I]159-will appeal to [Jane]202-jane ; [she]202-jane will tell [you]159-will it 's only an accident . Did [you]159-will ever before see [me]159-will asleep like this , [Jane]202-jane ? "[159-will]

At once [she]202-jane rose , and moved about , and strove to be [herself]202-jane ; but the effort it cost [her]202-jane was too obvious ; presently [she]202-jane had to sit down , with tremulous limbs , and [Will]159-will noticed that [her]202-jane forehead was moist .

Not till evening did [he]159-will find it possible to lead the conversation to the subject of [her]202-jane health . [Jane]202-jane had purposely left [them]1868-them alone . [[Her]202-jane son]610-her son having said that [he]610-her son feared [she]202-jane was not so well as usual , [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton quietly admitted that [she]176-warburton had recently consulted [[her]176-warburton doctor]1288-her doctor .

" [I]176-warburton am not young , [Will]159-will , [you]159-will know . Sixty - five next birthday . "[176-warburton]

"[202-jane]

[Will]159-will was silent , deeply impressed by the calm voice , the noble thought . [He]159-will had always felt no less respect than love for [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother , especially during the latter years , when experience of life better enabled [him]159-will to understand [her]346-his mother rare qualities ; but a deeper reverence took possession of [him]159-will whilst [she]346-his mother was speaking . CHAPTER 39

[The garden]603-the garden was drenched in dew , and when about seven o'clock , the first sunbeam pierced the grey mantle of [the east]1878-the east , every leaf flashed back the yellow light . [Jane]202-jane came forth with [her]202-jane rosy morning face , [her]202-jane expression graver than of wo nt .

"[159-will]

[He]159-will related [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood 's reckless proceedings , and the circumstances which had decided [him]177-sherwood to take [a shop]3017-a shop . "[746-the listener]

[He]611-her brother broke off , laughing , and [Jane]202-jane smiled , though with a line of trouble on [her]202-jane brow .

" That wo n't do , "[202-jane] [she]202-jane said , with quiet decision .

After breakfast , [Will]159-will walked into [St. Neots]49-st. neots , to have a private conversation with [Dr. Edge]265-dr. edge , and whilst [he]159-will was away [Jane]202-jane told [[her]202-jane mother]716-her mother the story of the lost money . At the end of an hour 's talk , [she]202-jane went out into [the garden]603-the garden , where presently [she]202-jane was found by [[her]202-jane brother]611-her brother , who had walked back at [his]611-her brother utmost pace , and wore a perturbed countenance .

" [You]202-jane have n't told yet ? "[611-her brother] were [his]611-her brother first words , uttered in a breathless undertone .

" Why ? "[202-jane] asked [Jane]202-jane startled .

" [I]611-her brother 'm afraid of the result . [Edge]265-dr. edge says that every sort of agitation must be avoided . "[611-her brother]

" [I]202-jane have told [her]716-her mother , "[202-jane] said [Jane]202-jane , with quiet voice , but anxious look . " [She]716-her mother was grieved on [your]159-will account , but it gave [her]716-her mother no shock . Again and again [she]716-her mother said how glad [she]716-her mother was [you]159-will had let [us]1892-us know the truth . "[202-jane]

" So far then , good . "[611-her brother]

" But [Dr. Edge]265-dr. edge what did [he]611-her brother tell [you]202-jane ? "[202-jane]

" [He]611-her brother said [he]611-her brother had wanted to see [me]611-her brother , and thought of writing . Yes , [he]611-her brother speaks seriously . "[611-her brother]

" And [you]346-his mother could n't trust [me]346-his mother to take [my]346-his mother share of the trouble ? "[346-his mother]

" [Greedy mother]3344-greedy mother ! Perhaps [you]346-his mother were right , [Will]159-will . "[176-warburton]

After the mid - day meal all sat together for an hour or two in [the garden]603-the garden . By [an evening train]1898-an evening train , [Will]159-will returned to [London]18-london . [Jane]202-jane had promised to let [him]159-will have frequent news , and during the ensuing week [she]202-jane wrote twice with very favourable accounts of [[their]1899-we mother]1436-their mother 's condition . A month went by without any disquieting report , then came a letter in [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton 's own hand .

" [[My]202-jane dear]2542-my dear [Will]159-will , "[202-jane] [she]202-jane wrote , " [I]202-jane ca n't keep secrets as long as [you]159-will . This is to inform [you]159-will that a week ago [I]202-jane let [The Haws]597-the haws , on annual tenancy , to [a friend of [Mr. Turnbull]195-mr. turnbull 's , who was looking for [such a house]3354-such a house]3353-a friend of mr. turnbull 's , who was looking for such a house . That [she]202-jane was able to find just what [we]1899-we wanted at a moment 's notice encourages [me]202-jane in thinking that [Providence]257-providence is on [our]1899-we side , or , as [[your]159-will dear father]3356-your dear father used to say , that [the oracle]3357-the oracle has spoken . In a week 's time [I]202-jane hope to send news that [we]1899-we are settled . [You]159-will are forbidden to come here before [our]1899-we departure , but will be invited to [the new home]3358-the new home as soon as possible . The address is "[202-jane] etc .

The same post brought a letter from [Jane]202-jane .

" Do n't be alarmed by the news , "[202-jane] [she]202-jane wrote . " [Mother]230-mother has been so firm in this resolve since the day of [your]159-will leaving [us]1899-we , that [I]202-jane could only obey [her]230-mother . Wonderful and delightful to tell , [she]230-mother seems better in health . [I]202-jane dare not make too much of this , after what [Dr. Edge]265-dr. edge said , but for the present [she]230-mother is certainly stronger .
