Do n't worry , and of course do n't on any account come . "[202-jane]

These letters arrived in the evening , and , after reading them , [Warburton]176-warburton was so moved that [he]1901-he had to go out and walk under the starry sky , in [quiet streets]1902-quiet streets . Of course the motive on which [[his]1901-he mother]346-his mother had acted was a desire to free [him]1901-he as soon as possible from the slavery of [the shop]2401-the shop ; but that slavery had now grown so supportable , that [he]1901-he grieved over the sacrifice made for [his]1901-he sake . After all , would [he]1901-he not have done better to live on with [his]1901-he secret ? And yet and yet

CHAPTER 40

With curiosity which had in it a touch of amusement , [Will]159-will was waiting to hear from [Norbert Franks]160-franks . [He]159-will waited for nearly a month , and was beginning to feel rather hurt at [[his]159-will friend]321-his friend 's neglect , perhaps a little uneasy on another score , when there arrived an Italian postcard , stamped [Venice]142-venice . " [We]3359-we have been tempted as far as this , "[176-warburton] ran the hurried scrawl . " Must be [home]354-home in ten days . Shall be delighted to see [you]321-his friend again . "[176-warburton] [Warburton]176-warburton puckered [his]1901-he brows and wondered whether a previous letter or card had failed to reach [him]1901-he . But probably not .

At the end of September , [Franks]160-franks wrote from [his]160-franks [London]18-london address , briefly but cordially , with an invitation to luncheon on the next day , which was Sunday . And [Warburton]176-warburton went .

[He]1901-he was nervous as [he]1901-he knocked at the door ; [he]1901-he was rather more nervous as [he]1901-he walked into [the studio]2461-the studio . "[267-mrs. franks]

"[1912-the painter 's wife]

[Franks]160-franks fidgeted , [his]160-franks head bent over [his]160-franks plate .

" That 's the work of [the great artist]3370-the great artist , "[156-warburton] exclaimed [Warburton]156-warburton , boldly flattering .

" [Humbug]270-humbug ! "[160-franks] growled [Franks]160-franks , but at once [he]160-franks laughed and glanced nervously at [[his]160-franks wife]569-his wife .

In spite of [himself]1928-him , [Will]159-will encountered [her]1929-her look , met the beautiful eyes , felt [their]1930-them smile envelop [him]1928-him . [He]1928-him did not stay much longer . When [he]1928-him took [his]1928-him leave , it would have seemed natural if [Franks]160-franks had come out to walk a little way with [him]1928-him , but [[his]1928-him friend]321-his friend bore [him]1928-him company only to the door .

" Let [us]3384-us see [you]1928-him as often as possible , [old man]2310-old man . [I]321-his friend hope [you]1928-him 'll often come and lunch on Sunday ; nothing could please [us]3384-us better . "[321-his friend]

[Franks]160-franks ' handgrip was very cordial , the look and tone were affectionate , but [Will]159-will said to [himself]159-will that the old intimacy was at an end ; it must now give place to mere acquaintanceship . [He]159-will suspected that [Franks]160-franks was afraid to come out and walk with [him]1928-him , afraid that it might not please [[his]160-franks wife]569-his wife . That [Rosamund]167-rosamund was to rule very sweetly of course , but unmistakably [no one]1074-no one could doubt who saw [the two together]1936-the two together for five minutes . It would be , in all likelihood , a happy subjugation , for [Norbert]160-franks was of anything but a rebellious temper ; [his]160-franks bonds would be of silk ; the rewards of [his]160-franks docility would be such as many [a self - assertive man]1937-a self - assertive man might envy . But when [Warburton]156-warburton tried to imagine [himself]156-warburton in such a position , a choked laugh of humourous disdain heaved [his]156-warburton chest .

[He]156-warburton wandered homewards in a dream . [He]156-warburton relived those moments on [the Embankment at [Chelsea]50-chelsea]1938-the embankment at chelsea , when [his]156-warburton common sense , [his]156-warburton reason , [his]156-warburton true emotions , were defeated by an impulse now scarcely intelligible ; [he]156-warburton saw [himself]156-warburton shot across [Europe]131-europe , like a parcel despatched by express ; and all that fury and rush meaningless as buffoonery at a pantomime ! Yet this was how [the vast majority of [men]2676-men]1939-the vast majority of men " fell in love "[167-rosamund] if ever [they]1939-the vast majority of men did so at all . This was the prelude to marriages innumerable , marriages destined to be dull as ditchwater or sour as verjuice . In love , forsooth ! [Rosamund]167-rosamund at all events knew the value of that , and had saved [him]156-warburton from [his]156-warburton own infatuation . [He]156-warburton owed [her]167-rosamund a lifelong gratitude .

That evening [he]156-warburton re - read a long letter from [Jane]202-jane which had reached [him]156-warburton yesterday . [[His]156-warburton sister]663-his sister gave [him]156-warburton a full description of [the new home in [Suffolk]141-suffolk]1942-the new home in suffolk , and told of the arrangement [she]663-his sister had made with [Miss Winter]266-miss winter , whereby , in a twelvemonth , [she]663-his sister would be able to begin earning a little money , and , if all went well , before long would become self - supporting . Could [he]156-warburton not run down to see [them]1943-them ? [[Their]1943-them mother]1436-their mother had borne the removal remarkably well , and seemed , indeed , to have a new vigour ; possibly the air might suit [her]663-his sister better than at [The Haws]59-the haws . [Will]159-will mused over this , but had no mind to make the journey just yet . It would be a pain to [him]159-will to see [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother in [that new place]1946-that new place ; it would shame [him]159-will to see [[his]156-warburton sister]663-his sister at work , and to think that all this change was on [his]159-will account . So [he]159-will wrote to [mother]2480-mother and [sister]2444-sister , with more of expressed tenderness than usual , begging [them]1943-them to let [him]159-will put off [his]159-will visit yet a few weeks . Presently [they]1943-them would be more settled . But of one thing let [them]1943-them be sure ; [his]159-will daily work was no burden whatever to [him]159-will , and [he]159-will hardly knew whether [he]159-will would care to change it for what was called the greater respectability of labour in [an office]1950-an office . [His]159-will health was good ; [his]159-will spirits could only be disturbed by ill news from those [he]159-will loved . [He]159-will promised that at all events [he]159-will would spend Christmas with [them]1943-them .

[September]271-september went by . One of the Sundays was made memorable by a visit to [Ashtead]32-ashtead . [Will]159-will had requested [Franks]160-franks to relate in that quarter the story of [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha , and immediately after hearing it , [Ralph Pomfret]170-ralph pomfret wrote a warm - hearted letter which made [the recipient]1951-the recipient in [Fulham]272-fulham chuckle with contentment . At [Ashtead]32-ashtead [he]159-will enjoyed [himself]159-will in the old way , gladdened by the pleasure with which [[his]159-will friends]898-his friends talked of [Rosamund]167-rosamund 's marriage . [Mrs. Pomfret]168-mrs. pomfret took an opportunity of speaking to [him]159-will apart , a bright smile on [her]168-mrs. pomfret good face .

" Of course [we]3386-we know who did much , if not everything , to bring it about . [Rosamund]167-rosamund came and told [me]168-mrs. pomfret how beautifully [you]159-will had pleaded [Norbert]160-franks 's cause , and [Norbert]160-franks confided to [[my]168-mrs. pomfret husband]3244-my husband that , but for [you]159-will , [he]160-franks would most likely have married [a girl [he]160-franks really did n't care about at all]3388-a girl he really did n't care about at all . [I]168-mrs. pomfret doubt whether [a mere man]3389-a mere man ever did such a thing so discreetly and successfully before ! "[168-mrs. pomfret]

In October , [Will]159-will began to waver in [his]159-will resolve not to go down into [Suffolk]141-suffolk before Christmas . There came a letter from [[his]159-will mother]346-his mother which deeply moved [him]159-will ; [she]346-his mother spoke of old things as well as new , and declared that in [[her]346-his mother husband]2812-her husband and in [[her]346-his mother children]1955-her children [no woman]2518-no woman had ever known truer happiness . This was at the middle of the week ; [Will]159-will all but made up [his]159-will mind to take an early train on the following Sunday . On Friday [he]159-will wrote to [Jane]202-jane , telling [her]202-jane to expect [him]159-will , and , as [he]159-will walked [home]354-home from [the shop]2401-the shop that evening [he]159-will felt glad that [he]159-will had overcome the feelings which threatened to make this first visit something of a trial to [his]159-will self - respect .

" There 's a telegram a - waiting for [you]159-will , [sir]2259-sir , "[223-mrs. wick] said [Mrs. Wick]223-mrs. wick , as [he]159-will entered .

The telegram contained four words :

" [Mother]230-mother ill . Please come . "[223-mrs. wick]

CHAPTER 41

Happen what might in [the world]364-the world beyond [her]223-mrs. wick doors , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross led the wonted life of domestic discomfort and querulousness . An interval there had been this summer , a brief , uncertain interval , when something like good - temper seemed to struggle with [her]223-mrs. wick familiar mood ; it was the month or two during which [Norbert Franks]160-franks resumed [his]160-franks friendly visitings . Fallen out of [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross 's good graces since [his]160-franks failure to become [[her]223-mrs. wick tenant]1960-her tenant a couple of years ago , [the artist]329-the artist had but to present [himself]160-franks again to be forgiven , and when it grew evident that [he]160-franks came to [the house]450-the house on [Bertha]222-bertha 's account , [he]160-franks rose into higher favour than ever . But this promising state of things abruptly ended . One morning , [Bertha]222-bertha , with a twinkle in [her]223-mrs. wick eyes , announced the fact of [Franks]160-franks ' marriage . [[Her]223-mrs. wick mother]716-her mother was stricken with indignant amaze .

" And [you]222-bertha laugh about it ? "[716-her mother]

" It 's so amusing , "[222-bertha] answered [Bertha]222-bertha .

[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross examined [[her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter .

" [I]174-mrs. cross do n't understand [you]222-bertha , "[174-mrs. cross] [she]174-mrs. cross exclaimed , in a tone of irritation . [The poor lady]1965-the poor lady 's feelings were too much for [her]1965-the poor lady . [She]1965-the poor lady retreated to [[her]1965-the poor lady bedroom]1660-her bedroom , and there passed the greater part of the day . But [she]2296-the girl did not go to [Mr. Jollyman]222-bertha 's , and [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross soon forgot the suggestion .

[Martha]274-martha entered upon [her]274-martha duties , and discharged [them]1988-them with such zeal , such docility , that [[her]274-martha mistress]1989-her mistress never tired of lauding [her]274-martha . [She]2296-the girl was [a young woman of rather odd appearance]1990-a young woman of rather odd appearance ; slim and meagre and red - headed , with a never failing simper on [her]2296-the girl loose lips , and blue eyes that frequently watered ; [she]2296-the girl had somehow an air of lurking gentility in faded youth . Undeniable as were the good qualities [she]2296-the girl put forth on this scene of innumerable domestic failures , [Bertha]222-bertha could not altogether like [her]2296-the girl . Submissive to the point of slavishness , [she]2296-the girl had at times a look which did not harmonize at all with this demeanour , a something in [her]2296-the girl eyes disagreeably suggestive of mocking insolence . [Bertha]222-bertha particularly noticed this on the day after [Martha]274-martha had received [her]274-martha first wages . Leave having been given [her]274-martha to go out in the afternoon to make some purchases , [she]274-martha was rather late in returning , and [Bertha]222-bertha , meeting [her]274-martha as [she]274-martha entered , asked [her]274-martha to be as quick as possible in getting tea ; whereupon [the domestic]1991-the domestic threw up [her]1991-the domestic head and regarded [the speaker]747-the speaker from under [her]1991-the domestic eyelids with an extraordinary smile ; then with a " Yes , [miss]2526-miss , this minute , [miss]2526-miss "[1991-the domestic] scampered [upstairs]642-upstairs to take [her]1991-the domestic things off . All that evening [her]2296-the girl behaviour was strange . As [she]2296-the girl waited at the supper table [she]2296-the girl seemed to be subduing laughter , and in clearing away [she]2296-the girl for the first time broke a plate ; whereupon [she]2296-the girl burst into tears , and begged forgiveness so long and so wearisomely that [she]2296-the girl had at last to be ordered out of [the room]305-the room .

On the morrow all was well again ; but [Bertha]222-bertha could not help watching that singular countenance , and the more [she]2296-the girl observed , the less [she]2296-the girl liked it .

The more " willing "[2531-a servant] [a servant]2531-a servant the more toil did [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross exact from [her]2296-the girl . When occasions of rebuke or of dispute were lacking , the day would have been long and wearisome for [her]2296-the girl had [she]2296-the girl not ceaselessly plied [the domestic drudge]1996-the domestic drudge with tasks , and narrowly watched [their]1996-the domestic drudge execution . The spectacle of this slave - driving was a constant trial to [Bertha]222-bertha 's nerves ; now and then [she]2296-the girl ventured a mild protest , but only with the result of exciting [[her]2296-the girl mother]716-her mother 's indignation . In [her]2296-the girl mood of growing moral discontent , [Bertha]222-bertha began to ask [herself]222-bertha whether acquiescence in this sordid tyranny was not a culpable weakness , and one day early in the year a wretched day of east - wind when [she]2296-the girl saw [Martha]274-martha perched on an outer window - sill cleaning panes , [she]2296-the girl found the courage to utter resolute disapproval .

" [I]174-mrs. cross do n't understand [you]222-bertha , [Bertha]222-bertha , "[174-mrs. cross] replied [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , the muscles of [her]174-mrs. cross face quivering as they did when [she]174-mrs. cross felt [her]174-mrs. cross dignity outraged . " [[My]174-mrs. cross dear]2542-my dear , if [we]3424-we managed so as to give [the servant]660-the servant no trouble at all , [the house]450-the house would soon be in a pretty state . Be so good as not to interfere . [One]2293-one would think [you]2542-my dear took a pleasure in making [my]174-mrs. cross life miserable "[174-mrs. cross]

Overwhelmed with floods of reproach , [Bertha]222-bertha had either to combat or to retreat . Again [her]477-her daughter nerves failed [her]477-her daughter , and [she]477-her daughter left [the room]305-the room .

At dinner that day there was a roast leg of mutton , and , as [her]477-her daughter habit was , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross carved the portion which [Martha]274-martha was to take away for [herself]274-martha . One very small and very thin slice , together with one unwholesome little potato , represented [the servant]660-the servant 's meal . As soon as the door had closed , [Bertha]222-bertha spoke in an ominously quiet voice .

" [Mother]2480-mother , this wo n't do . [I]222-bertha am very sorry to annoy [you]2480-mother , but if [you]2480-mother call that a dinner for [a girl who works hard ten or twelve hours a day]3432-a girl who works hard ten or twelve hours a day , [I]222-bertha do n't . How [she]3432-a girl who works hard ten or twelve hours a day supports life , [I]222-bertha ca n't understand . [You]2480-mother have only to look into [her]3432-a girl who works hard ten or twelve hours a day face to see [she]3432-a girl who works hard ten or twelve hours a day 's starving . [I]222-bertha can bear the sight of it no longer . "[222-bertha]

This time [she]477-her daughter held firm . The conflict lasted for half an hour , during which [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross twice threatened to faint . Neither of [them]2001-them ate anything , and in the end [Bertha]222-bertha saw [herself]222-bertha , if not defeated , at all events no better off than at the beginning , for [[her]477-her daughter mother]716-her mother clung fiercely to authority , and would obviously live in perpetual strife rather than yield an inch . For the next two days domestic life was very unpleasant indeed ; [mother]2480-mother and [daughter]678-daughter exchanged few words ; meanwhile [Martha]274-martha was tasked , if possible , more vigorously than ever , and fed mysteriously , meals no longer doled out to [her]274-martha under [Bertha]222-bertha 's eyes . The third morning brought another crisis .

" [I]222-bertha have a letter from [Emily]275-emily , "[222-bertha] said [Bertha]222-bertha at breakfast , naming [a friend of [hers]222-bertha who lived in [the far north of [London]18-london]2006-the far north of london]2005-a friend of hers who lived in the far north of london . " [I]222-bertha 'm going to see [her]275-emily to - day . "[222-bertha]

" Very well , "[174-mrs. cross] answered [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , between rigid lips .

" [She]275-emily says that in [the house where [she]275-emily lives]3433-the house where she lives , there 's [a bed - sitting - room]3434-a bed - sitting - room to let . [I]222-bertha think , [mother]2480-mother , it might be better for [me]222-bertha to take it . "[222-bertha]

CHAPTER 42

On the evening before , [Martha]274-martha had received [her]274-martha month 's wages , and had been promised the usual afternoon of liberty to - day ; but , as soon as [Bertha]222-bertha had left [the house]450-the house , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross summoned [the domestic]1991-the domestic , and informed [her]1991-the domestic bluntly that the holiday must be postponed .

" [I]274-martha 'm very sorry , [mum]3436-mum , "[274-martha] replied [Martha]274-martha , with an odd , half - frightened look in [her]274-martha watery eyes . " [I]274-martha 'd promised to go and see [[my]274-martha brother]3437-my brother as has just lost [[his]3437-my brother wife]569-his wife ; but of course , if it is n't convenient , [mum]3436-mum "[274-martha]

" It really is not , [Martha]274-martha . [Miss Bertha]183-bertha will be out all day , and [I]174-mrs. cross do n't like being left alone [You]274-martha shall go to - morrow instead . "[174-mrs. cross]

Half an hour later , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross went out shopping , and was away till noon . On returning , [she]174-mrs. cross found [the house]450-the house full of the odour of something burnt .

" What 's this smell , [Martha]274-martha ? "[174-mrs. cross] [she]174-mrs. cross asked at the kitchen door , " what is burning ? "[174-mrs. cross]

" Oh , it 's only a dishcloth as was drying and caught fire , [mum]3436-mum , "[660-the servant] answered [the servant]660-the servant .

" Only ! What do [you]174-mrs. cross mean ? "[2011-the mistress] cried [the mistress]2011-the mistress , angrily . " Do [you]174-mrs. cross wish to burn [the house]450-the house down ? "[2011-the mistress]

[Martha]274-martha stood with [her]274-martha arms akimbo , on [her]274-martha thin , dough - pale face the most insolent of grins , [her]274-martha teeth gleaming , and [her]274-martha eyes wide .

" What do [you]174-mrs. cross mean ? "[174-mrs. cross] cried [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross . " Show [me]174-mrs. cross the burnt cloth at once . "[174-mrs. cross]

" There [you]274-martha are , [mum]3436-mum ! "[274-martha]

And [Martha]274-martha , with a kick , pointed to something on the floor . Amazed and wrathful , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross saw a long roller - towel , half a yard of it burnt to tinder ; nor could any satisfactory explanation of the accident be drawn from [Martha]274-martha , who laughed , sobbed , and sniggered by turns as if [she]274-martha were demented .

" Of course [you]274-martha will pay for it , "[174-mrs. cross] exclaimed [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross for the twentieth time . " Go on with [your]274-martha work at once , and do n't let [me]174-mrs. cross have any more of this extraordinary behaviour . [I]174-mrs. cross ca n't think what has come to [you]274-martha . "[174-mrs. cross]

But [Martha]274-martha seemed incapable of resuming [her]274-martha ordinary calm . Whilst serving the one o'clock dinner which was very badly cooked [she]274-martha wept and sighed , and when [[her]274-martha mistress]1989-her mistress had risen from the table , [she]274-martha stood for a long time staring vacantly before [she]274-martha could bestir [herself]274-martha to clear away . About three o'clock , having several times vainly rung the sitting - room bell , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross went to [the kitchen]2013-the kitchen . The door was shut , and , on trying to open it , [she]174-mrs. cross found it locked . [She]174-mrs. cross called " [Martha]274-martha , "[174-mrs. cross] again and again , and had no reply , until , all of a sudden , a shrill voice cried from within " Go away ! Go away ! "[174-mrs. cross] Beside [herself]174-mrs. cross with wrath and amazement , [the mistress]2011-the mistress demanded admission answer , there came a violent thumping on the door at the other side , and again the voice screamed " Go away ! Go away ! "[2015-the voice]

" What 's the matter with [you]274-martha , [Martha]274-martha ? "[174-mrs. cross] asked [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , beginning to feel alarmed .

" Go away ! "[2015-the voice] replied [the voice]2015-the voice fiercely .

" Either [you]274-martha open the door this moment , or [I]2015-the voice call [a policeman]3443-a policeman . "[2015-the voice]

This threat had an immediate effect , though not quite of the kind that [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross hoped . The key turned with a snap , the door was flung open , and there stood [Martha]274-martha , in a Corybantic attitude , brandishing a dinner - plate in one hand , a poker in the other ; [her]274-martha hair was dishevelled , [her]274-martha face red , and fury blazed in [her]274-martha eyes .

" [You]274-martha wo n't go away ? "[174-mrs. cross] [she]174-mrs. cross screamed " There , then there goes one of [your]274-martha plates ! "[174-mrs. cross]

[She]174-mrs. cross dashed it to the floor .

" [You]274-martha wo n't go away ? There goes one of [you]274-martha dishes ! and there goes a basin ! And there goes a tea - cup ! "[174-mrs. cross]

One after another , the things [she]174-mrs. cross named perished upon the floor . [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross stood paralysed , horror - stricken .

" [You]274-martha think [you]274-martha 'll make [me]274-martha pay for them ? "[274-martha] cried [Martha]274-martha frantically . " Not [me]174-mrs. cross not [me]174-mrs. cross ! [It]3444-it 's [you]274-martha as owes [me]174-mrs. cross money money for all the work [I]174-mrs. cross 've done as was n't in [my]174-mrs. cross wages , and for the food as [I]174-mrs. cross have n't had , when [I]174-mrs. cross 'd ought to . What do [you]274-martha call that ? "[174-mrs. cross] [She]174-mrs. cross pointed to a plate of something on the kitchen table . " Is that a dinner for [a human being]3445-a human being , or is it a dinner for a beetle ? [D'you]274-martha think [I]174-mrs. cross 'd eat it , and [me]174-mrs. cross with money in [my]174-mrs. cross pocket to buy better ? And here goes a sugar - basin ! And here goes [your]274-martha teapot ! "[174-mrs. cross]

With a shriek of dismay , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross sprang forward . [She]174-mrs. cross was too late to save the cherished object , and [her]174-mrs. cross aggressive movement excited [Martha]274-martha to yet more alarming behaviour .

" [You]274-martha 'd hit [me]2016-me , would [you]274-martha ? [Two]3446-two can play at that game [you]274-martha old skinflint , [you]274-martha ! [She]2016-me brandished the poker so menacingly that [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross turned and fled . [Martha]274-martha pursued , yelling abuse and threats . [The mistress]2011-the mistress vainly tried to shut the sitting - room door against [her]274-martha ; in broke [the furious maid]2018-the furious maid , and for a moment so handled [her]2016-me weapon that [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross with difficulty escaped a dangerous blow . Round and round the table [they]2019-they went , until , the cloth having been dragged off , [Martha]274-martha 's feet caught in it , and [she]274-martha fell heavily to the floor . To escape from [the room]305-the room , [the terrified lady]2021-the terrified lady must have stepped over [her]274-martha . For a moment there was silence . Then [Martha]274-martha made an attempt to rise , fell again , again struggled to [her]274-martha knees , and finally collapsed , lying quite still and mute .

Trembling , panting , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross moved cautiously nearer , until [she]174-mrs. cross could see [the girl]2296-the girl 's face . [Martha]274-martha was asleep , unmistakably asleep ; [she]274-martha had even begun to snore . This way and that [she]174-mrs. cross looked along [the streets]398-the streets , searching for [a policeman]3443-a policeman , but none was in sight . CHAPTER 43

[[Warburton]156-warburton 's mother]2062-warburton 's mother was dead . The first effect upon [him]156-warburton of the certainty that [she]2062-warburton 's mother could not recover from the unconsciousness in which [he]156-warburton found [her]2062-warburton 's mother when summoned by [Jane]202-jane 's telegram , was that of an acute remorse ; it pierced [him]156-warburton to the heart that [she]2062-warburton 's mother should have abandoned [the home of [her]2062-warburton 's mother life]2063-the home of her life - time , for the strangeness and discomfort of [the new abode]2064-the new abode , and here have fallen , stricken by death the cause of it , [he]156-warburton [himself]156-warburton , [he]156-warburton so unworthy of the least sacrifice . [He]156-warburton had loved [her]2062-warburton 's mother ; but what assurance had [he]156-warburton been wo nt to give [her]2062-warburton 's mother of [his]156-warburton love ? Through many and many a year it was much if [he]156-warburton wrote at long intervals a hurried letter . How seldom had [he]156-warburton cared to go down to [St. Neots]49-st. neots , and , when there , how soon had [he]156-warburton felt impatient of the little restraints imposed upon [him]156-warburton by [[his]156-warburton mother]346-his mother 's ways and prejudices . Yet not a moment had [she]2062-warburton 's mother hesitated , ill and aged , when , at so great a cost to [herself]2062-warburton 's mother , it seemed possible to make life a little easier for [him]156-warburton . This reproach was the keenest pain with which nature had yet visited [him]156-warburton .

Something of the same was felt by [[his]156-warburton sister]663-his sister , partly on [her]663-his sister own , partly on [his]156-warburton account , but as soon as [Jane]202-jane became aware of [his]156-warburton self torment , [her]202-jane affection and [her]202-jane good sense soon brought succour to [them]2067-their both . [She]202-jane spoke of the life [[their]2067-their mother]1436-their mother had led since coming into [Suffolk]141-suffolk , related a hundred instances to prove how full of interest and contentment it had been , bore witness to the seeming improvement of health , and the even cheerfulness of spirits which had accompanied it . Moreover , there was the medical assurance that life could not in any case have been prolonged ; that change of place and habits counted for nothing in the sudden end which some months ago had been foretold . [Jane]202-jane confessed [herself]202-jane surprised at the ease with which so great and sudden a change was borne ; the best proof that could have been given of [[their]2067-their mother]1436-their mother 's nobleness of mind . Once only had [Mrs. Warburton]176-warburton seemed to think regretfully of [the old home]2070-the old home ; it was on coming out of [church]2915-church one morning , when , having stood for a moment to look at [the graveyard]2072-the graveyard , [she]176-warburton murmured to [[her]176-warburton daughter]477-her daughter that [she]176-warburton would wish to be buried at [St. Neots]49-st. neots . This , of course , was done ; it would have been done even had [she]176-warburton not spoken . And when , on the day after the funeral , [brother]605-brother and [sister]2444-sister parted to go [their]2067-their several ways , the sadness [they]2067-their bore with [them]2067-their had no embitterment of brooding regret . A little graver than usual , [Will]159-will took [his]159-will place behind the counter , with no word to [Allchin]161-allchin concerning the cause of [his]159-will absence . [He]159-will wrote frequently to [Jane]202-jane , and from [her]202-jane received long letters , which did [him]159-will good , so redolent were [they]2076-they of the garden life , even in mid - winter , and so expressive of a frank , sweet , strong womanhood , like that of [her]202-jane who was no more .

Meanwhile [his]159-will business flourished . Not that [he]159-will much exerted [himself]159-will , or greatly rejoiced to see [his]159-will till more heavily laden night after night , by natural accretion custom flowed to [the shop in [fuller stream]2078-fuller stream]2077-the shop in fuller stream ; [Jollyman]2757-jollyman 's had established a reputation for quality and cheapness , and began seriously to affect the trade of [small rivals in [the district]2081-the district]2080-small rivals in the district . As [Allchin]161-allchin had foretold , [the hapless grocer with [the drunken wife]2083-the drunken wife]2082-the hapless grocer with the drunken wife sank defeated before the end of the year ; one morning [[his]159-will shop]1039-his shop did not open , and in a few days the furniture of [the house]450-the house was carried off by [some brisk creditor]2086-some brisk creditor . It made [Warburton]176-warburton miserable to think of [the man]2363-the man 's doom ; when [Allchin]161-allchin , frank barbarian as [he]2363-the man was , loudly exulted . [Will]159-will turned away in shame and anger . Had the thing been practicable [he]159-will would have given money out of [his]159-will own pocket to [the ruined struggler]2088-the ruined struggler . [He]159-will saw [himself]159-will as [a merciless victor]2089-a merciless victor ; [he]159-will seemed to have [his]159-will heel on [the other man]862-the other man 's head , and to crush , crush

At [Christmas]273-christmas [he]159-will was obliged to engage [a second assistant]2091-a second assistant . [Allchin]161-allchin did not conceal [his]159-will dislike of this step , but [he]159-will ended by admitting it to be necessary . At first , the new state of things did not work quite smoothly ; [Allchin]161-allchin was inclined to an imperious manner , which [the newcomer]2092-the newcomer , by name [Goff]276-goff , now and then plainly resented . But in a day or two [they]2093-they were on fair terms , and ere long [they]2093-they became cordial .

Then befell the incident of [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross ' Martha .

Not without uneasiness had [Warburton]176-warburton suggested [a servant]2531-a servant on the recommendation of [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper , but credentials seemed to be fairly good , and when , after a week or two , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross declared [herself]174-mrs. cross more than satisfied , [he]159-will blessed [his]159-will good luck . Long ago [he]159-will had ceased to look for the reappearance at [the shop of [Bertha Cross]183-bertha]2095-the shop of bertha cross ; [he]159-will thought of [the girl]2296-the girl now and then , generally reverting in memory to that day when [he]159-will had followed [her]2296-the girl and [[her]2296-the girl mother]716-her mother into [Kew Gardens]98-kew gardens a recollection which had lost all painfulness , and shone idyllically in summer sunlight , but it mattered nothing to [him]159-will that [Bertha]183-bertha showed [herself]183-bertha no more . Of course [she]183-bertha knew [his]159-will story from [Rosamund]167-rosamund , and in all likelihood [she]183-bertha felt [her]183-bertha self - respect concerned in holding aloof from [an acquaintance of [his]159-will ambiguous standing]2098-an acquaintance of his ambiguous standing . It mattered not a jot .

Yet when the tragi - comedy of [Martha]274-martha 's outbreak unexpectedly introduced [him]159-will to [the house at [Walham Green]60-walham green]1539-the house at walham green , [he]159-will experienced a sudden revival of the emotions of a year ago . After [his]159-will brief meeting with [Bertha]183-bertha , [he]159-will did not go straight back to [the shop]2401-the shop , but wandered a little in quiet by - ways , thinking hard and smiling . Nothing more grotesque than the picture of [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross amid [her]174-mrs. cross shattered crockery , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross pointing to the prostrate [Martha]274-martha , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross panting forth the chronicle of [her]174-mrs. cross woes ; but [[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross ' daughter]2101-mrs. cross ' daughter was not involved in this scene of pantomime ; [she]2101-mrs. cross ' daughter walked across the stage , but independently , with a simple dignity , proof against paltry or ludicrous circumstance . If [any one]2536-any one could see the laughable side of [such domestic squalor]2103-such domestic squalor , assuredly it was [Bertha]183-bertha [herself]183-bertha of that [Will]159-will felt assured . Did [he]159-will not remember [her]183-bertha smile when [she]183-bertha had to discuss prices and qualities in [the shop]2401-the shop ? [Not many girls]2105-not many girls smile with so much implication of humorous comment .

[He]159-will had promised to look out for [another servant]3475-another servant , but hardly knew how to go to work . First of all , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper was summoned to an interview in [the parlour behind [the shop]2401-the shop]2107-the parlour behind the shop , and [Martha]274-martha 's case was fully discussed . With much protesting and circumlocution , [Mrs. Hopper]158-mrs. hopper brought [herself]158-mrs. hopper at length to own that [Martha]274-martha had been known to " take too much , "[158-mrs. hopper] but that was so long ago , and [the girl]2296-the girl had solemnly declared , etc . , etc . "[174-mrs. cross]

Over [his]159-will coffee and egg , [Will]159-will pondered this invitation . It pleased [him]159-will , undeniably , but caused [him]159-will no undue excitement . [He]159-will would have liked to know in what degree [[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross ' daughter]2101-mrs. cross ' daughter was [a consenting party to the step]2120-a consenting party to the step . Before going to business , [he]159-will wrote a brief acceptance . During the day , a doubt now and then troubled [him]159-will as to whether [he]159-will had behaved discreetly , but on the whole [he]159-will looked forward to Sunday with pleasant expectation .

How should [he]159-will equip [himself]159-will ? Should [he]159-will go dressed as [he]159-will would have gone to [the Pomfrets ']165-the pomfrets , in [his]159-will easy walking attire , jacket and soft - felt ? [His]159-will cylinder seemed to be about three feet high ; [his]159-will gloves stared their newness ; the tails of [his]159-will coat felt as though they wrapped several times round [his]159-will legs , and still left enough to trail upon the floor as [he]159-will sat on a chair too low for [him]159-will . "[183-bertha] And [he]159-will had a conviction that [Bertha Cross]183-bertha was laughing at [him]159-will . [Her]183-bertha smile was too persistent ; it could only be explained as a compromise with threatening merriment .

CHAPTER 44

It was on this same evening that [Warburton]156-warburton had a visit from [Godfrey Sherwood]177-sherwood . It was a letter from [Milligan]245-milligan , who , with many explanations and apologies , wrote to inform [[his]245-milligan secretary]2137-his secretary that the Great Work could not be pursued , that [the vegetarian colony in [Ireland]91-ireland]2138-the vegetarian colony in ireland , which was to civilise [the world]364-the world , must so far as [he]245-milligan was concerned remain a glorious dream . " [He]245-milligan encloses a very liberal cheque , "[177-sherwood] said [Godfrey]177-sherwood . " But what a downfall ! [I]177-sherwood foresaw it . CHAPTER 45

When [Bertha]183-bertha , at [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother 's request , undertook the control of [the house]450-the house , [she]183-bertha knew very well what was before [her]183-bertha .

During a whole fortnight , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross faithfully adhered to the compact . For the first time in [her]183-bertha life , [she]183-bertha declared , [she]183-bertha was enjoying peace . Feeling much shaken in [her]183-bertha nervous system , [she]183-bertha rose late , retired early , and , when [downstairs]1725-downstairs , reclined a good deal on the sofa . [She]183-bertha professed [herself]183-bertha unable to remember [the new servant]2158-the new servant 's name , and assumed an air of profound abstraction whenever " what do [you]3544-you call [her]2158-the new servant "[183-bertha] came into [the room]305-the room . Not a question did [she]183-bertha permit [herself]183-bertha as to the details of household management . [Bertha]183-bertha happening incautiously to complain of a certain joint supplied by [the butcher]2160-the butcher , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross turned a dreamy eye upon it , and said , in the tone of [one who speaks of long ago]2161-one who speaks of long ago , " In [my]174-mrs. cross time [he]2160-the butcher could always be depended upon for a small shoulder "[174-mrs. cross] ; then dismissed the matter as in no way concerning [her]183-bertha .

But repose had a restorative effect , and , in the third week , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross felt the revival of [her]174-mrs. cross energies . [She]183-bertha was but fifty - three years old , and in spite of languishing habits , in reality had very fair health . Caring little for books , and not much for [society]2162-society , how was [she]183-bertha to pass [her]183-bertha time if denied the resource of household affairs ? [Bertha]183-bertha observed the signs of coming trouble . One morning , [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother came [downstairs]1725-downstairs earlier than usual , and after fidgeting about [the room]305-the room , where [[her]716-her mother daughter]477-her daughter was busy at [her]477-her daughter drawing - board , suddenly exclaimed :

" [I]716-her mother wish [you]716-her mother would tell [that girl]2371-that girl to make [my]716-her mother bed properly . [I]716-her mother have n't closed [my]716-her mother eyes for three nights , and [I]716-her mother ache from head to foot . The way [she]2371-that girl neglects [[my]716-her mother room]3546-my room is really shameful "[716-her mother]

There followed intimate details , to which [Bertha]183-bertha listened gravely .

" That shall be seen to at once , [mother]2480-mother , "[183-bertha] [she]183-bertha replied , and left [the room]305-the room .

The complaint , as [she]183-bertha suspected , had very little foundation . It was only the beginning ; day after day did [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross grumble about this , that and the other thing , until [Bertha]183-bertha saw that the anticipated moment was at hand . The great struggle arose out of that old point of debate , [the servant]660-the servant 's meals . [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , stealing into [the kitchen]2013-the kitchen , had caught a glimpse of [Sarah]278-sarah 's dinner , and so amazed was [she]174-mrs. cross , so stirred with indignation to the depth of [her]174-mrs. cross soul , that [she]174-mrs. cross cast off all show of respect for [the new order]2170-the new order , and overwhelmed [Bertha]183-bertha with rebukes . [[Her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter listened quietly until the torrent had spent its force , then said with a smile :

" Is this how [you]183-bertha keep [your]183-bertha promise , [mother]2480-mother ? "[174-mrs. cross]

" Promise ? Did [I]174-mrs. cross promise to look on at wicked waste ? Do [you]2480-mother want to bring [us]3549-us to [the workhouse]2862-the workhouse , [child]685-child ? "[174-mrs. cross]

" Do n't let [us]3549-us waste time in talking about what [we]3549-us settled a month ago , "[183-bertha] replied [Bertha]183-bertha decisively . " [Sarah]278-sarah is doing very well , and there must be no change . [I]183-bertha am quite content to pay [her]278-sarah wages [myself]183-bertha . Keep [your]2480-mother promise , [mother]2480-mother , and let [us]3549-us live quietly and decently . "[183-bertha]

" If [you]183-bertha call it living decently to pamper [a servant]2531-a servant until [she]2531-a servant bursts with insolence "[174-mrs. cross]

" When was [Sarah]278-sarah insolent to [you]183-bertha ? [She]278-sarah has never been disrespectful to [me]183-bertha . Quite the contrary , [I]183-bertha think [her]278-sarah [a very good servant]3554-a very good servant indeed . [You]183-bertha know that [I]183-bertha have a good deal of work to do just now , and to speak quite plainly [I]183-bertha ca n't let [you]183-bertha upset the orderly life of [the house]450-the house . Be quiet , there 's a dear . [I]183-bertha insist upon it . "[183-bertha]

Speaking thus , [Bertha]183-bertha laid [her]183-bertha hands on [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother 's shoulders , and looked into the foolish , angry face so steadily , so imperturbably , with such a light of true kindness in [her]183-bertha gentle eyes , yet at the same time such resolution about the well - drawn lips that [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross had no choice but to submit . Grumbling [she]183-bertha turned ; sullenly [she]183-bertha held [her]183-bertha tongue for the rest of the day ; but [Bertha]183-bertha , at all events for a time , had conquered .

[The Crosses]184-the crosses knew little and saw less of [their]184-the crosses kith and kin . With [[[her]174-mrs. cross husband]2812-her husband 's family]2174-her husband 's family , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross had naturally been on cold terms from an early period of [her]174-mrs. cross married life ; [she]174-mrs. cross held no communication with any of the name , and always gave [Bertha]183-bertha to understand that , in one way or another , [the paternal uncles]2175-the paternal uncles and [aunts]2176-aunts had " behaved very badly . "[174-mrs. cross] Of [her]174-mrs. cross own blood , [she]174-mrs. cross had only [a brother ten years younger than [herself]174-mrs. cross , who was [an estate agent at [Worcester]153-worcester]2178-an estate agent at worcester]2177-a brother ten years younger than herself , who was an estate agent at worcester . Some seven years had elapsed since [their]2179-their last meeting , on which occasion [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross had a little difference of opinion with [[her]174-mrs. cross sister - in - law]2180-her sister - in - law . [James Rawlings]283-james rawlings was now [a widower]2181-a widower , with [three children]2182-three children , and during the past year or two not unfriendly letters had been exchanged between [Worcester]153-worcester and [Walham Green]60-walham green . Utterly at a loss for a means of passing [her]174-mrs. cross time , [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross , in these days of domestic suppression , renewed the correspondence , and was surprised by an invitation to pass a few days at [[[her]174-mrs. cross brother]611-her brother 's house]2184-her brother 's house . This [she]174-mrs. cross made known to [Bertha]183-bertha about a week after the decisive struggle .

" Of course , [you]183-bertha are invited , too , but [I]174-mrs. cross 'm afraid [you]183-bertha are too busy ? "[174-mrs. cross]

Amused by [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother 's obvious wish to go to [Worcester]153-worcester unaccompanied , [Bertha]183-bertha answered that [she]183-bertha really did n't see how [she]183-bertha was to spare the time just now .

" But [I]183-bertha do n't like to leave [you]183-bertha alone here "[183-bertha]

[[Her]174-mrs. cross daughter]477-her daughter laughed at this scruple . [She]477-her daughter was just as glad of the prospect of a week 's solitude as [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother in the thought of temporary escape from the proximity of pampered [Sarah]278-sarah . The matter was soon arranged , and [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross left [home]354-home .

This was a Friday . The next day , sunshine and freedom putting [her]183-bertha in holiday mood , [Bertha]183-bertha escaped into [the country]2354-the country , and had a long ramble like that , a year ago , on which [she]183-bertha had encountered [Norbert Franks]160-franks . Sunday morning [she]183-bertha spent quietly at [home]354-home . For the afternoon [she]183-bertha had invited [a girl friend]2191-a girl friend . About five o'clock , as [they]2192-they were having tea , [Bertha]183-bertha heard a knock at the front door . Conversation of a rather artificial kind went on for half an hour , then [Miss Medwin]284-miss medwin jumped up and said [she]284-miss medwin must go . [Bertha]183-bertha protested , but [[her]183-bertha friend]474-her friend alleged the necessity of making another call , and took leave .

"[2203-his]

[You]183-bertha know [I]156-warburton began shopkeeping as if [I]156-warburton were ashamed of [myself]156-warburton . [I]156-warburton kept it a dead secret ; hid away from [everybody]2577-everybody ; told elaborate lies to [[my]156-warburton people]3574-my people ; and the result was what might have been expected before long [I]156-warburton sank into a vile hypochrondria , saw everything black or dirty grey , thought life intolerable . When common sense found out what was the matter with [me]156-warburton , [I]156-warburton resolved to have done with snobbery and lying ; but [a sanguine friend of [mine]156-warburton]3575-a sanguine friend of mine , [the only one in [my]156-warburton confidence]3576-the only one in my confidence , made [me]156-warburton believe that something was going to happen in fact , the recovery of [the lost thousands]3577-the lost thousands ; and [I]156-warburton foolishly held on for a time . [I]156-warburton ca n't say that [I]156-warburton glory in grocerdom ? but the plain fact is that [I]156-warburton see nothing degrading in it , and [I]156-warburton do [my]156-warburton day 's work as a matter of course . Is it any worse to stand behind a counter than to sit in [a counting - house]3579-a counting - house ? Why should retail trade be vulgar , and wholesale quite repeatable ? This is what [I]156-warburton 've come to , as far as [my]156-warburton own thought and feeling go . "[156-warburton]

" Because "[156-warburton]

CHAPTER 46

After [he]2204-he had put the question , the reply to which meant so much to [him]2204-he , [Will]159-will 's eyes , avoiding [Bertha]183-bertha , turned to the window . Though there wanted still a couple of hours to sunset , a sky overcast was already dusking [the little parlour]2121-the little parlour . Distant bells made summons to evening service , and footfalls sounded in [the otherwise silent street]2206-the otherwise silent street .

"[159-will]

[Bertha]183-bertha seemed on the point of laughing ; but [she]183-bertha drew in [her]183-bertha breath , composed [her]183-bertha features , let [her]183-bertha eyes wander to a picture on the wall .

" Can [you]183-bertha believe that ? "[159-will] [Will]159-will asked , [his]159-will voice quivering with earnestness , as [he]159-will bent forward to [her]183-bertha .

" [I]159-will should have to think about it , "[159-will] was the answer , calm , friendly .

" The fit of madness from which [I]159-will suffered is very common in [men]2676-men . Often it has serious results . No end of marriages come about in that way . Happily [I]159-will was in no danger of that . [I]159-will simply made [a most colossal fool]3605-a most colossal fool of [myself]159-will . And all the time all the time , [I]159-will tell [you]183-bertha , believe it or not , as [you]183-bertha will or can [I]159-will was in love with [you]183-bertha . "[159-will]

Again [Bertha]183-bertha drew in [her]183-bertha breath , more softly than before .

" [I]183-bertha went one day from [St. Jean de Luz]227-st. jean de luz over [the border into [Spain]132-spain]3606-the border into spain , and came to [[a village]2358-a village among [the mountains]306-the mountains]3608-a village among the mountains , called [Vera]259-vera . [Will]159-will paused a moment , then asked in a shamefaced way :

[Bertha]183-bertha moved [her]183-bertha head as if to reply , but after all , kept silence . [Thereupon Warburton]285-warburton stood up and clutched [his]2209-he hat .

[He]2209-he slept well ; [he]2209-he arose in a cheerful but still dreamy , mood ; and without a thought of reluctance [he]2209-he went to [his]2209-he day 's work .

[Warburton]285-warburton turned to [his]285-warburton correspondence .

[He]285-warburton sat down and kept a short silence , whilst [the girl]2296-the girl resumed [her]2296-the girl pencil .

" There were things [I]159-will ought to have told [you]183-bertha on Sunday . "[159-will] [Will]159-will 's voice threatened huskiness . " Things [I]159-will forgot . How can [you]183-bertha know [my]159-will character [my]159-will peculiarities faults ? [I]159-will 've been going over all that . [I]159-will do n't think [I]159-will 'm ill - tempered , or unjust or violent , but there are things that irritate [me]159-will . Unpunctuality for instance . Then ah yes ! restraint is intolerable to [me]159-will . [I]159-will must come and go at [my]159-will own will . [I]159-will must do and refrain just as [I]159-will think fit . One enormous advantage of [[my]159-will shopkeeping]3624-my shopkeeping is that [I]159-will 'm [[my]159-will own master]2332-my own master . [I]159-will ca n't subordinate [myself]159-will , wo n't be ruled . Fault - finding would exasperate [me]159-will ; dictation would madden [me]159-will . Then yes , the money matter . [I]159-will 'm not extravagant , but [I]159-will hate parsimony . If it pleases [me]159-will to give away a sovereign [I]159-will must be free to do it . Then yes , [I]159-will 'm not very tidy in [my]159-will habits ; [I]159-will have no respect for furniture ; [I]159-will like , when it 's comfortable , to sit with [my]159-will boots on the fender ; and [I]159-will loathe antimacassars . "[159-will]

CHAPTER 47

When [Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross came [home]354-home [she]174-mrs. cross brought with [her]174-mrs. cross a changed countenance . The lines graven by habitual fretfulness and sourness of temper , by long - indulged vices of the feminine will , could not of course be obliterated , but [her]174-mrs. cross complexion had a healthier tone , [her]174-mrs. cross eyes were brighter , and the smile with which [she]174-mrs. cross answered [Bertha]183-bertha 's welcome expressed a more spontaneous kindliness than had appeared on [her]174-mrs. cross face for many a year . [She]174-mrs. cross had recovered , indeed , during [her]174-mrs. cross visit to [the home of [her]174-mrs. cross childhood]2217-the home of her childhood , something of the grace and virtue in which [she]174-mrs. cross was not lacking before [her]174-mrs. cross marriage to [a man who spoilt [her]174-mrs. cross by excess of good nature]2218-a man who spoilt her by excess of good nature . Subject to [a husband firm of will and occasionally rough of tongue]2219-a husband firm of will and occasionally rough of tongue , [she]174-mrs. cross might have led a fairly happy and useful life . It was the perception of this truth which had strengthened [Bertha]183-bertha in [her]183-bertha ultimate revolt . Perhaps , too , it had not been without influence on [her]183-bertha own feeling and behaviour during the past week .

[Mrs. Cross]174-mrs. cross had much to relate . At the tea - table [she]174-mrs. cross told all about [[[her]174-mrs. cross brother]611-her brother 's household]2221-her brother 's household , described [the children]2222-the children , lauded [the cook]2223-the cook and [housemaid]2224-housemaid " Ah , [Bertha]183-bertha , if one could get [such servants]3634-such servants [here]2261-here ! " Perhaps [uncle]3638-uncle thinks of marrying again ? "[183-bertha] said [Bertha]183-bertha .

" Not a bit of it , [[my]716-her mother dear]2542-my dear , "[716-her mother] replied [[her]183-bertha mother]716-her mother eagerly . CHAPTER 48

[Norbert Franks]160-franks was putting the last touches to a portrait of [[his]160-franks wife]569-his wife ; a serious portrait , full length , likely to be regarded as one of [his]160-franks most important works .
